Text

“ A STIFLING hot day ! ”[289-the general] [General Hobson]120-general hobson lifted [his]120-general hobson hat and mopped [his]120-general hobson forehead indignantly . “ What on earth [this place]2649-this place can be like in June [I]121-roger ca n't conceive ! The tenth of April , and [I]121-roger 'll be bound the thermometer 's somewhere near eighty in the shade . [You]288-his uncle never find the English climate playing [you]288-his uncle these tricks . ”[121-roger] [Roger Barnes]121-roger looked at [[his]120-general hobson uncle]288-his uncle with amusement . “ Do n't [you]288-his uncle like heat , [Uncle Archie]122-uncle archie ? Ah , but [I]121-roger forgot , it 's American heat . ”[121-roger] “ [I]289-the general like a climate [you]288-his uncle can depend on , ”[289-the general] said [the General]289-the general , quite conscious that [he]289-the general was talking absurdly , yet none the less determined to talk , by way of relief to some obscure annoyance . “ Here [we]2650-we are sweltering in this abominable heat , and in [New York]1-new york last week [they]2651-they had a blizzard , and here , even , it was cold enough to give [me]289-the general rheumatism . The climate 's always in extremes — like [the people]2652-the people . ”[289-the general] “ [I]290-the young man 'm sorry to find [you]288-his uncle do n't like [the States]2653-the states , [Uncle Archie]122-uncle archie . ”[290-the young man] [The young man]290-the young man sat down beside [[his]290-the young man uncle]288-his uncle . [They]292-they were in [the deck saloon of [a steamer]294-a steamer which had left [Washington]2-washington about an hour before for [Mount Vernon]3-mount vernon]293-the deck saloon of a steamer which had left washington about an hour before for mount vernon . Through the open doorway to [their]292-they left [they]292-they saw [a wide expanse of river]295-a wide expanse of river , flowing between banks of spring green , and above it thunderous clouds , in a hot blue . [The saloon]296-the saloon , and the decks outside , held [a great crowd of passengers]297-a great crowd of passengers , of whom [the majority]298-the majority were [women]299-women . The tone in which [Roger Barnes]121-roger spoke was good - tempered , but quite perfunctory . [Any shrewd observer]300-any shrewd observer would have seen that whether [[his]290-the young man uncle]288-his uncle liked [the States]2653-the states or not did not in truth matter to [him]290-the young man a whit . “ And [I]289-the general consider all the arrangements for this trip most unsatisfactory , ”[289-the general] [the General]289-the general continued angrily . “ [The steamer]2654-the steamer 's too small , [the landing - place]2655-the landing - place is too small , [the crowd]2656-the crowd getting on board was something disgraceful . [They]2656-the crowd 'll have a shocking accident one of these days . And what on earth are [all these women]2657-all these women [here]2658-here for — in the middle of the day ? It 's not a holiday . ”[289-the general] “ [I]121-roger believe it 's a [teachers]2659-teachers ' excursion , ”[121-roger] said [young Barnes]121-roger absently , [his]290-the young man eyes resting on the rows of [young women in white blouses and spring hats who sat in close - packed chairs upon the deck]304-young women in white blouses and spring hats who sat in close - packed chairs upon the deck — [an eager , talkative host]305-an eager , talkative host . “ H'm — [Teachers]2659-teachers ! ”[289-the general] [The General]289-the general 's tone was still more pugnacious . “ Going to learn more lies about [us]2661-us , [I]289-the general suppose , that [they]2656-the crowd may teach [them]2656-the crowd to [school - children]2662-school - children ? [I]289-the general was turning over some of [their]2656-the crowd school - books in [a shop]2663-a shop yesterday . Perfectly abominable ! It 's monstrous what [they]2656-the crowd teach [the children]2664-the children [here]2658-here about what [they]2656-the crowd 're pleased to call [[their]2656-the crowd War of Independence]2666-their war of independence . All that [we]2661-us did was to ask [them]2656-the crowd to pay something for [their]2656-the crowd own protection . What did it matter to [us]2661-us whether [they]2656-the crowd were mopped up by [the Indians]123-the indians , or [the French]124-french , or not ? ‘ But if [you]2667-you want [us]2661-us to go to all the expense and trouble of protecting [you]2667-you , and putting down [those fellows]2668-those fellows , why , hang it , ’ [we]2661-us said , ‘ [you]2667-you must pay some of the bill ! ’ That was all [English Ministers]125-the english asked ; and perfectly right too . And as for [the men [they]2656-the crowd make such a fuss about]2669-the men they make such a fuss about , [Samuel Adams]126-samuel adams , and [John Adams]127-john adams , and [Franklin]128-franklin , and [all the rest of [the crew]2671-the crew]2670-all the rest of the crew , [I]289-the general tell [you]2667-you , the stuff [they]2656-the crowd teach [American school - children]2672-american school - children about [them]2656-the crowd is a poisoning of the wells ! [Franklin]128-franklin was [a man of profligate life]2673-a man of profligate life , whom [I]289-the general would never have admitted inside [my]289-the general doors ! And as for [the Adamses]129-the adamses — intriguers — [canting fellows!—both of [them]129-the adamses]2674-canting fellows!—both of them . ”[289-the general] “ Well , at least [you]121-roger 'll give [them]129-the adamses [George Washington]130-washington . ”[307-he] As [he]307-he spoke , [Barnes]121-roger concealed a yawn , followed immediately afterwards by a look of greater alertness , caused by the discovery that [a girl]308-a girl sitting not far from the doorway in [the crowd outside]309-the crowd outside was certainly pretty . [The red - faced , white - haired General]310-the red - faced , white - haired general paused a moment before replying , then broke out : “ What [George Washington]130-washington might have been if [he]130-washington had held a straight course [I]310-the red - faced , white - haired general am not prepared to say . As it is , [I]310-the red - faced , white - haired general do n't hesitate for a moment ! [George Washington]130-washington was nothing more nor less than [a rebel]2675-a rebel — [a damned rebel]2676-a damned rebel ! And what [Englishmen]131-englishmen mean by joining in the worship of [him]130-washington [I]310-the red - faced , white - haired general 've never been able to understand . ”[310-the red - faced , white - haired general] “ [I]290-the young man say , [uncle]2677-uncle , take care , ”[290-the young man] said [the young man]290-the young man , looking round [him]310-the red - faced , white - haired general , and observing with some relief that [they]312-they seemed to have the saloon to [themselves]312-they . “ [These Yankees]2678-these yankees will stand most things , but — ”[290-the young man] “ [You]290-the young man need n't trouble [yourself]290-the young man , [Roger]121-roger , ”[310-the red - faced , white - haired general] was the testy reply ; “ [I]310-the red - faced , white - haired general am not in the habit of annoying [[my]310-the red - faced , white - haired general neighbours]2679-my neighbours . Well now , look here , what [I]310-the red - faced , white - haired general want to know is , what is the meaning of this absurd journey of [yours]290-the young man ? ”[310-the red - faced , white - haired general] [The young man]290-the young man 's frown increased . [He]290-the young man began to poke the floor with [his]290-the young man stick . “ [I]290-the young man do n't know why [you]314-the other call it absurd ? ”[290-the young man] “ To [me]314-the other it seems both absurd and extravagant , ”[314-the other] said [the other]314-the other with emphasis . “ The last thing [I]314-the other heard of [you]290-the young man was that [Burdon]132-burdon and [Co.]133-co. had offered [you]290-the young man a place in [[their]2680-their office]2681-their office , and that [you]290-the young man were prepared to take it . When [a man]2682-a man has lost [his]2682-a man money and becomes dependent upon [others]2683-others , the sooner [he]2682-a man gets to work the better . ”[314-the other] [Roger Barnes]121-roger reddened under the onslaught , and the sulky expression of [his]290-the young man handsome mouth became more pronounced . “ [I]290-the young man think [[my]290-the young man mother]2684-my mother and [I]290-the young man ought to be left to judge for [ourselves]2685-ourselves , ”[290-the young man] [he]290-the young man said rather hotly . “ [We]2685-ourselves have n't asked [anybody]2686-anybody for money yet , [Uncle Archie]122-uncle archie . [Burdon]132-burdon and [Co.]133-co. can have [me]290-the young man in [September]4-september just as well as now ; and [[my]290-the young man mother]2684-my mother wished [me]290-the young man to make [some friends over here who might be useful to [me]290-the young man]2688-some friends over here who might be useful to me . ”[290-the young man] “ Useful to [you]290-the young man . How ? ”[314-the other] “ [I]289-the general think that 's [my]289-the general affair . In [this country]2689-this country there are always openings — things turning up — chances — [you]290-the young man ca n't get at [home]2690-home . ”[289-the general] [The General]289-the general gave a disapproving laugh . “ The only chance that 'll help [you]290-the young man , [Roger]121-roger , at present — excuse [me]289-the general if [I]289-the general speak frankly — is the chance of regular work . [[Your]290-the young man poor mother]2691-your poor mother has nothing but [her]2691-your poor mother small fixed income , and [you]290-the young man have n't a farthing to chuck away on what [you]290-the young man call chances . Why , [your]290-the young man passage by [the Lucania]2692-the lucania alone must have cost a pretty penny . [I]289-the general 'll bet [my]289-the general hat [you]290-the young man came first class . ”[289-the general] [The young man]290-the young man was clearly on the brink of an explosion , but controlled [himself]290-the young man with an effort . “ [I]290-the young man paid the winter rate ; and [mother]2693-mother , who knows [the Cunard people]2694-the cunard people very well , got a reduction . [I]290-the young man assure [you]290-the young man , [Uncle Archie]122-uncle archie , neither [mother]2693-mother nor [I]290-the young man is [a fool]2696-a fool , and [we]2697-we know quite well what [we]2697-we are about . ”[290-the young man] As [he]290-the young man spoke [he]290-the young man raised [himself]290-the young man with energy , and looked [[his]290-the young man companion]317-his companion in the face . [The General]289-the general , surveying [him]290-the young man , was mollified , as usual , by nothing in [the world]319-the world but [the youth]320-the youth 's extraordinary good looks . [Roger Barnes]121-roger 's good looks had been , indeed , from [his]290-the young man childhood upwards the distinguishing and remarkable feature about [him]290-the young man . [He]290-the young man had been [a king among [[his]290-the young man school - fellows]322-his school - fellows]321-a king among his school - fellows largely because of [them]322-his school - fellows , and of the athletic prowess which went with [them]322-his school - fellows ; and while at [Oxford]5-oxford [he]290-the young man had been cast for the part of [Apollo]134-apollo in [The Eumenides]135-the eumenides , [Nature]136-nature having clearly designed [him]290-the young man for it , in spite of the lamentable deficiencies in [his]290-the young man Greek scholarship , which gave [[his]290-the young man prompters]323-his prompters and [trainers]324-trainers so much trouble . Nose , chin , brow , the poising of the head on the shoulders , the large blue eyes , lidded and set with a Greek perfection , the delicacy of the lean , slightly hollow cheeks , combined with the astonishing beauty and strength of the head , crowned with ambrosial curls — these possessions , together with [others]2683-others , had so far made life an easy and triumphant business for [[their]326-their owner]327-their owner . [The “ others]2698-the “ others , ”[2698-the “ others] let it be noted , however , had till now always been present ; and , chief amongst [them]2683-others , great wealth and [an important and popular father]328-an important and popular father . [The father]329-the father was recently dead , as the black band on [the young man]290-the young man 's arm still testified , and the wealth had suddenly vanished , wholly and completely , in one of the financial calamities of the day . [General Hobson]120-general hobson , contemplating [[his]120-general hobson nephew]331-his nephew , and mollified , as [we]332-we have said , by [his]290-the young man splendid appearance , kept saying to [himself]290-the young man : “ [He]290-the young man has n't a farthing but what poor [Laura]137-laura allows [him]290-the young man ; [he]290-the young man has the tastes of forty thousand a year ; a very indifferent education ; and what [the deuce]2699-the deuce is [he]290-the young man going to do ? ”[290-the young man] Aloud [he]290-the young man said : “ Well , all [I]290-the young man know is , [I]290-the young man had a deplorable letter last mail from [[your]290-the young man poor mother]2691-your poor mother . ”[290-the young man] [The young man]290-the young man turned [his]290-the young man head away , [his]290-the young man cigarette still poised at [his]290-the young man lips . “ Yes , [I]290-the young man know — [mother]2693-mother 's awfully down . ”[290-the young man] “ Well , certainly [[your]290-the young man mother]2702-your mother was never meant for [a poor woman]2703-a poor woman , ”[289-the general] said [the General]289-the general , with energy . “ [She]2702-your mother takes it uncommonly hard . ”[289-the general] [Roger]121-roger , with face still averted , showed no inclination to discuss [[his]290-the young man mother]335-his mother 's character on these lines . “ However , [she]2702-your mother 'll get along all right , if [you]290-the young man do [your]290-the young man duty by [her]2702-your mother , ”[289-the general] added [the General]289-the general , not without a certain severity . “ [I]121-roger mean to do it , [sir]2704-sir . ”[121-roger] [Barnes]121-roger rose as [he]289-the general spoke . “ [I]289-the general should think [we]2705-we 're getting near [Mount Vernon]3-mount vernon by this time . [I]289-the general 'll go and look . ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general made [his]289-the general way to [the outer deck]337-the outer deck , [the General]289-the general following . [The old soldier]339-the old soldier , as [he]339-the old soldier moved through [the crowd of chairs in the wake of [[his]339-the old soldier nephew]331-his nephew]340-the crowd of chairs in the wake of his nephew , was well aware of the attention excited by [the young man]290-the young man . The eyes of [many damsels]343-many damsels were upon [him]339-the old soldier ; and , while [the girls]344-the girls looked and said nothing , [[their]344-the girls mothers]345-their mothers laughed and whispered to [each other]346-each other as [the young Apollo]347-the young apollo passed . Standing at the side of [the steamer]2654-the steamer , [the uncle]349-the uncle and [nephew]350-nephew perceived that [the river]351-the river had widened to a still more stately breadth , and that , on the southern bank , [a white building]352-a white building , high placed , had come into view . [The excursionists]353-the excursionists crowded to look , expressing [their]353-the excursionists admiration for the natural scene and [their]353-the excursionists sense of its patriotic meaning in a frank , enthusiastic chatter , which presently enveloped [the General , standing in a silent endurance like a rock among the waves]354-the general , standing in a silent endurance like a rock among the waves . “ Is n't it fine to think of [his]120-general hobson coming back here to die , so simply , when [he]120-general hobson 'd made [a nation]2706-a nation ? ”[355-a young girl] said [a young girl]355-a young girl — perhaps from [Omaha]6-omaha — to [[her]355-a young girl companion]356-her companion . “ Was n't it just lovely ? ”[355-a young girl] [Her]355-a young girl voice , restrained , yet warm with feeling , annoyed [General Hobson]120-general hobson . [He]120-general hobson moved away , and as [they]357-their hung over the taffrail , [he]120-general hobson said with suppressed venom to [[his]120-general hobson companion]317-his companion : “ Much good it did [them]357-their to be ‘ made [a nation]2706-a nation ’ ! Look at [their]357-their press — look at [their]357-their corruption — [their]357-their divorce scandals ! ”[120-general hobson] [Barnes]121-roger laughed , and threw [his]120-general hobson cigarette - end into the swift brown water . “ Upon [my]120-general hobson word , [Uncle Archie]122-uncle archie , [I]120-general hobson ca n't play up to [you]122-uncle archie . As far as [I]120-general hobson 've gone , [I]120-general hobson like [America]7-america and [the Americans]138-the americans . ”[120-general hobson] “ Which means , [I]289-the general suppose , that [[your]122-uncle archie mother]2702-your mother gave [you]122-uncle archie some introductions to [rich people in [New York]1-new york]2709-rich people in new york , and [they]2709-rich people in new york entertained [you]122-uncle archie ? ”[289-the general] said [the General]289-the general drily . “ Well , is there any crime in that ? [I]289-the general met a lot of [uncommonly nice people]2710-uncommonly nice people . ”[289-the general] “ And did n't particularly bless [me]290-the young man when [I]290-the young man wired to [you]289-the general to come here ? ”[290-the young man] [The young man]290-the young man laughed again and paused a moment before replying . “ [I]290-the young man 'm always very glad to come and keep [you]289-the general company , [Uncle Archie]122-uncle archie . ”[290-the young man] [The old General]361-the old general reddened a little . Privately , [he]361-the old general knew very well that [his]361-the old general telegram summoning [young Barnes]121-roger from [New York]1-new york had been an act of tyranny — mild , elderly tyranny . [He]361-the old general was not amusing [himself]361-the old general in [Washington]2-washington , where [he]361-the old general was paying a second visit after an absence of twenty years . [[His]361-the old general English soul]362-his english soul was disturbed and affronted by a wholly new realisation of the strength of [America]7-america , by [the giant forces of [the young nation]364-the young nation]363-the giant forces of the young nation , as [they]363-the giant forces of the young nation are to be felt pulsing in [the Federal City]365-the federal city . [He]361-the old general was up in arms for [the Old World]8-the old world , wondering sorely and secretly what [the New]139-the new might do with [her]8-the old world in the times to come , and foreseeing an ever - increasing deluge of unlovely things — ideals , principles , manners — flowing from this western civilisation , under which [[his]361-the old general own gods]366-his own gods were already half buried , and would soon be hidden beyond recovery . And in this despondency which possessed [him]361-the old general , in spite of the attentions of Embassies , and luncheons at [the White House]9-the white house , [he]361-the old general had heard that [Roger]121-roger was in [New York]1-new york , and could not resist the temptation to send for [him]361-the old general . After all , [Roger]121-roger was [[his]361-the old general heir]367-his heir . Unless [the boy]368-the boy flagrantly misbehaved [himself]368-the boy , [he]368-the boy would inherit [General Hobson]120-general hobson 's money and [small estate in [Northamptonshire]10-northamptonshire]369-small estate in northamptonshire . Before the death of [[Roger]121-roger 's father]370-roger 's father this prospective inheritance , indeed , had not counted for very much in the family calculations . [The General]289-the general had even felt a shyness in alluding to a matter so insignificant in comparison with the general scale on which [the Barnes family]372-the barnes family lived . But since the death of [Barnes père]121-roger , and the complete pecuniary ruin revealed by that event , [Roger]121-roger 's expectations from [[his]368-the boy uncle]288-his uncle had assumed a new importance . [The General]289-the general was quite aware of it . A year before this date [he]289-the general would never have dreamed of summoning [Roger]121-roger to attend [him]289-the general at a moment 's notice . That [he]289-the general had done so , and that [Roger]121-roger had obeyed [him]289-the general , showed how closely even [the family]375-the family relation may depend on pecuniary circumstance . [The steamer]2654-the steamer swung round to [the landing - place under [the hill of [Mount Vernon]3-mount vernon]378-the hill of mount vernon]377-the landing - place under the hill of mount vernon . Again , in disembarkation , there was [a crowd and rush]379-a crowd and rush which set [the General]289-the general 's temper on edge . [He]289-the general emerged from [it]379-a crowd and rush , hot and breathless , after haranguing the functionary at the gates on the inadequacy of the arrangements and the likelihood of an accident . Then [he]289-the general and [Roger]121-roger strode up [the steep path]381-the steep path , beside beds of blue periwinkles , and under old trees just bursting into leaf . A spring sunshine was in the air and on the grass , which had already donned its “ livelier emerald . ”[121-roger] The air quivered with heat , and the blue dome of sky diffused it . Here and there a magnolia in full flower on the green slopes spread its splendour of white or pinkish blossom to the sun ; [the great river]382-the great river , shimmering and streaked with light , swept round [the hill]383-the hill , and out into a pearly distance ; and on the height [the old pillared house with [its]384-the old pillared house with its flanking colonnades flanking colonnades]384-the old pillared house with its flanking colonnades stood under the thinly green trees in a sharp light and shade , which emphasised all its delightful qualities — made , as it were , the most of it , in response to the eagerness of [the crowd now flowing round it]385-the crowd now flowing round it . Half - way up [the hill]383-the hill [Roger]121-roger suddenly raised [his]289-the general hat . “ Who is it ? ”[289-the general] said [the General]289-the general , putting up [his]289-the general eyeglass . “ [The girl [we]2712-we met last night and [[her]388-the lady whom young barnes had greeted brother]2713-her brother]2711-the girl we met last night and her brother . ”[289-the general] “ [Captain Boyson]140-boyson ? [The whole party]398-the whole party walked on up [the hill]383-the hill . [The General]289-the general and [Captain Boyson]140-boyson fell into a discussion of some military news of the morning . Among [the hundreds of young women streaming over [the lawn]404-the lawn]403-the hundreds of young women streaming over the lawn [they]403-the hundreds of young women streaming over the lawn were clearly marked out by [[their]403-the hundreds of young women streaming over the lawn carriage]405-their carriage and [their]403-the hundreds of young women streaming over the lawn clothes — especially [their]403-the hundreds of young women streaming over the lawn clothes — as belonging to [the fastidious cosmopolitan class]406-the fastidious cosmopolitan class , between [whom]407-whom and [the young school - teachers from [the West]12-the west]408-the young school - teachers from the west , in [their]403-the hundreds of young women streaming over the lawn white cotton blouses , leathern belts , and neat short skirts , the links were few . [Miss Floyd]145-daphne , indeed , was dressed with great simplicity . A white muslin dress , à la Romney , with a rose at the waist , and a black - and - white Romney hat deeply shading the face beneath — nothing could have been plainer ; yet it was a simplicity not to be had for the asking , a calculated , a Parisian simplicity ; while [[her]145-daphne companion]356-her companion , [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne , was attired in what the fashion - papers would have called a “ creation in mauve . ”[146-daphne] And [Roger]121-roger knew quite enough about [women]299-women 's dress to be aware that it was a creation that meant dollars . [She]145-daphne was [a tall , dark - eyed , olive - skinned woman]411-a tall , dark - eyed , olive - skinned woman , thin almost to emaciation : and [young Barnes]121-roger noticed that while [Miss Floyd]145-daphne talked much , [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne answered little , and smiled less . [She]146-daphne moved with a languid step , and looked absently about [her]146-daphne . [Roger]121-roger could not make up [his]412-his mind whether [she]145-daphne was American or English . In [the house]413-the house itself [the crowd]2656-the crowd was almost unmanageable . [The General]289-the general 's ire was roused afresh when [he]289-the general was warned off the front door by [the polite official on guard]416-the polite official on guard , and made to mount a back stair in the midst of [a panting multitude]417-a panting multitude . “ [I]289-the general really can not congratulate [you]140-boyson on [your]140-boyson management of these affairs , ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general said severely to [Captain Boyson]140-boyson , as [they]418-they stood at last , breathless and hustled , on the first - floor landing . “ It is most improper , [I]289-the general may say dangerous , to admit such a number at once . Voice and smile were alike engaging . [[Their]434-them owner]327-their owner was not exactly pretty , but [she]327-their owner had very large dark eyes , and a small glowing face , set in a profusion of hair . [Barnes]121-roger observed [the two figures]444-the two figures in front of [them]434-them , and remarked that [Miss Floyd]145-daphne had a “ very — well — a very foreign look . ”[121-roger] “ Not English , [you]289-the general mean?—or American ? [Miss Floyd]145-daphne proposed a seat a little way down [the slope]454-the slope , where [they]453-them might wait the half - hour appointed . That half - hour passed quickly for [all concerned]455-all concerned . In looking back upon it afterwards [two of [the party]422-the party]456-two of the party were conscious that it had all hung upon [one person]458-one person . [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne sat beside [the General]289-the general , who paid [her]145-daphne a half - reluctant , half - fascinated attention . Without any apparent effort on [her]145-daphne part [she]145-daphne became indeed the centre of [the group who sat or lay on the grass]460-the group who sat or lay on the grass . All faces were turned towards [her]145-daphne , and presently [all ears]461-all ears listened for [her]145-daphne remarks . [Her]145-daphne talk was young and vivacious , nothing more . But all [she]145-daphne said came , as it were , steeped in personality , a personality so energetic , so charged with movement and with action that it arrested [the spectators]462-the spectators — not always agreeably . It was like the passage of [a train]463-a train through the darkness , when , for the moment , [the quietest landscape]464-the quietest landscape turns to fire and force . The comparison suggested itself to [Captain Boyson]140-boyson as [he]140-boyson lay watching [her]145-daphne , only to be received with an inward mockery , half bitter , half amused . [This girl]465-this girl was always awakening in [him]140-boyson these violent or desperate images . Was it [her]145-daphne fault that [she]145-daphne possessed those brilliant eyes — eyes , as it seemed , of the typical , essential woman?—and that downy brunette skin , with the tinge in it of damask red?—and that instinctive art of lovely gesture in which [her]145-daphne whole being seemed to express itself ? [Boyson]140-boyson , who was not only [a rising soldier]466-a rising soldier , but [an excellent amateur artist]467-an excellent amateur artist , knew every line of the face by heart . [He]140-boyson had drawn [Miss Daphne]145-daphne from the life on several occasions ; and from memory scores of times . [He]140-boyson was not likely to draw [her]145-daphne from life any more ; and thereby hung a tale . As far as [he]140-boyson was concerned [the train]468-the train had passed — in flame and fury — leaving an echoing silence behind [it]468-the train . What folly ! [He]140-boyson turned resolutely to [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne , and tried to discuss with [her]146-daphne an exhibition of French art recently opened in [Washington]2-washington . In vain . After a few sentences , the talk between [them]469-them dropped , and both [he]140-boyson and [she]146-daphne were once more watching [Miss Floyd]145-daphne , and joining in the conversation whenever [she]146-daphne chose to draw [them]469-them in . As for [Roger Barnes]121-roger , [he]140-boyson too was steadily subjugated — up to a certain point . [He]140-boyson was not sure that [he]140-boyson liked [Miss Floyd]145-daphne , or [her]145-daphne conversation . [She]145-daphne was so much mistress of [herself]145-daphne and of [the company]470-the company , that [his]140-boyson masculine vanity occasionally rebelled . A little flirt!—that gave [herself]145-daphne airs . It startled [his]140-boyson English mind that at twenty — for [she]145-daphne could be no more — [a girl]308-a girl should so take the floor , and hold the stage . Sometimes [he]140-boyson turned [his]140-boyson back upon [her]145-daphne — almost ; and [Cecilia Boyson]147-cecilia boyson held [him]140-boyson . But , if there was too much of the “ eternal womanly ”[145-daphne] in [Miss Floyd]145-daphne , there was not enough in [Cecilia Boyson]147-cecilia boyson . [He]140-boyson began to discover also that [she]145-daphne was too clever for [him]140-boyson , and was in fact talking down to [him]140-boyson . Some of the things that [she]145-daphne said to [him]140-boyson about [New York]1-new york and [Washington]2-washington puzzled [him]140-boyson extremely . [She]145-daphne was , [he]140-boyson supposed , intellectual ; but [the intellectual women in [England]14-england]472-the intellectual women in england did not talk in the same way . [He]140-boyson was equal to [them]472-the intellectual women in england , or flattered [himself]140-boyson that [he]140-boyson was ; but [Miss Boyson]141-miss boyson was beyond [him]140-boyson . [He]140-boyson was getting into great difficulties with [her]145-daphne , when suddenly [Miss Floyd]145-daphne addressed [him]140-boyson : “ [I]145-daphne am sure [I]145-daphne saw [you]140-boyson in [New York]1-new york , at the opera ? ”[145-daphne] [She]145-daphne bent over to [him]140-boyson as [she]145-daphne spoke , and lowered [her]145-daphne voice . [Her]145-daphne look was merry , perhaps a little satirical . It put [him]140-boyson on [his]140-boyson guard . “ Yes , [I]145-daphne was there . [I]140-boyson think [we]473-we ought to be moving up . ”[140-boyson] [They]473-we strolled slowly towards [the house]413-the house , watching the stream of excursionists pour out of [the house]413-the house and [gardens]476-gardens , and wind down [the hill]383-the hill ; sounds of talk and laughter filled the air , and the western sun touched the spring hats and dresses . “ The holidays end to - morrow , ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne demurely , as [she]145-daphne walked beside [young Barnes]121-roger . [A teacher of music?—with that self - confidence]480-a teacher of music?—with that self - confidence — that air as though [the world]319-the world belonged to [her]145-daphne ! [The young man]290-the young man was greatly mystified . But [he]290-the young man reminded [himself]290-the young man that [he]290-the young man was in [a democratic country where [all men]484-all men — and especially [all women]485-all women]483-a democratic country where all men — and especially all women — are equal . Not that [the young women now streaming to the steamboat]486-the young women now streaming to the steamboat were [[Miss Floyd]145-daphne 's equals]487-miss floyd 's equals . The notion was absurd . All that appeared to be true was that [Miss Floyd]145-daphne , in any circumstances , would be , and was , the equal of [anybody]2686-anybody . “ How charming [[your]147-cecilia boyson friend]2737-your friend is ! ”[290-the young man] [he]290-the young man said presently to [Cecilia Boyson]147-cecilia boyson , as [they]489-they lingered on [the verandah]490-the verandah , waiting for [the curator]491-the curator , in a scene now deserted . “ [She]2737-your friend tells [me]147-cecilia boyson [she]2737-your friend is [a teacher of music]2738-a teacher of music . ”[147-cecilia boyson] [Cecilia Boyson]147-cecilia boyson looked at [him]290-the young man in amazement , and made [him]290-the young man repeat [his]290-the young man remark . [Miss Boyson]141-miss boyson leant against one of the pillars of [the verandah]490-the verandah , shaking with suppressed laughter . But at that moment [the curator]491-the curator , [a gentle , grey - haired man]495-a gentle , grey - haired man , appeared , shaking hands with [the General]289-the general , and bowing to [the ladies]497-the ladies . [He]491-the curator gave [them]497-the ladies a little discourse on [the house]413-the house and its history , as [they]497-the ladies stood on [the verandah]490-the verandah ; and private conversation was no longer possible . A SUDDEN hush had fallen upon [Mount Vernon]3-mount vernon . From [the river below]500-the river below came the distant sounds of [the steamer]2654-the steamer , which , with [its]2654-the steamer crowds safe on board , was now putting off for [Washington]2-washington . But the lawns and paths of [the house]413-the house , and [the formal garden behind [it]413-the house]503-the formal garden behind it , and [all [its]413-the house simple rooms [upstairs]505-upstairs and down]504-all its simple rooms upstairs and down , were now given back to the spring and silence , save for this last party of sightseers . [The curator]491-the curator , after [his]491-the curator preliminary lecture on [the verandah]490-the verandah , took [them]497-the ladies within ; the railings across the doors were removed ; [they]497-the ladies wandered in and out as [they]497-the ladies pleased . Perhaps , however , there were only [two persons among the six now following [the curator to whom the famous place]509-the curator to whom the famous place meant anything more than a means of idling away a warm afternoon]508-two persons among the six now following the curator to whom the famous place meant anything more than a means of idling away a warm afternoon . [General Hobson]120-general hobson carried [his]120-general hobson white head proudly through it , saying little or nothing . [It]413-the house was [the house of [a man who had wrenched half a continent from [Great Britain]16-great britain]511-a man who had wrenched half a continent from great britain]510-the house of a man who had wrenched half a continent from great britain ; [the English Tory]512-the english tory had no intention whatever of bowing the knee . On the other hand , it was [the house of [a soldier]514-a soldier and [a gentleman]515-a gentleman , representing old English traditions , tastes , and manners]513-the house of a soldier and a gentleman , representing old english traditions , tastes , and manners . No modern blatancy , no Yankee smartness anywhere . Simplicity and moderate wealth , combined with culture,—witness the books of [the library,—with]516-the library,—with [land - owning]517-land - owning , [a family coach]518-a family coach , and [church]519-church on Sundays : these things [the Englishman]395-the englishman understood . Only [the slaves , in the picture of [Mount Vernon]3-mount vernon 's past]521-the slaves , in the picture of mount vernon 's past , were strange to [him]395-the englishman . [They]521-the slaves , in the picture of mount vernon 's past stood at length in [the death - chamber]522-the death - chamber , with [its]522-the death - chamber low white bed , and [its]522-the death - chamber balcony overlooking [the river]351-the river . “ This , [ladies]2739-ladies , is [the room in which [General Washington]152-washington died]2740-the room in which general washington died , ”[491-the curator] said [the curator]491-the curator , patiently repeating the familiar sentence . “ It is , of course , on that account sacred to [every true American]2741-every true american . ”[395-the englishman] [He]395-the englishman bowed [his]395-the englishman head instinctively as [he]395-the englishman spoke . [The General]289-the general looked round [him]289-the general in silence . [His]289-the general eye was caught by the old hearth , and by the iron plate at the back of it , bearing the letters G.W. and some scroll work . There flashed into [his]289-the general mind a vision of the December evening on which [Washington]152-washington passed away , the flames flickering in the chimney , the winds breathing round [the house]413-the house and over [the snow - bound landscape]527-the snow - bound landscape outside , [the dying man in that white bed]528-the dying man in that white bed , and around [him]289-the general , hovering invisibly , [the generations of the future]529-the generations of the future . [The General]289-the general 's patriotic mind was not alloyed by any harassing sense of humour ; [he]289-the general therefore firmly reminded [himself]289-the general that [no Englishman]531-no englishman had a right to think of [Washington]152-washington as anything better than [a traitor to [[his]289-the general king]533-his king and [country]534-country]532-a traitor to his king and country ; yet [he]289-the general admitted that it was perhaps natural that [Americans]138-the americans should consider [him]289-the general [a great man]535-a great man . The French window beside the bed was thrown open , and [these privileged guests]536-these privileged guests were invited to step on to [the balcony]537-the balcony . [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne was handed out by [young Barnes]121-roger . [They]538-they hung over the white balustrade together . An evening light was on [the noble breadth of [river]540-river]539-the noble breadth of river ; [its]539-the noble breadth of river surface of blue and gold gleamed through the boughs of the trees which girdled [the house]413-the house ; blossoms of wild cherry , of dogwood , and magnolia sparkled amid the coverts of young green . [Roger Barnes]121-roger remarked , with sincerity , as [he]289-the general looked about [him]289-the general , that it was a very pretty place , and [he]289-the general was glad [he]289-the general had not missed it . [Miss Floyd]145-daphne made an absent reply , being in fact occupied in studying [the speaker]542-the speaker . It was , so to speak , the first time [she]145-daphne had really observed [him]542-the speaker ; and , as [they]538-they paused on [the balcony]537-the balcony together , [she]145-daphne was suddenly possessed by the same impression as that which had mollified [the General]289-the general 's scolding on board [the steamer]2654-the steamer . [He]542-the speaker was indeed handsome , [the young Englishman!—a magnificent figure of [a man , in height and breadth and general proportions]547-a man , in height and breadth and general proportions ; and in addition , as it seemed to [her]145-daphne , possessed of an absurd and superfluous beauty of feature]546-the young englishman!—a magnificent figure of a man , in height and breadth and general proportions ; and in addition , as it seemed to her , possessed of an absurd and superfluous beauty of feature . What does [a man]2682-a man want with such good looks ? This was perhaps [the girl]396-the girl 's first instinctive feeling . [She]145-daphne was , indeed , a little dazzled by [[her]145-daphne new companion]550-her new companion , now that [she]145-daphne began to realise [him]542-the speaker . As compared with [the average man in [Washington]2-washington or [New York]1-new york]551-the average man in washington or new york , here was an exception — an Apollo!—for [she]145-daphne too thought of [the Sun - god]552-the sun - god . [Miss Floyd]145-daphne could not remember that [she]145-daphne had ever had to do with [an Apollo]553-an apollo before ; [young Barnes]121-roger , therefore , was so far an event , a sensation . In [the opera - house]554-the opera - house [she]145-daphne had been vaguely struck by a handsome face . But here , in the freedom of outdoor dress and movement , [he]542-the speaker seemed to [her]145-daphne [a physical king of [men]556-men]555-a physical king of men ; and , at the same time , [his]542-the speaker easy manner — which , however , was neither conceited nor ill - bred — showed [him]542-the speaker conscious of [his]542-the speaker advantages . [He]542-the speaker had been , it seemed , at [Eton]17-eton and [Oxford]5-oxford ; and [she]145-daphne supposed that [he]542-the speaker belonged to [the rich English world]559-the rich english world . [[His]542-the speaker mother]335-his mother was [a Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes ; [[his]542-the speaker father]561-his father , [she]145-daphne gathered , was dead ; and [he]542-the speaker was travelling , no doubt , in the lordly English way , to get a little knowledge of the barbarians outside , before [he]542-the speaker settled down to [[his]542-the speaker own kingdom]562-his own kingdom , and the ways thereof . [She]145-daphne envisaged [a big Georgian house in [a spreading park]564-a spreading park , like scores that [she]145-daphne had seen in the course of motoring through [England]14-england the year before]563-a big georgian house in a spreading park , like scores that she had seen in the course of motoring through england the year before . [I]145-daphne hope [I]145-daphne have n't said anything [I]145-daphne ought n't to have said ? ”[145-daphne] “ [Everybody]2750-everybody knows it here , ”[146-daphne] said [Daphne]146-daphne slowly . “ [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne married three years ago . [She]146-daphne married [a Jew]157-a jew — [a New Yorker]2751-a new yorker — who had changed [his]157-a jew name . [You]2752-you know [Jews]158-jews are not in what [we]2753-we call ‘ society ’ here . But [Madeleine]159-madeleine thought [she]159-madeleine could do it ; [she]159-madeleine was in love with [him]157-a jew , and [she]159-madeleine meant to be able to do without society . [He]157-a jew said — as [they]2755-her people and [she]159-madeleine pleased . Then , one night about a year ago , [he]157-a jew took [the train]468-the train to [Niagara]18-niagara — of course it was a very commonplace thing to do — and two days afterwards [he]157-a jew was found , thrown up by the whirlpool ; [you]2757-you know , where all the suicides are found ! ”[121-roger] [Barnes]121-roger stopped short in front of [[his]582-you companion]317-his companion , [his]582-you face flushing . “ What a horrible story ! ”[582-you] [he]582-you said , with emphasis . [They]595-we hurried on to join [the curator]491-the curator , who took the party for a stroll round some of [the fields over which [George Washington]130-washington , in [his]130-washington early married life]598-the fields over which george washington , in his early married life , was accustomed to ride in summer and winter dawns , inspecting [his]130-washington negroes , [[his]130-washington plantation]599-his plantation , and [[his]130-washington barns]600-his barns . The grass in [these southern fields]601-these southern fields was already high ; there were shining fruit - trees , blossom - laden , in an orchard copse ; and the white dogwood glittered in [the woods]602-the woods . For [two people to whom the traditions of the place]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place were dear , this quiet walk through [[Washington]2-washington 's land]604-washington 's land had a charm far beyond that of [the reconstructed interior of [the house]413-the house]605-the reconstructed interior of the house , Here were things unaltered and unalterable , boundaries , tracks , [woods]607-woods , haunted still by the figure of [the young master]608-the young master and [bridegroom]609-bridegroom who brought [Patsy Curtis]162-patsy curtis [there]610-there in 1759 . To [the grey - haired curator]611-the grey - haired curator every foot of [them]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place was sacred and familiar ; [he]611-the grey - haired curator knew [these fields]612-these fields and the records of [them]612-these fields better than any detail of [his]611-the grey - haired curator own personal affairs ; for years now [he]611-the grey - haired curator had lived in spirit with [Washington]130-washington , through all the hours of the Mount Vernon day ; [his]611-the grey - haired curator life was ruled by [one great ghost]613-one great ghost , so that everything actual was comparatively dim . [Boyson]141-miss boyson too , [a fine soldier]614-a fine soldier and [a fine intelligence]615-a fine intelligence , had a mind stored with [Washingtoniana]163-washingtoniana . [They]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place knew well that [the others]572-the others were not worthy of [their]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place opportunity ; although [General Hobson]120-general hobson , seeing that most of the memories touched belonged to a period before the Revolution , obeyed the dictates of politeness , and made amends for [his]120-general hobson taciturnity indoors by [a talkative vein outside]620-a talkative vein outside . [Captain Boyson]140-boyson was not , however , wholly occupied with history or reminiscence . [He]140-boyson perceived very plainly before the walk was over that [[the General]289-the general 's good - looking nephew]622-the general 's good - looking nephew and [Miss Daphne Floyd]145-daphne were interested in [each other]346-each other 's conversation . When [they]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place joined the party in [the garden]2727-the garden it seemed to [him]140-boyson that [they]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place had been disputing . [Miss Daphne]145-daphne was flushed and a little snappish when spoken to ; and [the young man]290-the young man looked embarrassed . But presently [he]140-boyson saw that [they]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place gravitated to [each other]346-each other , and that , whatever chance combination might be formed during the walk , it always ended for a time in the flight ahead of [the two figures]444-the two figures , [the girl in the rose - coloured sash]628-the girl in the rose - coloured sash and [the tall handsome youth]629-the tall handsome youth . Towards the end of the walk [they]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place became separated from the rest of [the party]422-the party , and only arrived at [the little station]631-the little station just in time before [the cars]632-the cars started . On this occasion again , [they]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place had been clearly arguing and disagreeing ; and [Daphne]145-daphne had the air of a ruffled bird , [her]145-daphne dark eyes glittering , [her]145-daphne mouth set in the obstinate lines that [Boyson]140-boyson knew by heart . But again [they]603-two people to whom the traditions of the place sat together in [the car]633-the car , and talked and sparred all the way [home]2690-home ; while [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne , in a corner of [the carriage]635-the carriage , shut [her]146-daphne hollow eyes , and laid [her]146-daphne thin hands one over the other , and in [her]146-daphne purple draperies made a picture à la Mélisande which was not lost upon [[her]146-daphne companions]636-her companions . [Boyson]140-boyson 's mind registered a good many grim or terse comments , as occasionally [he]140-boyson found [himself]140-boyson watching [this lady]637-this lady . Scarcely a year since that hideous business at [Niagara]18-niagara , and here [she]637-this lady was in that extravagant dress ! [He]140-boyson wished [[his]140-boyson sister]430-his sister would not make [a friend of [her]637-this lady]639-a friend of her , and that [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne saw less of [her]637-this lady . [Miss Daphne]145-daphne had quite enough bees in [her]145-daphne own bonnet without adopting [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne 's . Meanwhile , it was [the General who , on the return journey]640-the general who , on the return journey , was made to serve [Miss Boyson]141-miss boyson 's gift for monopoly . [She]141-miss boyson took possession of [him]640-the general who , on the return journey in a business - like way , inquiring into [his]640-the general who , on the return journey engagements in [Washington]2-washington , [[his]640-the general who , on the return journey particular friends]641-his particular friends , [his]640-the general who , on the return journey opinion of [the place]642-the place and [the people]2652-the people , with a light - handed acuteness which was more than a match for [the Englishman]395-the englishman 's instincts of defence . [The General]289-the general did not mean to give [himself]289-the general away ; [he]289-the general intended , indeed , precisely the contrary ; but , after every round of conversation , [Miss Boyson]141-miss boyson felt [herself]141-miss boyson more and more richly provided with materials for satire at the expense of [England]14-england and [the English tourist]646-the english tourist , [his]640-the general who , on the return journey invincible conceit , insularity , and condescension . [She]141-miss boyson was [a clever though tiresome woman]647-a clever though tiresome woman ; and expressed [herself]141-miss boyson best in letters . [She]141-miss boyson promised [herself]141-miss boyson to write a “ character ”[141-miss boyson] of [General Hobson]120-general hobson in [her]141-miss boyson next letter to [an intimate friend]648-an intimate friend , which should be a masterpiece . Then , having led [him]120-general hobson successfully through the rôle of [the comic Englishman abroad]649-the comic englishman abroad , [she]141-miss boyson repaid [him]120-general hobson with information . [She]141-miss boyson told [him]120-general hobson , not without some secret amusement at the reprobation it excited , the tragic story of [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne . [She]141-miss boyson gave [him]120-general hobson a full history of [[her]141-miss boyson brother]2713-her brother 's honourable and brilliant career ; and here let it be said that the précieuse in [her]141-miss boyson gave way to [the sister]651-the sister , and that [she]141-miss boyson talked with feeling . And finally [she]141-miss boyson asked [him]120-general hobson with a smile whether [he]120-general hobson admired [Miss Floyd]145-daphne . [The General]289-the general , who had in fact been observing [Miss Floyd]145-daphne and [[his]289-the general nephew]331-his nephew with some little uneasiness during the preceding half - hour , replied guardedly that [Miss Floyd]145-daphne was pretty and picturesque , and apparently [a great talker]654-a great talker . Was [she]145-daphne [a native of [Washington]2-washington]655-a native of washington ? “ [You]289-the general never heard of [Miss Floyd?—of Daphne Floyd]145-daphne ? No ? Ah , well!”—and[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne laughed—“I suppose [I]120-general hobson ought to take it as a compliment , of a kind . There are so many rich people now in [this queer country of ours]2781-this queer country of ours that even [Daphne Floyds]164-daphne floyds do n't matter . ”[120-general hobson] “ Is [Miss Floyd]145-daphne so tremendously rich ? ”[120-general hobson] [General Hobson]120-general hobson turned a quickened countenance upon [her]145-daphne , expressing no more than the interest felt by [the ordinary man in all societies]656-the ordinary man in all societies — more strongly , perhaps , at the present day than ever before — in the mere fact of money . But [Miss Boyson]141-miss boyson gave it at once a personal meaning , and set [herself]141-miss boyson to play on what [she]141-miss boyson scornfully supposed to be the cupidity of [the Englishman]395-the englishman . [She]141-miss boyson produced , indeed , a full and particular account of [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne 's parentage , possessions , and prospects , during which [the General]289-the general 's countenance represented [him]289-the general with great fidelity . A trace of recalcitrance at the beginning — for it was [his]289-the general opinion that [Miss Boyson]141-miss boyson , like [most American women]659-most american women , talked decidedly too much — gave way to close attention tion , then to astonishment , and finally to a very animated observation of [[Miss Floyd]145-daphne 's slender person]660-miss floyd 's slender person as [she]145-daphne sat a yard or two from [him]289-the general on the other side of [the car]633-the car , laughing , frowning , or chattering with [Roger]121-roger . “ And [that poor child]2782-that poor child has the management of it all ? ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general said at last , in a tone which did [him]289-the general credit . [He]703-the old man opened [[his]703-the old man mother]335-his mother 's first . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes wrote a large and straggling hand , which required many sheets and much postage . The letter contained only one more repetition of counsels that had been dinned into [his]710-he ears for months — almost ever since the financial crash which had followed [[his]710-he father]561-his father 's death , and the crash of another sort , concerning [himself]710-he , which had come so quick upon it . [His]710-he thoughts returned , as they always did at some hour of the day or night , to [the “ horrid woman]2833-the “ horrid woman . ”[2833-the “ horrid woman] Yes , that had hit [him]710-he hard ; [the lad]713-the lad 's heart still throbbed with bitterness as [he]710-he thought of it . [He]710-he had never felt anything so much ; [he]710-he did n't believe [he]710-he should ever mind anything so much again . “ [I]710-he 'm not one of [your]714-her sentimental sort , ”[710-he] [he]710-he thought , half congratulating [himself]710-he , half in self - contempt . But [he]710-he could not get [her]714-her out of [his]710-he head ; [he]710-he wondered if [he]710-he ever should . And it had gone pretty far too . By [Jove]160-jove ! that night in the orchard!—when [she]714-her had kissed [him]710-he and thrown [her]714-her arms round [his]710-he neck ! And then to write [him]710-he that letter when things were at their worst . [She]714-her might have done the thing decently . Have treated [a fellow]715-a fellow kindly at least . Well , of course , it was all done with . Yes , it was . Done with ! [He]710-he got up and began to pace [[his]710-he small room]716-his small room , [his]710-he hands in [his]710-he pockets , thinking of the night in [the orchard]717-the orchard . Then gradually the smart lessened , and [his]710-he thoughts passed away to other things . [That little Yankee girl]718-that little yankee girl had really made good sport all the way [home]2690-home . [He]710-he had not been dull for a moment ; [she]718-that little yankee girl had teased and provoked [him]710-he so . [Her]718-that little yankee girl eyes , too , were wonderfully pretty , and [her]718-that little yankee girl small , pointed chin , and [her]718-that little yankee girl witch - like imperious ways . Was it [her]718-that little yankee girl money , the sense that [she]718-that little yankee girl could do as [she]718-that little yankee girl liked with [most people]720-most people , that made [her]718-that little yankee girl so domineering and masterful ? Very likely . On the journey [he]710-he had put it down just to a natural and very surprising impudence . That was when [he]710-he believed that [she]718-that little yankee girl was [a teacher]479-a teacher , earning [her]718-that little yankee girl bread . But the impudence had not prevented [him]710-he from finding it much more amusing to talk to [her]718-that little yankee girl than to [anybody else]722-anybody else . And , on the whole , [he]710-he thought [she]718-that little yankee girl had not disliked [him]710-he , though [she]718-that little yankee girl had said the rudest things to [him]710-he , and [he]710-he had retaliated . [She]718-that little yankee girl had asked [him]710-he , indeed , to join [them]723-them in an excursion the following day , and to tea at [the Country Club]724-the country club . [He]710-he had meant , if possible , to go back to [New York]1-new york on the morrow . But perhaps a day or two longer — So [she]718-that little yankee girl had a million — [the little sprite]725-the little sprite ? [She]718-that little yankee girl was and would be [a handful!—with a fortune or without it]726-a handful!—with a fortune or without it . And possessed also of the most extraordinary opinions . [He]710-he began to fold [[his]710-he mother]335-his mother 's letter , and put it back into its envelope , while a slight flush mounted in [his]710-he cheeks , and [the young mouth that was still so boyish and candid]729-the young mouth that was still so boyish and candid took a stiffer line . “ IS [Miss Floyd]145-daphne at [home]2690-home ? ”[730-the questioner] [The questioner]730-the questioner was [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne , who had just alighted from [[her]146-daphne carriage]731-her carriage at the door of [the house in [Columbia Avenue]25-columbia avenue inhabited by [Miss Floyd]145-daphne]732-the house in columbia avenue inhabited by miss floyd and [[her]145-daphne chaperon]698-her chaperon . [The maid]734-the maid replied that [Miss Floyd]145-daphne had not yet returned , but had left a message begging [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne to wait for [her]145-daphne . [The visitor]735-the visitor was accordingly ushered to [the drawing - room on [the first floor]737-the first floor]736-the drawing - room on the first floor . [This room]738-this room , the staircase , [the maid]734-the maid , all bore witness to [Miss Floyd]145-daphne 's simplicity — like the Romney dress of [Mount Vernon]3-mount vernon . The colour of the walls and the hangings , the lines of the furniture , were all subdued , even a little austere . Quiet greens and blues , mingled with white , showed the artistic mind ; the chairs and sofas were a trifle stiff and straight - legged ; the electric fittings were of a Georgian plainness to match the Colonial architecture of [the house]413-the house ; the beautiful self - coloured carpet was indeed Persian and costly , but it betrayed [its]741-its costliness only to [the expert]742-the expert . Altogether , [the room]743-the room , [one]2809-one would have said , of [any bourse moyenne with an eye for beauty]745-any bourse moyenne with an eye for beauty . Fine photographs also , of Italian and Dutch pictures , suggested travel , and struck the cultivated cosmopolitan note . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne looked round [it]743-the room with a smile . It was all as unpretending as [the maid who ushered [her]146-daphne [upstairs]505-upstairs]746-the maid who ushered her upstairs . [Daphne]146-daphne would have [[no men]748-no men - servants in [her]146-daphne employ]749-no men - servants in her employ . What did [two ladies]750-two ladies want with [them]749-no men - servants in her employ , in [a democratic country]751-a democratic country ? But [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne happened to know that [[Daphne]146-daphne 's [maid - servants]753-maid - servants]752-daphne 's maid - servants were just as costly in [their]752-daphne 's maid - servants degree as the drawing - room carpet . Chosen for [her]146-daphne in [London]26-london with great care , attracted to [Washington]2-washington by enormous wages , [these numerous damsels]754-these numerous damsels played [their]754-these numerous damsels part in the general “ simplicity ”[146-daphne] effect ; but on the whole [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne believed that [[Daphne]146-daphne 's household]755-daphne 's household was rather more expensive than that of [other rich people who employed [men]556-men]756-other rich people who employed men . [She]146-daphne walked through [the room]743-the room , looking absently at the various photographs and engravings , till [her]146-daphne attention was excited by an easel and a picture upon it in [the back drawing - room]759-the back drawing - room . [She]146-daphne went up to it with a muttered exclamation . “ So [she]146-daphne bought it ! [Daphne]146-daphne 's amazing ! ”[146-daphne] For what [she]146-daphne saw before [her]146-daphne was a masterpiece — an excessively costly masterpiece — of the Florentine school , smuggled out of [Italy]27-italy , to the wrath of [the Italian Government]760-the italian government , some six months before this date , and since then lost to general knowledge . Rumour had given it first to [a well - known collection at [Boston]28-boston]761-a well - known collection at boston ; then to another at [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia ; yet here it was in the possession of [a girl of two - and - twenty of whom [the great world]763-the great world]762-a girl of two - and - twenty of whom the great world was just — but only just — beginning to talk . “ How like [Daphne]146-daphne ! ”[764-her friend] thought [[her]146-daphne friend]764-her friend , with malice . [The “ simple ”[764-her friend] room]765-the “ simple ” room , and the priceless picture carelessly placed in a corner of [it]765-the “ simple ” room , lest [any one]766-any one should really suppose that [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne was [an ordinary mortal]767-an ordinary mortal . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne sat down at last in a chair fronting the picture and let [herself]146-daphne fall into a reverie . On this occasion [she]146-daphne was dressed in black . The lace strings of a hat crowned with black ostrich feathers were fastened under [her]146-daphne chin by a diamond that sparkled in the dim greenish light of [the drawing - room]768-the drawing - room ; the feathers of the hat were unusually large and drooping ; they curled heavily round the thin neck and long , hollow - eyed face , so that its ivory whiteness , its fatigue , its fretful beauty , were framed in and emphasised by them ; [her]146-daphne bloodless hands lay upon [her]146-daphne lap , and the folds of the sweeping dress drawn round [her]146-daphne showed [her]146-daphne slenderness , or rather [her]146-daphne emaciation . Two years before this date [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine had been [a great beauty]769-a great beauty , and [she]146-daphne had never yet reconciled [herself]146-daphne to physical losses which were but the outward and visible sign of losses “ far more deeply interfused . ”[146-daphne] As [she]146-daphne sat apparently absorbed in thought before the picture , [she]146-daphne moved , half consciously , so that [she]146-daphne could no longer see [herself]146-daphne in a mirror opposite . Yet [her]146-daphne thoughts were in truth much engaged with [Daphne]146-daphne and [Daphne]146-daphne 's proceedings . It was now nearly three weeks since [Roger Barnes]121-roger had appeared on the horizon . [General Hobson]120-general hobson had twice postponed [his]120-general hobson departure for [England]14-england , and was still “ enduring hardness ”[146-daphne] in [a Washington hotel]770-a washington hotel . Why [[his]120-general hobson nephew]331-his nephew should not be allowed to manage [his]331-his nephew courtship , if it was a courtship , for [himself]331-his nephew , [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne did not understand . There was no love lost between [herself]146-daphne and [the General]289-the general , and [she]146-daphne made much mock of [him]331-his nephew in [her]146-daphne talks with [Daphne]146-daphne . However , there [he]331-his nephew was ; and [she]146-daphne could only suppose that [he]331-his nephew took the situation seriously and felt bound to watch it in the interests of [[the young man]290-the young man 's absent mother]774-the young man 's absent mother . Was it serious ? Certainly [Daphne]146-daphne had been committing [herself]146-daphne a good deal . The question was whether [she]146-daphne had not been committing [herself]146-daphne more than [the young man]290-the young man had been doing on [his]331-his nephew side . That was the astonishing part of it . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne could not sufficiently admire the skill with which [Roger Barnes]121-roger had so far played [his]331-his nephew part ; could not sufficiently ridicule [her]146-daphne own lack of insight , which at [her]146-daphne first meeting with [him]331-his nephew had pronounced [him]331-his nephew stupid . Stupid [he]331-his nephew might be in the sense that it was of no use to expect from [him]331-his nephew the kind of talk on books , pictures , and first principles which prevailed in [Daphne]146-daphne 's circle . But [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne thought [she]146-daphne had seldom come across a finer sense of tactics than [young Barnes]121-roger had so far displayed in [his]331-his nephew dealings with [Daphne]146-daphne . If [he]331-his nephew went on as [he]331-his nephew had begun , the probability was that [he]331-his nephew would succeed . Did [she]146-daphne , [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine , wish [him]331-his nephew to succeed ? [Daphne]146-daphne had grown tragically necessary to [her]146-daphne , in [this world of American society]776-this world of american society — that section of it , at any rate , in which [she]146-daphne desired to move , where [the widow of [Leopold Verrier]167-leopold verrier]777-the widow of leopold verrier was always conscious of the blowing of a cold and hostile breath . [She]146-daphne was not excluded , but [she]146-daphne was not welcome ; [she]146-daphne was not ostracised , but [she]146-daphne had lost consideration . There had been something picturesque and appealing in [[her]146-daphne husband]778-her husband ; something unbearably tragic in the manner of [his]331-his nephew death . [She]146-daphne had braved it out by staying in [America]7-america , instead of losing [herself]146-daphne in [foreign towns]779-foreign towns ; and [she]146-daphne had thereby proclaimed that [she]146-daphne had no guilty sense of responsibility , no burden on [her]146-daphne conscience ; that [she]146-daphne had only behaved as [a thousand other women]780-a thousand other women would have behaved , and without any cruel intention at all . But [she]146-daphne knew all the same that [the spectators of what had happened]781-the spectators of what had happened held [her]146-daphne for [a cruel woman]782-a cruel woman , and that there were [many]783-many , and [those the best]784-those the best , who saw [her]146-daphne come with distaste , and go without regret ; and it was under that knowledge , in spite of indomitable pride , that [her]146-daphne beauty had withered in a year . And at the moment when the smart of what had happened to [her]146-daphne — personally and socially — was at its keenest ; when , after a series of quarrels , [she]146-daphne had separated [herself]146-daphne from [the imperious mother who had been [her]146-daphne evil genius throughout [her]146-daphne marriage]785-the imperious mother who had been her evil genius throughout her marriage , [she]146-daphne had made [friends]786-friends , unexpectedly , owing to a chance meeting at [a picture - gallery]787-a picture - gallery , with [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne . Some element in [Daphne]145-daphne 's nature had attracted and disarmed [her]146-daphne . [The proud , fastidious woman]788-the proud , fastidious woman had given [the girl]396-the girl [her]788-the proud , fastidious woman confidence — eagerly , indiscriminately . [She]788-the proud , fastidious woman had poured out upon [her]146-daphne all that wild philosophy of “ rights ”[788-the proud , fastidious woman] which is still struggling in the modern mind with a crumbling ethic and a vanishing religion . And [she]788-the proud , fastidious woman had found in [Daphne]145-daphne [a warm and passionate ally]790-a warm and passionate ally . [Daphne]145-daphne was nothing if not [“ advanced . ”]2835-“ advanced . ”[145-daphne] [She]145-daphne shrank , as [Roger Barnes]121-roger had perceived , from no question ; [she]145-daphne had never been forbidden , had never forbidden [herself]145-daphne , any book that [she]145-daphne had a fancy to read ; and [she]145-daphne was as ready to discuss the relative divorce laws of [Massachusetts]30-massachusetts and [Pennsylvania]31-pennsylvania , as [the girls of fifty years ago]791-the girls of fifty years ago were to talk of the fashions , or “ [Evangeline]168-evangeline . ”[145-daphne] In any disputed case , moreover , between [a man]2682-a man and [a woman]793-a woman [Daphne]145-daphne was hotly and instinctively on the side of [the woman]794-the woman . [She]145-daphne had thrown [herself]145-daphne therefore with ardour into the defence of [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne ; and for [her]145-daphne it was not [the wife]795-the wife 's desertion , but [the husband]2811-the husband 's suicide , which had been the cruel and indefensible thing . All these various traits and liberalisms had made [her]145-daphne very dear to [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine . Now , as [that lady]797-that lady sat in [her]797-that lady usual drooping attitude , wondering what [Washington]2-washington would be like for [her]797-that lady when even [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne was gone from it , the afternoon sun stole through the curtains of the window on [the street]798-the street and touched some of the furniture and engravings in [the inner drawing - room]799-the inner drawing - room . Suddenly [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne started in [her]146-daphne chair . A face had emerged , thrown out upon the shadows by the sun - finger — the countenance of [a handsome young Jew]800-a handsome young jew , as [Rembrandt]169-rembrandt had once conceived it . Rare and high intelligence , melancholy , and premonition:—they were there embodied , so long as the apparition lasted . The effect on [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne was apparently profound . [She]146-daphne closed [her]146-daphne eyes ; [her]146-daphne lips quivered ; [she]146-daphne leant back feebly in [her]146-daphne chair , breathing a name . The crisis lasted a few minutes , while the momentary vision faded and the sunlight crept on . The eyelids unclosed at last , slowly and painfully , as though shrinking from what might greet the eyes beneath [them]801-them . But the farther wall was now in deep shade . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne sat up ; the emotion which had mastered [her]146-daphne like a possession passed away ; and rising hurriedly , [she]146-daphne went back to [the front drawing - room]802-the front drawing - room . [She]146-daphne had hardly reached [it]802-the front drawing - room when [Miss Floyd]145-daphne 's voice was heard upon the stairs . [Daphne]145-daphne entered [the room]743-the room in what appeared to be a fit of irritation . [She]146-daphne was scolding [the parlour - maid , whose high colour and dignified silence]804-the parlour - maid , whose high colour and dignified silence proclaimed [her]804-the parlour - maid , whose high colour and dignified silence both blameless and long - suffering . [Daphne]146-daphne , with both elbows on the table , was slowly crunching a morsel of toast in [her]146-daphne small white teeth . [She]146-daphne had a look of concentrated energy — as of [a person charged and overcharged with force of some kind]810-a person charged and overcharged with force of some kind , impatient to be let loose . [Her]146-daphne black eyes sparkled ; impetuosity and will shone from them ; although they showed also rims of fatigue , as if [Miss Daphne]145-daphne 's nights had not of late been all they should be . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne was chiefly struck , however , by the perception that for the first time [Daphne]146-daphne was not having altogether [her]146-daphne own way with [the world]319-the world . [Madeleine]159-madeleine had not observed anything of the same kind in [her]159-madeleine before . In general [she]159-madeleine was in entire command both of [herself]159-madeleine and of [the men who surrounded [her]159-madeleine]812-the men who surrounded her . [She]159-madeleine made a little court out of [them]813-them , and treated [them]813-them en despote . But [Roger Barnes]121-roger had not lent [himself]121-roger to the process ; [he]814-he had not played the game properly ; and [Daphne]146-daphne 's sleep had been disturbed for the first time in history . It had been admitted very soon between [the two friends]815-the two friends — without putting it very precisely — that [Daphne]146-daphne was interested in [Roger Barnes]121-roger . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne believed that [the girl]396-the girl had been originally carried off [her]396-the girl feet by [the young man]290-the young man 's superb good looks , and by the natural distinction — evident in all societies — which [they]813-them conferred upon [him]290-the young man . Then , no doubt , [she]146-daphne had been piqued by [his]290-the young man good - humoured , easy way — the absence of any doubt of [himself]290-the young man , of tremor , of insistence . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne said to [herself]146-daphne — not altogether shrewdly — that [he]290-the young man had no nerves , or no heart ; and [Daphne]146-daphne had not yet come across [the genus]818-the genus . [[Her]146-daphne lovers]819-her lovers had either possessed too much heart — like [Captain Boyson]140-boyson — or a lack of coolness , when it really came to the point of grappling with [Daphne]146-daphne and [[her]146-daphne millions]820-her millions , as in the case of a dozen [she]146-daphne could name . Whereby it had come about that [Daphne]146-daphne 's attention had been first provoked , then peremptorily seized by [the Englishman]395-the englishman ; and [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne began now to suspect that deeper things were really involved . Certainly there was a good deal to puzzle [the spectator]822-the spectator . That [the English]125-the english are [a fortune - hunting race]823-a fortune - hunting race may be a popular axiom ; but it was quite possible , after all , that [Roger Barnes]121-roger was not the latest illustration of it . It was quite possible , also , that [he]290-the young man had [a sweetheart]824-a sweetheart at [home]2690-home , [some quiet , Quakerish girl who would never wave in [his]290-the young man face the red flags that [Daphne]146-daphne was fond of brandishing]826-some quiet , quakerish girl who would never wave in his face the red flags that daphne was fond of brandishing . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne realised that , for all [his]290-the young man lack of subtlety and the higher conversation , [young Barnes]121-roger had managed astonishingly to keep [his]290-the young man counsel . [His]290-the young man “ simplicity , ”[290-the young man] like [Daphne]146-daphne 's , seemed to be of a special type . And yet — there was no doubt that [he]290-the young man had devoted [himself]290-the young man a great deal . [Washington]2-washington society had quickly found [him]290-the young man out ; [he]290-the young man had been invited to [all the most fastidious houses]830-all the most fastidious houses , and was immensely in request for picnics and expeditions . [She]146-daphne had become suddenly [a woman of [Andalusia]35-andalusia and [the South]845-the south]844-a woman of andalusia and the south , moved by [certain primitive forces in the blood]846-certain primitive forces in the blood . THE reception at [the White House]9-the white house was being given in honour of [the delegates]870-the delegates to a Peace Congress . [The rooms]424-the rooms were full without being inconveniently crowded , and [the charming house]872-the charming house opened [its]872-the charming house friendly doors to a society more congruous and organic , richer also in the nobler kind of variety than [America]7-america , perhaps , can offer to [[her]146-daphne guests]873-her guests elsewhere . [The President]2842-the president stood , [a rugged figure , amid [the cosmopolitan crowd]899-the cosmopolitan crowd , breasting the modern world , like [some [ocean headland]901-ocean headland]900-some ocean headland , yet not truly of [it]902-it , one of [the great fighters and [workers of mankind]904-workers of mankind]903-the great fighters and workers of mankind , with a laugh that pealed above the noise , blue eyes that seemed to pursue some converse of [their]905-their own , and a hand that grasped and cheered , where other hands withdrew and repelled]898-a rugged figure , amid the cosmopolitan crowd , breasting the modern world , like some ocean headland , yet not truly of it , one of the great fighters and workers of mankind , with a laugh that pealed above the noise , blue eyes that seemed to pursue some converse of their own , and a hand that grasped and cheered , where other hands withdrew and repelled . [This one man]906-this one man 's will had now , for some years , made the pivot on which vast issues turned — issues of peace and war , of policy embracing [the civilised world]907-the civilised world ; and , here , [one]2809-one saw [him]906-this one man in [drawing - rooms]909-drawing - rooms , discussing [Alaric]177-alaric 's campaigns with [an Oxford professor]910-an oxford professor , or chatting with [a young mother]911-a young mother about [[her]911-a young mother children]912-her children . [Cecilia]147-cecilia boyson recognised — with [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne — that merely to put the question involved a certain tribute to [young Barnes]121-roger .
