[He]1028-he was hanging out of the window in [[his]1028-he bedroom]1029-his bedroom , smoking and pondering . It was a mild and rainy night . [Washington]2-washington was full of the earth and leaf odours of the spring , which rose in gusts from [its]2-washington trees and [gardens]476-gardens ; and rugged , swiftly moving clouds disclosed every now and then what looked like hurrying stars . [The young man]290-the young man was excited and on edge . [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne — and the thought of [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne — had set [his]290-the young man pulses hammering ; [they]1032-they challenged in [him]290-the young man the aggressive , self - assertive , masculine force . The history of the preceding three weeks was far from simple . [He]290-the young man had first paid [a determined court]1033-a determined court to [her]145-daphne , conducting it in an orthodox , English , conspicuous way . [[His]290-the young man mother]335-his mother , and [her]145-daphne necessities — [his]290-the young man own also — imposed it on [him]290-the young man ; and [he]290-the young man flung [himself]290-the young man into it , setting [his]290-the young man teeth . Then , to [his]290-the young man astonishment , [one]2809-one may almost say to [his]290-the young man disconcerting , [he]290-the young man found the prey all at once , and , as it were , without a struggle , fluttering to [his]290-the young man lure , and practically within [his]290-the young man grasp . There was an evening when [Daphne]145-daphne 's sudden softness , the look in [her]145-daphne eyes , the inflection in [her]145-daphne voice had fairly thrown [him]290-the young man off [his]290-the young man balance . For the first time [he]290-the young man had shown a lack of self - command and self - possession . [Whereupon]186-whereupon , in a flash , [a new and strange Daphne]1036-a new and strange daphne had developed — imperious , difficult , incalculable . The more [he]290-the young man gave , the more [she]145-daphne claimed . Nor was it mere girlish caprice . [The young Englishman]1037-the young englishman , invited to a game that [he]290-the young man had never yet played , felt in it something sinister and bewildering . Gropingly , [he]290-the young man divined in front of [him]290-the young man a future of tyranny on [her]145-daphne side , of expected submission on [his]290-the young man . The Northern character in [him]290-the young man , with its reserve , its phlegm , its general sanity , began to shrink from the Southern elements in [her]145-daphne . [He]290-the young man became aware of the depths in [her]145-daphne nature , of things volcanic and primitive , and the English stuff in [him]290-the young man recoiled . So [he]290-the young man was to be bitted and bridled , it seemed , in the future . [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne would have bought [him]290-the young man with [her]145-daphne dollars , and [he]290-the young man would have to pay the price . Something natural and wild in [him]290-the young man said No ! If [he]290-the young man married [this girl]465-this girl [he]290-the young man would be master , in spite of [her]145-daphne money . [He]290-the young man realised vaguely , at any rate , the strength of [her]145-daphne will , and the way in which it had been tempered and steeled by circumstance . But the perception only roused in [himself]290-the young man some slumbering tenacities and vehemences of which [he]290-the young man had been scarcely aware . So that , almost immediately — since there was no glamour of passion on [his]290-the young man side — [he]290-the young man began to resent [her]145-daphne small tyrannies , to draw in , and draw back . A few quarrels — not ordinary [lovers]666-lovers ' quarrels , but representing a true grapple of personalities — sprang up behind a screen of trifles . [Daphne]145-daphne was once more rude and provoking , [Roger]121-roger cool and apparently indifferent . [The party]422-the party lunched in [a little inn]1091-a little inn beside [the river]351-the river , and then scattered again along [woodland paths]1093-woodland paths . [Daphne]145-daphne and [the Under - Secretary]1008-the under - secretary wandered on ahead and were some distance from [the rest of the party]451-the rest of the party when [that gentleman]1096-that gentleman suddenly looked at [his]1096-that gentleman watch in dismay . An appointment had to be kept with [the President]2842-the president at a certain hour , and [the Under - Secretary]1008-the under - secretary 's wits had been wandering . There was nothing for it but to take a short cut through [the woods]602-the woods to [a local station]1100-a local station and make at once for [Washington]130-washington . [Daphne]145-daphne quickened [his]1008-the under - secretary uneasiness and hastened [his]1008-the under - secretary departure . [She]145-daphne assured [him]1008-the under - secretary that [the others]572-the others were close behind , and that nothing could suit [her]145-daphne better than to rest on a mossy stone that happily presented itself till [they]572-the others arrived . [The Under - Secretary]1008-the under - secretary , transformed into [the anxious and ambitious politician]1103-the anxious and ambitious politician , abruptly left [her]145-daphne . [Daphne]145-daphne , as soon as [he]1008-the under - secretary was gone , allowed [herself]145-daphne the natural attitude that fitted [her]145-daphne thoughts . [She]145-daphne was furiously in love and torn with jealousy ; and that love and jealousy could smart so , and cling so , was a strange revelation to one accustomed to make a world entirely to [her]145-daphne liking . [Her]145-daphne dark eyes were hollow , [her]145-daphne small mouth had lost its colour , and [she]145-daphne showed that touch of something wasting and withering that [Theocritan Shepherds]1104-theocritan shepherds knew in old [Sicilian]43-sicilian days . It was as though [she]145-daphne had defied [a god]1105-a god — and [the god]1106-the god had avenged [himself]1106-the god . Suddenly [he]1008-the under - secretary appeared — [the teasing divinity]1107-the teasing divinity — in human shape . There was a rustling among the brushwood fringing [the river]351-the river . [Roger Barnes]121-roger emerged and made [his]1008-the under - secretary way up towards [her]145-daphne . “ [I]1008-the under - secretary 've been stalking [you]145-daphne all this time , ”[1008-the under - secretary] [he]1008-the under - secretary said , breathless , as [he]1008-the under - secretary reached [her]145-daphne , “ and now , at last — [I've]1008-the under - secretary caught [you]145-daphne ! ”[1008-the under - secretary] [Daphne]145-daphne rose furiously . “ What right have [you]121-roger to stalk [me]121-roger , as [you]121-roger call it?—to follow [me]121-roger — to speak to [me]121-roger even ? [I]121-roger wish to avoid [you]145-daphne — and [I]121-roger have shown it ! ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger looked at [her]145-daphne . [He]1008-the under - secretary had thrown down [his]1008-the under - secretary hat , and [she]145-daphne saw [him]1008-the under - secretary against the background of sunny wood , as the magnificent embodiment of its youth and force . “ And why have [you]121-roger shown it ? ”[1008-the under - secretary] There was a warning tremor of excitement in [his]1008-the under - secretary voice . “ What have [I]1008-the under - secretary done ? [Roger]121-roger hesitated , but only for a moment . [He]1008-the under - secretary caught the hand , [he]1008-the under - secretary gathered its owner into a pair of strong arms , and bending over [her]145-daphne , [he]1008-the under - secretary kissed [her]145-daphne . [Daphne]145-daphne , suffocated with anger and emotion , broke from [him]1008-the under - secretary — tottering . Then sinking on the ground beneath a tree , [she]145-daphne burst into sobbing . [Roger]121-roger , scarlet , with sparkling eyes , dropped on one knee beside [her]145-daphne . “ [Daphne]145-daphne , [I]121-roger 'm [a ruffian]2917-a ruffian ! Forgive [me]121-roger ! [Daphne]145-daphne allowed it . [Her]145-daphne breast heaved as the storm departed . And [she]145-daphne looked so charming , so soft , so desirable , as [she]145-daphne sat there in [her]145-daphne white dress , with [her]145-daphne great tear - washed eyes and fluttering breath , that [the youth]320-the youth was really touched and carried off [his]1112-he feet ; and the rest of [his]1112-he task was quite easy . All the familiar things that had to be said were said , and with all the proper emphasis and spirit . [He]1112-he played [his]1112-he part , [the spring woods]1114-the spring woods played theirs , and [Daphne]145-daphne , worn out by emotion and conquered by passion , gradually betrayed [herself]145-daphne wholly . After losing [themselves]1116-them deliberately in [the woods]602-the woods , [they]1116-them strolled back to join [the rest of [the party]422-the party]451-the rest of the party . [She]146-daphne was walking alone and did not perceive [them]1116-them . [Her]146-daphne eyes were raised and fixed , as though on some sight in front of [them]1116-them . [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's often strange . ”[146-daphne] And with a superstitious pang [she]146-daphne wished that [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine 's face had not been the first to meet [her]146-daphne in this hour of [her]159-madeleine betrothal . IN [the drawing - room at [Heston Park]44-heston park]1123-the drawing - room at heston park [two ladies]750-two ladies were seated . [One]2809-one was [a well - preserved woman of fifty , with a large oblong face , good features , a double chin , and abundant grey hair arranged in waved bandeaux above a forehead which should certainly have implied strength of character]1126-a well - preserved woman of fifty , with a large oblong face , good features , a double chin , and abundant grey hair arranged in waved bandeaux above a forehead which should certainly have implied strength of character , and a pair of challenging black eyes . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes moved and spoke with authority ; it was evident that [she]153-lady barnes had been accustomed to do so all [her]153-lady barnes life ; to trail silk gowns over Persian carpets , to engage [expensive cooks]1127-expensive cooks and rely on [expensive butlers]1128-expensive butlers , with a strict attention to small economies all the time ; to impose [her]153-lady barnes will on [[her]153-lady barnes household]1129-her household and [the clergyman of [the parish]1131-the parish]1130-the clergyman of the parish ; to give [her]153-lady barnes opinions on books , and expect [them]1132-them to be listened to ; to abstain from politics as unfeminine , and to make up for it by the strongest of views on Church questions . [She]153-lady barnes belonged to [an English type common throughout all classes]1133-an english type common throughout all classes — quite harmless and tolerable when things go well , but apt to be soured and twisted by adversity . And [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes , it will be remembered , had known adversity . Not much of it , nor for long together ; but in [her]153-lady barnes own opinion [she]153-lady barnes had gone through “ great trials , ”[153-lady barnes] to the profit of [her]153-lady barnes Christian character . [She]153-lady barnes was quite certain , now , that everything had been for the best , and that [Providence]178-providence makes no mistakes . But that , perhaps , was because the “ trials ”[178-providence] had only lasted about a year ; and then , so far as they were pecuniary , the marriage of [[her]153-lady barnes son]708-her son with [Miss Daphne Floyd]145-daphne had entirely relieved [her]153-lady barnes of [them]1135-them . For [Roger]121-roger now made [her]153-lady barnes a handsome allowance , and the chastened habits of a most uncomfortable year had been hastily abandoned . Nevertheless , [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes 's aspect on this autumn afternoon was not cheerful , and [[her]153-lady barnes companion]356-her companion was endeavouring , with a little kind embarrassment , both to soothe an evident irritation and to avoid the confidences that [[Roger]121-roger 's mother]1137-roger 's mother seemed eager to pour out . [Elsie French]124-french , whom [Washington]130-washington had known three years before as [Elsie Maddison]174-elsie maddison , was in that bloom of young married life when all that was lovely in [the girl]396-the girl seems to be still lingering , while yet love and motherhood have wrought once more [their]1139-their old transforming miracle on sense and spirit . In [her]153-lady barnes afternoon dress of dainty sprigged silk , with just a touch of austerity in the broad muslin collar and cuffs — [her]153-lady barnes curly brown hair simply parted on [her]153-lady barnes brow , and gathered classically on a shapely head — [her]153-lady barnes mouth a little troubled , [her]153-lady barnes brow a little puckered over [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes 's discontents — [she]153-lady barnes was a very gracious vision . Yet behind the gentleness , as even [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes knew , there were qualities and characteristics of a singular strength . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes indeed was complaining , and could not be stopped . “ [You]2927-you see , [dear Mrs. French]190-mrs. french , ”[153-lady barnes] [she]153-lady barnes was saying in a rapid , lowered voice , and with many glances at the door , “ the trouble is that [Daphne]145-daphne is never satisfied . [She]145-daphne has some impossible ideal in [her]145-daphne mind , and then everything must be sacrificed to it . [She]145-daphne began with going into ecstasies over [this dear old house]2928-this dear old house , and now!—there 's scarcely a thing in it [she]145-daphne does not want to change . [Poor Edward]191-poor edward and [I]153-lady barnes spent thousands upon it , and [we]2929-we really flattered [ourselves]2929-we that [we]2929-we had some taste ; but it is not good enough for [Daphne]145-daphne ! ”[153-lady barnes] [The speaker]542-the speaker settled [herself]542-the speaker in [her]542-the speaker chair with a slight but emphatic clatter of bangles and rustle of skirts . “ It 's the ceilings , is n't it ? ”[124-french] murmured [Elsie French]124-french , glancing at the heavy decoration , the stucco bosses and pendants above [her]124-french head , which had replaced , some twenty years before , a piece of Adam design , sparing and felicitous . “ It 's everything ! ”[153-lady barnes] [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes 's tone was now more angry than fretful . “ [I]153-lady barnes do n't , of course , like to say it — but really [Daphne]145-daphne 's self - confidence is too amazing ! ”[153-lady barnes] “ [She]145-daphne does know so much , ”[124-french] said [Elsie French]124-french reflectively . “ Does n't [she]145-daphne ? ”[124-french] “ Well , if [you]153-lady barnes call it knowing . The situation was certainly awkward . At the time of [the Barnes]153-lady barnes 's financial crash , and [Sir Edward Barnes]192-edward 's death , [Heston Park]44-heston park , which belonged to [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes , was all that remained to [her]153-lady barnes and [[her]153-lady barnes son]708-her son . [A park of a hundred acres and a few cottages]1142-a park of a hundred acres and a few cottages went with [the house]413-the house ; but there was no estate to support [it]413-the house , and [it]413-the house had to be let , to provide an income for [the widow]1144-the widow and [the boy]368-the boy . Much of the expensive furniture had been sold before letting , but enough remained to satisfy the wants of [a not very exacting tenant]1146-a not very exacting tenant . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes had then departed to weep in exile on a pittance of about seven hundred a year . When [Daphne]145-daphne first stepped inside [the ancestral mansion of [the Trescoes]193-the trescoes]1159-the ancestral mansion of the trescoes — such had been [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes 's maiden name — [she]145-daphne had received a severe shock . The outside , the shell of [the house]413-the house — delightful ! But inside!—heavens ! what taste , what decoration — what ruin of a beautiful thing ! Half the old mantelpieces gone , the ceilings spoilt , the decorations “ busy , ”[121-roger] pretentious , overdone , and nothing left to console [her]145-daphne but an ugly row of bad Lelys and worse Highmores — the most despicable collection of family portraits [she]145-daphne had ever set eyes upon ! [He]2883-her father again urged [her]2941-the child to kiss [[her]2941-the child grandmother]1180-her grandmother ; but [the child]2941-the child again shook [her]2941-the child head . “ Then , ”[2883-her father] said [he]2883-her father craftily , “ [father]2933-father must kiss [granny]199-granny . ”[2883-her father] And [he]2883-her father began to cross [the room]743-the room . But [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes stopped [him]2883-her father , not without dignity . “ Better not press it , [Roger]121-roger : another time . ”[121-roger] [Barnes]121-roger laughed , and yielded . [He]2883-her father carried [the child]2941-the child away , murmuring to [her]1180-her grandmother , “ Naughty , naughty ' ittie girl!”—a[2883-her father] remark which [Beatty]246-daphne , tucked under [his]2883-her father ear , and complacently sucking [her]246-daphne thumb , received with complete indifference . “ There , [you]2883-her father see ! ”[1190-the grandmother] said [the grandmother]1190-the grandmother , with slightly flushed cheeks , as the door closed : “ [the child]2941-the child has been already taught to dislike [me]1190-the grandmother , and if [Roger]121-roger had attempted to kiss [me]1190-the grandmother , [she]2941-the child would probably have struck [me]1190-the grandmother . ”[1190-the grandmother] “ Oh , no ! ”[190-mrs. french] cried [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french . “ [She]2941-the child is [a loving little thing]2952-a loving little thing . ”[190-mrs. french] “ Except when [she]2941-the child is jealous , ”[153-lady barnes] said [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes , with significance . “ [I]153-lady barnes told [you]190-mrs. french [she]2941-the child has inherited more than [her]2941-the child eyes . ”[153-lady barnes] [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french rose . [She]190-mrs. french was determined not to discuss [[her]190-mrs. french hostess]1191-her hostess any more , and [she]190-mrs. french walked over to the bow window as though to look at the prospects of the weather , which had threatened rain . But [[Roger]121-roger 's mother]1137-roger 's mother was not to be repressed . Resentment and antagonism , nurtured on a hundred small incidents and trifling jars , and , to begin with , a matter of temperament , had come at last to speech . And in this charming New Englander , [the wife of [[Roger]121-roger 's best friend]1194-roger 's best friend]1193-the wife of roger 's best friend , sympathetic , tender , with a touch in [her]153-lady barnes of [the nun]1195-the nun and the saint , [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes could not help trying to find [a supporter]1196-a supporter . [She]153-lady barnes was [a much weaker person than [her]153-lady barnes square build]1197-a much weaker person than her square build and [her]153-lady barnes double chin would have led [the bystander]1198-the bystander to suppose ; and [her]153-lady barnes feelings had been hurt . So that when [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french returned to say that the sun seemed to be coming out , [[her]190-mrs. french companion]356-her companion , without heeding , went on , with emotion : “ It 's [[my]190-mrs. french son]2953-my son [I]190-mrs. french am thinking of , [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french . [You]190-mrs. french know , when [Roger]121-roger married , [I]190-mrs. french do n't think [he]2953-my son was much in love — in fact , [I]190-mrs. french 'm sure [he]2953-my son was n't . But now — it 's quite different . [Roger]121-roger has a very soft heart , and [he]2953-my son 's very domestic . [He]2953-my son was always [the best of sons to [me]190-mrs. french]2956-the best of sons to me , and as soon as [he]2953-my son was married [he]2953-my son became the best of [husbands]2957-husbands . [The pair]1207-the pair passed the window , absorbed apparently in conversation . [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french escaped . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes was left to discontent and solitude . But the solitude was not for long . When [Elsie]124-french entered , [Daphne]145-daphne was walking up and down in excitement . “ [One]2809-one can not really live with bad pictures because [they]2963-they happen to be [one 's ancestors]2964-one 's ancestors ! It was now [Daphne]145-daphne 's turn to shrug . [She]145-daphne threw [herself]145-daphne into a chair , with very red cheeks , one foot hanging over the other , and the fingers of [her]145-daphne hands , which shone with diamonds , tapping the chair impatiently . [Her]145-daphne dress of a delicate pink , touched here and there with black , [her]145-daphne wide black hat , and the eyes which glowed from the small pointed face beneath it ; the tumbling masses of [her]145-daphne dark hair as contrasted with [her]145-daphne general lightness and slenderness ; the red of the lips , the whiteness of the hands and brow , the dainty irregularity of feature : these things made a Watteau sketch of [her]145-daphne , all pure colour and lissomeness , with dots and scratches of intense black . [Daphne]145-daphne was much handsomer than [she]145-daphne had been as [a girl]308-a girl , but also a trifle less refined . All [her]145-daphne points were intensified — [her]145-daphne eyes had more flame ; the damask of [her]145-daphne cheek was deeper ; [her]145-daphne grace was wilder , [her]145-daphne voice a little shriller than of old . While the uncomfortable silence which [the two women]1220-the two women had made around [them]1220-the two women still lasted , [Roger Barnes]121-roger appeared on [the garden steps]1221-the garden steps . “ Hullo ! any tea going ? ”[1222-he] [He]1222-he came in , without waiting for an answer , looked from [[his]1222-he mother]335-his mother to [Daphne]145-daphne , from [Daphne]145-daphne to [[his]1222-he mother]335-his mother , and laughed uncomfortably . “ Still bothering about those beastly pictures ? ”[1222-he] [he]1222-he said as [he]1222-he helped [himself]1222-he to a cup of tea . “ Thank [you]1222-he , [Roger]121-roger ! ”[153-lady barnes] said [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes . “ [I]1222-he did n't mean any harm , [mother]2693-mother . ”[1222-he] [He]1222-he crossed over to [her]145-daphne and sat down beside [her]145-daphne . “ [I]1222-he say , [Daphne]145-daphne , [I]1222-he 've got an idea . [Daphne]145-daphne , with [her]145-daphne thin arms and hands locked behind [her]145-daphne , paused beside [[her]145-daphne husband]778-her husband . [Dr. Lelius]200-dr. lelius , stealthily raising [his]1225-his eyes , observed [the two]863-the two . A strange little scene — not English at all . [The English]125-the english , [he]1225-his understood , were [a phlegmatic people]1228-a phlegmatic people . What had [this little Southerner]1229-this little southerner to do among [them]125-the english ? And what [sort of fellow]1230-sort of fellow was [the husband]2811-the husband ? [Elsie French]124-french noticed the expertise of [her]124-french talk ; the intellectual development it implied ; the passion of will which accompanied it . “ To the dollar , all things are possible,”—one[124-french] might have phrased it so . The soft September air came in through the open windows , from [a garden]1237-a garden flooded with western sun . [It]2987-this house has many charming points . ”[153-lady barnes] [She]153-lady barnes looked round with a face that had suddenly become coolly critical , an embodied intelligence . [Daphne]145-daphne , as though divining for the first time [a listener worthy of [her]145-daphne steel]1263-a listener worthy of her steel , began to talk with some rapidity of the changes [she]145-daphne wished to make . [She]145-daphne talked with an evident desire to show off , to make an impression . [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile listened attentively , occasionally throwing in a word of criticism or comment , in the softest , gentlest voice . But somehow , whenever [she]203-mrs. fairmile spoke , [Daphne]145-daphne felt vaguely irritated . [She]145-daphne was generally put slightly in the wrong by [[her]145-daphne visitor]1264-her visitor , and [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile 's extraordinary knowledge of [Heston Park]44-heston park , and of everything connected with it , was so odd and disconcerting . [She]203-mrs. fairmile had a laughing way , moreover , of appealing to [Roger Barnes]121-roger [himself]121-roger to support a recollection or an opinion , which presently produced a contraction of [Daphne]145-daphne 's brows . Who was [this woman]1265-this woman ? [A cousin]1266-a cousin — [a cousin who knew every inch of [the house]413-the house , and seemed to be one of [[Roger]121-roger 's closest friends]1269-roger 's closest friends]1267-a cousin who knew every inch of the house , and seemed to be one of roger 's closest friends ? It was really too strange that in all these years [Roger]121-roger should never have said a word about [her]203-mrs. fairmile ! The red mounted in [Daphne]145-daphne 's cheek . [She]145-daphne began , moreover , to feel [herself]145-daphne at a disadvantage to which [she]145-daphne was not accustomed . [Dr. Lelius]200-dr. lelius , meanwhile , turned to [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , whenever [she]203-mrs. fairmile was allowed to speak , with a joyous yet inarticulate deference [he]1270-he had never shown to [[his]1270-he hostess]1271-his hostess . [They]1272-we understood [each other]346-each other at a word or a glance . Beside [them]1272-we [Daphne]145-daphne , with all [her]145-daphne cleverness , soon appeared as [a child for whom one]1274-a child for whom one makes allowances . A vague anger swelled in [her]145-daphne throat . [She]145-daphne noticed , too , [Roger]121-roger 's silence and [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes 's discomfort . There was clearly something here that had been kept from [her]145-daphne — something to be unravelled ! Suddenly [the new - comer]1250-the new - comer rose . [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile wore a dress of some pale grey stuff , cobweb - light and transparent , over a green satin . It had the effect of sea - water , and [her]203-mrs. fairmile grey hat , with its pale green wreath , framed the golden - grey of [her]203-mrs. fairmile hair . Every one of [her]203-mrs. fairmile few adornments was exquisite — so was [her]203-mrs. fairmile grace as [she]203-mrs. fairmile moved . [Daphne]145-daphne 's pink - and - black vivacity beside [her]145-daphne seemed a pinchbeck thing . “ Well , now , when will [you]1272-we all come to [Upcott]48-upcott ? ”[203-mrs. fairmile] [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile said graciously , as [she]203-mrs. fairmile shook hands . “ [The Duchess]3006-the duchess will be enchanted to see [you]1272-we any day , and — ”[203-mrs. fairmile] “ Thank [you]203-mrs. fairmile ! but [we]1272-we really ca n't come so far , ”[203-mrs. fairmile] said a determined voice . “ [We]1272-we have only [a shaky old motor]3015-a shaky old motor — [[our]1272-we new one]3016-our new one is n't ready yet — and besides , [we]1272-we want all [our]1272-we time for [the house]413-the house . ”[203-mrs. fairmile] “ [You]203-mrs. fairmile make [him]542-the speaker work so hard ? ”[203-mrs. fairmile] [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , laughing , pointed to [the speaker]542-the speaker . [One of [the Episcopalian bishops]1310-the episcopalian bishops]1309-one of the episcopalian bishops , however , had preached — in [Westminster Abbey]50-westminster abbey — a remarkable sermon , on a very sad subject , not perhaps a subject to be discussed in [a drawing - room]1311-a drawing - room — but still — Suddenly [the group on the other side of the room]1312-the group on the other side of the room became aware that [the Archdeacon]1288-the archdeacon 's amiable prosing had been sharply interrupted — that [Daphne]145-daphne , not [he]1288-the archdeacon , was holding the field . Meanwhile [Daphne]145-daphne , in [[her]145-daphne own room]1335-her own room , was also employed in meditation . [She]145-daphne had thrown [herself]145-daphne , frowning , into a chair beside a window which overlooked [the park]1292-the park . The landscape had a gentle charm — spreading grass , [low hills]1337-low hills , and scattered woods — under a warm September sun . But it had no particular accent , and [Daphne]145-daphne thought it both tame and depressing ; like [an English society made up of [Archdeacon Mountfords]206-archdeacon mountfords and [[their]206-archdeacon mountfords womenkind]1339-their womenkind]1338-an english society made up of archdeacon mountfords and their womenkind ! [She]145-daphne had behaved badly , of course ; in a few days [she]145-daphne supposed the report of [her]145-daphne outburst would be all over [the place]642-the place . [She]145-daphne did not care . Even for [Roger]121-roger 's sake [she]145-daphne was not going to cringe to these poor provincial standards . BARNES]121-roger , however , made no immediate reference to the matter which was in truth filling [her]145-daphne mind . What did it matter to [her]145-daphne or to anyone that [Chloe Morant]207-chloe morant had made a fool of [him]1352-he ? [His]1352-he recollection of the fooling , at the time [he]1352-he proposed to [Daphne]145-daphne , was still so poignant that it would have been impossible to speak of it . And within a few months afterwards [he]1352-he had practically forgotten it — and [Chloe]207-chloe morant too . Of course [he]1352-he could not see [her]145-daphne again , for the first time , without being “ a bit upset ”[207-chloe morant] ; mostly , indeed , by the boldness — the brazenness — of [her]145-daphne behaviour . But [his]1352-he emotions were of no tragic strength , and , as [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes had complained to [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french , [he]1352-he was now honestly in love with [Daphne]145-daphne and [[his]1352-he child]1355-his child . [They]3060-they do n't get on , and [I]145-daphne suppose [she]208-chloe comes and quarters [herself]208-chloe on [the old Duchess]3061-the old duchess — as [she]208-chloe used to on [us]3060-they . ”[145-daphne] “ [You]145-daphne seem to know all about [her]208-chloe ! [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile — [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile — yes , [I]145-daphne remember , ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne]145-daphne , in a brooding voice , [her]145-daphne cheeks becoming suddenly very red . “ [[Your]145-daphne uncle]2721-your uncle — in [town]3064-town — mentioned [her]208-chloe . [I]145-daphne did n't take any notice . ”[145-daphne] “ Why should [you]145-daphne ? [She]208-chloe does n't matter a fig , either to [you]145-daphne or to [me]145-daphne ! ”[145-daphne] “ It matters to [me]145-daphne very much that [these people who spoke of [her]208-chloe]3065-these people who spoke of her — [[your]145-daphne uncle]2721-your uncle and [the others]572-the others — knew what [I]145-daphne did n't know ! ”[145-daphne] cried [Daphne]145-daphne , passionately . [She]145-daphne stared at [Roger]121-roger , strangely conscious that something epoch - making and decisive had happened . [Roger]121-roger had had a secret from [her]145-daphne all these years — that was what had happened ; and now [she]145-daphne had discovered it . That [he]1360-i could have a secret from [her]145-daphne , however , was the real discovery . [She]145-daphne felt a fierce resentment , and yet a kind of added respect for [him]1360-i . All the time [he]1360-i had been the private owner of thoughts and recollections that [she]145-daphne had no part in , and the fact roused in [her]145-daphne tumult and bitterness . Nevertheless the disturbance which it produced in [her]145-daphne sense of property , the shock and anguish of it , brought back something of the passion of love [she]145-daphne had felt in the first year of [their]1361-their marriage . During these three years [she]145-daphne had more than once shown [herself]145-daphne insanely jealous for the merest trifles . But [Roger]121-roger had always laughed at [her]145-daphne , and [she]145-daphne had ended by laughing at [herself]145-daphne . Yet all the time [he]1360-i had had this secret . [She]145-daphne sat looking at [him]1360-i hard with [her]145-daphne astonishing eyes ; and [he]1360-i grew more and more uneasy . “ Well , [some of [them]3068-some of them]3068-some of them knew , ”[1360-i] [he]1360-i said , answering [her]145-daphne last reproach . “ And [they]3068-some of them knew that [I]1360-i was jolly well quit of [her]145-daphne ! [I]1360-i suppose [I]1360-i ought to have told [you]145-daphne , [Daphne]145-daphne — of course [I]1360-i ought — [I'm]1360-i sorry . But the fact was [I]1360-i never wanted to think of [her]145-daphne again . And [I]1360-i certainly never want to see [her]145-daphne again ! Why , in the name of goodness , did [you]145-daphne accept that tea - fight ? ”[1360-i] “ Because [I]145-daphne mean to go . ”[145-daphne] “ Then [you]145-daphne 'll have to go without [me]145-daphne , ”[145-daphne] was the incautious reply . “ Oh , so [you]145-daphne 're afraid of meeting [her]145-daphne ! [I]145-daphne shall know what to think , if [you]145-daphne do n't go . ”[145-daphne] [Daphne]145-daphne sat erect , [her]145-daphne hands clasped round [her]145-daphne knees . [Roger]121-roger made a sound of wrath , and threw [his]1362-me cigarette into the fire . [He]1363-he gave way at last , and [she]145-daphne allowed [herself]145-daphne to be soothed and caressed . [Roger]121-roger was silent . Suddenly there swept through [him]1363-he the memory of the scene in [the orchard]717-the orchard , and with it an admission — wrung , as it were , from [a wholly unwilling self]1368-a wholly unwilling self — that it had remained for [him]1363-he a scene unique and unapproached . In that one hour the “ muddy vesture ”[1368-a wholly unwilling self] of common feeling and desire that closed in [his]1363-he manhood had taken fire and burnt to a pure flame , fusing , so it seemed , body and soul . [He]1363-he had not thought of it for years , but now that [he]1363-he was made to think of it , the old thrill returned — a memory of something heavenly , ecstatic , far transcending the common hours and [the common earth]1369-the common earth . The next moment [he]1363-he had thrown the recollection angrily from [him]1363-he . Meanwhile a note of invitation had been addressed to [Daphne]145-daphne by [the Duchess]3006-the duchess , and had been accepted ; [Roger]121-roger had been reminded , at the point of the bayonet , that go [he]1377-he must ; and [Dr. Lelius]200-dr. lelius had transferred [himself]200-dr. lelius from [Heston]54-heston to Upcott , and the companionship of [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile . It was the last day of [the Frenches]210-the frenches ' visit . [Roger]121-roger and [Herbert French]187-french had been trying to get a brace or two of partridges on [the long - neglected and much - poached estate]1378-the long - neglected and much - poached estate ; and on the way [home]2690-home [French]187-french expressed a hope that , now [they]1380-they were to settle at [Heston]54-heston , [Roger]121-roger would take up some of the usual duties of [the country gentleman]1381-the country gentleman . [He]1377-he spoke in the half - jesting way characteristic of [the modern Mentor]1382-the modern mentor . [The old didactics]1383-the old didactics have long gone out of fashion , and [the moralist of to - day]1384-the moralist of to - day , instead of preaching , ore retundo , must only “ hint a fault and hesitate dislike . ”[1377-he] But , hide it as [he]1377-he might , there was an ethical and religious passion in [French]187-french that would out , and was soon indeed to drive [him]1377-he from [Eton]17-eton to [a town parish]1385-a town parish . [He]1377-he had been ordained some two years before this date . It was this inborn pastoral gift , just as real as the literary or artistic gifts , and containing the same potentialities of genius as they , which was leading [him]1377-he to feel a deep anxiety about [the Barnes]121-roger 's ménage . It seemed to [him]1377-he necessary that [Daphne]145-daphne should respect [[her]145-daphne husband]778-her husband ; and [Roger]121-roger , in a state of complete idleness , was not altogether respect - able . [The Barnes family]372-the barnes family was tolerable , though not distinguished . [[Roger]121-roger 's father]370-roger 's father 's great temporary success in politics and business had given [it]372-the barnes family a passing splendour , now quenched in the tides of failure and disaster which had finally overwhelmed [his]1398-the young father career . [Roger]121-roger evidently did not want to think much about [his]1398-the young father [Barnes]121-roger heritage . But it was clear also that [he]1398-the young father was proud of [the Trescoes]193-the trescoes ; that [he]1398-the young father had fallen back upon [them]193-the trescoes , so to speak . Since the fifteenth century there had always been [a Trescoe at [Heston]54-heston]1407-a trescoe at heston ; and [Roger]121-roger had already taken to browsing in county histories and sorting family letters . [French]187-french foresaw a double - barrelled surname before long — perhaps , just in time for the advent of [the future son]1408-the future son and heir who was already [a personage in the mind]1409-a personage in the mind , if not yet positively expected . “ [[My]1398-the young father dear fellow]3115-my dear fellow , [I]1398-the young father hope [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger will give [you]3115-my dear fellow not [one son]3116-one son , but many ! ”[1398-the young father] [he]1398-the young father said , in answer to [[his]1398-the young father companion]317-his companion 's outburst . “ [They]3117-they 're wanted nowadays . ”[1398-the young father] [Roger]121-roger nodded and smiled , and then passed on to the discussion of county business and [county people]1411-county people . [He]1398-the young father had already , it seemed , informed [himself]1398-the young father to a rather surprising degree . [The shrewd , upright county gentleman]1412-the shrewd , upright county gentleman was beginning to emerge , oddly , from [the Apollo]134-apollo . The merits and absurdities of the type were already there , indeed , in posse . How persistent was the type , and the instinct ! [A man of [Roger]121-roger]1413-a man of roger 's antecedents might seem to swerve from the course ; but the smallest favourable variation of circumstances , and there [he]1398-the young father was again on the track , trotting happily between the shafts . “ If only [the wife]795-the wife plays up ! ”[187-french] thought [French]187-french . The recollection of [Daphne]145-daphne , indeed , emerged simultaneously in both minds . “ [Daphne]145-daphne , [you]145-daphne know , wo n't be able to stand this all the year round , ”[121-roger] said [Roger]121-roger . “ By [George]130-washington , no ! not with a waggon - load of [Leliuses]212-leliuses ! ”[121-roger] Then , with a sudden veer and a flush : “ [I]121-roger say , [French]187-french , do [you]187-french know what sort of state the Fairmile marriage is in by now ? It was the first time , as far as [he]187-french was concerned , that [Roger]121-roger had referred to the incident . Yet the tone of [the questioner]730-the questioner implied a past history . It was to [him]187-french , indeed , that [Roger]121-roger had come , in the first bitterness of [his]187-french young grief and anger , after the “ jilting . ”[187-french] [French]187-french had tried to help [him]187-french , only to find that [he]187-french was no more a match for [the lady]393-the lady than [the rest of [the world]319-the world]1417-the rest of the world . As to the call and the invitation , [he]187-french agreed heartily that [a person of delicacy]1419-a person of delicacy would have omitted them . The Fairmile marriage , it was generally rumoured , had broken down hopelessly . “ Faults on both sides , of course . [Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile is and always was [an unscrupulous beggar]3120-an unscrupulous beggar ! [He]3120-an unscrupulous beggar left [Eton]17-eton just as [you]187-french came , but [I]121-roger remember [him]3120-an unscrupulous beggar well . ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger began a sentence to the effect that if [Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile had no scruples of [his]187-french own , [Chloe]208-chloe would scarcely have taught [him]187-french any ; but [he]187-french checked [himself]187-french abruptly in the middle , and [the two men]1420-the two men passed to other topics . [French]187-french began to talk of [East London]59-east london , and [the parish [he]187-french was to have [there]610-there]1421-the parish he was to have there . [Roger]121-roger , indifferent at first , did not remain so . [He]187-french did not profess , indeed , any enthusiasm of humanity ; but [French]187-french found in [him]187-french new curiosities . That [children]2775-children should starve , and slave , and suffer — that moved [him]187-french . [He]187-french was , at any rate , for hanging [the parents]1424-the parents . The day of the Upcott visit came , and , in spite of all recalcitrance , [Roger]121-roger was made to mount the motor beside [[his]187-french wife]1168-his wife . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes had entirely refused to go , and [Mr.]1426-mr. and [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french had departed that morning for [Eton]17-eton . As the thing was inevitable , [Roger]121-roger 's male philosophy came to [his]187-french aid . Better laugh and have done with it . So that , as [he]187-french and [Daphne]145-daphne sped along [the autumn lanes]1427-the autumn lanes , [he]187-french talked about anything and everything . [He]187-french expressed , for instance , [his]187-french friendly admiration for [Elsie French]124-french . “ [She]124-french 's just [the wife for [old Herbert]187-french]3121-the wife for old herbert — and , by [George]130-washington , [she]124-french 's in love with [him]187-french ! ”[187-french] “ A great deal too much in love with [him]187-french ! ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne]145-daphne , sharply . The day was chilly , with a strong east wind blowing , and [Daphne]145-daphne 's small figure and face were enveloped in a marvellous wrap , compounded in equal proportions portions of Russian sables and white cloth . It had not long arrived from [Worth]60-worth , and [Roger]121-roger had allowed [himself]121-roger some jibes as to its probable cost . [Daphne]145-daphne 's “ simplicity , ”[145-daphne] the pose of [her]145-daphne girlhood , was in fact breaking down in all directions . The arrogant spending instinct had gained upon the moderating and self - restraining instinct . The results often made [Barnes]121-roger uncomfortable . But [he]187-french was inarticulate , and easily intimidated — by [Daphne]145-daphne . With regard to [Mrs. French]190-mrs. french , however , [he]187-french took up the cudgels at once . Why should n't [Elsie]124-french adore [[her]124-french man]1428-her man , if it pleased [her]124-french ? [Old Herbert]213-old herbert was worth it . [Women]299-women , said [Daphne]145-daphne , should never put [themselves]299-women wholly in [a man]2682-a man 's power . Moreover , wifely adoration was particularly bad for [clergymen]1431-clergymen , who were far too much inclined already to give [themselves]1431-clergymen airs . “ [I]145-daphne say ! [Herbert]213-old herbert never gives [himself]213-old herbert airs ! ”[145-daphne] “ [They]3122-they both did — to [me]145-daphne . [They]3122-they have quite different ways from [us]3123-we , and [they]3122-they make [one]2809-one feel it . [They]3122-they have family prayers — [we]3123-we do n't . [They]3122-they have ascetic ideas about bringing up [children]2775-children — [I]145-daphne have n't . [Elsie]124-french would think it self - indulgent and abominable to stay in bed to breakfast — [I]145-daphne do n't . The fact is , all [her]124-french interests and ideals are quite different from mine , and [I]145-daphne am rather tired of being made to feel inferior . ”[145-daphne] “ [Daphne]145-daphne ! what rubbish ! [I]145-daphne 'm certain [Elsie French]124-french never had such an idea in [her]124-french head . [She]124-french 's awfully soft and nice ; [I]145-daphne never saw a bit of conceit in [her]124-french . ”[145-daphne] “ [She]124-french 's soft outside and steel inside . Well , never mind ! [we]3123-we do n't get on . [She]124-french 's [the old America]3126-the old america , [I]145-daphne 'm the new , ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne]145-daphne , half frowning , half laughing ; “ and [I]145-daphne 'm as good as [she]124-french . ”[145-daphne] “ [You]145-daphne 're [a very good - looking woman]3127-a very good - looking woman , anyway , ”[121-roger] said [Roger]121-roger , admiring the vision of [her]145-daphne among the warm browns and shining whites of [her]145-daphne wrap . “ Much better - looking than when [I]1432-him married [you]145-daphne . ”[1432-him] [He]1432-him slipped an arm under the cloak and gave [her]145-daphne small waist a squeeze . [Daphne]145-daphne turned [her]145-daphne eyes upon [him]1432-him . In their black depths [his]1432-him touch had roused a passion which was by no means all tenderness . There was in it something threatening , something intensely and inordinately possessive . “ That means that [you]1432-him did n't think [me]145-daphne good - looking at all , as compared with — [Chloe]208-chloe ? ”[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne said insistently . “ Really , [Daphne!”—Roger]214-daphne!”—roger[145-daphne] withdrew [his]1432-him arm with a rather angry laugh—“the way [you]145-daphne twist what one says ! [I]145-daphne declare [I]145-daphne wo n't make [you]145-daphne any more pretty speeches for an age . ”[145-daphne] [Daphne]145-daphne scarcely replied ; but there dawned on [her]145-daphne face the smile — melting , provocative , intent — which is the natural weapon of such a temperament . With a quick movement [she]145-daphne nestled to [[her]145-daphne husband]778-her husband 's side , and [Roger]121-roger was soon appeased . The visit which followed always counted in [Roger Barnes]121-roger 's memory as the first act of the tragedy , the first onset of the evil that engulfed [him]1432-him . [They]1434-they found [the old Duchess]3061-the old duchess , [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , and [Dr. Lelius]200-dr. lelius , alone . [The Duchess]3006-the duchess had been [the penniless daughter of [an Irish clergyman]1438-an irish clergyman , married en secondes noces for [her]3006-the duchess somewhat queer and stimulating personality , by [an epicurean duke]1439-an epicurean duke , who , after having provided [the family]375-the family with a sufficient store of [dull children]1441-dull children by [an aristocratic mother]1442-an aristocratic mother]1437-the penniless daughter of an irish clergyman , married en secondes noces for her somewhat queer and stimulating personality , by an epicurean duke , who , after having provided the family with a sufficient store of dull children by an aristocratic mother , thought [himself]1439-an epicurean duke at liberty , in [his]1439-an epicurean duke declining years , to please [himself]1439-an epicurean duke . [He]1439-an epicurean duke had left [her]3006-the duchess [the dower - house]1443-the dower - house — small but delicately Jacobean — and [she]3006-the duchess was now nearly as old as [the Duke]1444-the duke had been when [he]1439-an epicurean duke married [her]3006-the duchess . [She]3006-the duchess was largely made , shapeless , and untidy . [Her]3006-the duchess mannish face and head were tied up in a kind of lace coif ; [she]3006-the duchess had long since abandoned all thought of a waist ; and [her]3006-the duchess strong chin rested on an ample bosom . Amused curiosity , first . Evidently [Daphne]145-daphne represented to [her]145-daphne one of [the queer , crude types that modern society]1449-the queer , crude types that modern society is always throwing up on the shores of life — like strange beasts from [deep - sea soundings]1450-deep - sea soundings . It was in some such way , no doubt — so [Lelius]200-dr. lelius guessed — that [the Duchess]3006-the duchess 's thoughts were running . Meanwhile [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger was treated with all possible civility . Why had [she]145-daphne never been told of this thing ? When [they]1509-we were once more alone together , speeding through the bright sunset air , [each]1510-each found [the other]314-the other on edge . “ [You]145-daphne were rather rough on [the Duchess]3006-the duchess , [Daphne]145-daphne ! ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger protested . “ It was n't quite nice , was it , outbidding [her]3006-the duchess like that in [[her]3006-the duchess own house]3151-her own house ? ”[145-daphne] [Daphne]145-daphne flared up at once , declaring that [she]145-daphne wanted no lessons in deportment from [him]1512-his or [anyone else]1513-anyone else , and then demanding fiercely what was the meaning of [his]1512-his two disappearances with [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile . But in the dead of night [Daphne]145-daphne sat up in bed , looking at the face and head of [[her]145-daphne husband]778-her husband beside [her]145-daphne on the pillow . [He]778-her husband lay peacefully sleeping , the noble outline of brow and features still nobler in the dim light which effaced all the weaker , emptier touches . [Daphne]145-daphne felt rising within [her]145-daphne that mingled passion of [the jealous woman]1515-the jealous woman , which is half love , half hate , of which [she]145-daphne had felt the first stirrings in [her]145-daphne early jealousy of [Elsie Maddison]174-elsie maddison . It was the clutch of something racial and inherited — a something which [the Northerner]1516-the northerner hardly knows . [She]145-daphne had felt it before on one or two occasions , but not with this intensity . [She]145-daphne was very sure [they]1520-they had not been [ordinary conversations!—Mrs]1521-ordinary conversations!—mrs . [Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile was not the person to waste [her]145-daphne time in chit - chat . A gust of violence swept through [her]145-daphne . [She]145-daphne had given [Roger]121-roger everything — money , ease , amusement . Where would [he]778-her husband have been without [her]145-daphne ? And [[his]778-her husband mother]335-his mother , [too?—tiresome , obstructive woman]1523-too?—tiresome , obstructive woman ! For the first time that veil of the unspoken , that mist of loving illusion which preserves all human relations , broke down between [Daphne]145-daphne and [her]145-daphne marriage . [Her]145-daphne thoughts dwelt , in a vulgar detail , on the money [she]145-daphne had settled upon [Roger]121-roger — on [his]778-her husband tendencies to extravagance — [his]778-her husband happy - go - lucky self - confident ways . [He]778-her husband would have been [a pauper]2849-a pauper but for [her]145-daphne ; but now that [he]778-her husband had [her]145-daphne money safe , without a word to [her]145-daphne of [his]778-her husband previous engagement , no doubt [he]778-her husband and [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile supposed [they]1525-they might do as [they]1525-they pleased . The heat and corrosion of this idea spread through [her]145-daphne being , and the will made no fight against it . “ [YOU'RE]208-chloe off to the meet ? ”[208-chloe] “ [I]208-chloe am . A mild November sun shone on [the garden]2727-the garden and [the woods]602-the woods , and [Chloe]208-chloe 's face — the more exquisite as a rule for its slight , strange withering — had caught a freshness from the morning . [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile was soon riding alone , without [a groom]1541-a groom — [she]203-mrs. fairmile was [an excellent horsewoman]1542-an excellent horsewoman , and [she]203-mrs. fairmile never gave any unnecessary trouble to [[[her]203-mrs. fairmile friends]1543-her friends ' servants]1544-her friends ' servants — through [country lanes chequered with pale sun]1545-country lanes chequered with pale sun . As for [the Duchess]3006-the duchess 's attack upon [her]203-mrs. fairmile , [Chloe]208-chloe smarted . [The Duchess]3006-the duchess had clearly pulled [her]203-mrs. fairmile up , and [Chloe]208-chloe was not [a person who took it well]1548-a person who took it well . If [[Roger]121-roger 's American wife]1549-roger 's american wife was by now wildly jealous of [[his]1550-his old fiancée]1551-his old fiancée , whose fault was it ? Had not [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger [herself]121-roger thrown [them]1552-them perpetually together ? Dinners at Upcott!—invitations to [Heston!—a]225-heston!—a resolute frequenting of the same festal gatherings with [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile . None of it with [Roger]121-roger 's goodwill , or [[his]1550-his mother's,—Chloe]1553-his mother's,—chloe admitted it . It had been [the wife]795-the wife 's doing — all of it . There had been even — rare occurrences — two or three balls in [the neighbourhood]1460-the neighbourhood . [Roger]121-roger hated dancing , but [Daphne]145-daphne had made [him]1550-his go to [them]1556-them all . Merely that [she]145-daphne might display [her]145-daphne eyes , [her]145-daphne diamonds , and [her]145-daphne gowns ? Not at all . The real psychology of it was plain . “ [She]145-daphne wishes to keep [us]3178-us under observation — to give [us]3178-us opportunities — and then torment [[her]145-daphne husband]778-her husband . The gossip of [the neighbourhood]1460-the neighbourhood had been no doubt a good deal roused ; and [Daphne]145-daphne , it seemed , was discontented . But is it not good for [such people]1558-such people to be discontented ? The money and the arrogance of [[Roger]121-roger 's wife]1559-roger 's wife had provoked [Roger]121-roger 's former fiancée from the beginning ; the money to envy , and the arrogance to chastisement . Why not ? What is society but a discipline ? As for [Roger]121-roger , who is it says there is a little polygamy in [all men]484-all men ? Anyway , [a man]2682-a man can always — nearly always — keep a corner for [the old love]1562-the old love , if the new love will let [him]2682-a man . [Roger]121-roger could , at any rate ; “ though [he]2682-a man is [a model husband]3181-a model husband , far better than [she]208-chloe deserves , and [anybody not a fool]3182-anybody not a fool could manage [him]2682-a man . ”[121-roger] It was a day of physical delight , especially for [riders]1563-riders . After a warm October , the leaves were still thick on the trees ; [Nature]136-nature had not yet resigned [herself]136-nature to death and sleep . Here and there an oak stood , fully green , among the tawny reds and golds of [a flaming woodland]1564-a flaming woodland . The gorse was yellow on [the commons]1565-the commons ; and in [the damp woody ways through which [Chloe]208-chloe passed]1566-the damp woody ways through which chloe passed , a few primroses — frail , unseasonable blooms — pushed their pale heads through the moss . The scent of the beech - leaves under foot ; the buffeting of a westerly wind ; the pleasant yielding of [her]208-chloe light frame to the movement of the horse ; the glimpses of plain that every here and there showed [themselves]1567-themselves through the trees that girdled the high ground or edge along which [she]208-chloe rode ; the white steam - wreath of [a train]463-a train passing , far away , through strata of blue or pearly mist ; an old windmill black in the middle distance ; [villages]1569-villages , sheltering among [their]1569-villages hedges and uplands ; a sky , of shadow below widely brooding over earth , and of a radiant blue flecked with white cloud above:—all the English familiar scene , awoke in [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe a familiar sensuous joy . Life was so good — every minute , every ounce of it!—from [the Duchess]3006-the duchess 's chef to these ethereal splendours of autumn — from the warm bath , the luxurious bed , and breakfast , [she]208-chloe had but lately enjoyed , to these artistic memories that ran through [her]208-chloe brain , as [she]208-chloe glanced from side to side , reminded now of [Turner]226-turner , now of [De Wint]227-de wint , revelling in the complexity of [her]208-chloe own being . [Her]208-chloe conscience gave [her]208-chloe no trouble ; it had never been more friendly . [[Her]208-chloe husband]778-her husband and [she]208-chloe had come to an understanding ; [they]1572-they were in truth more than quits . There was to be no divorce — and no scandal . [She]208-chloe would be very prudent . [A man]2682-a man 's face rose before [her]208-chloe that was not the face of [[her]208-chloe husband]778-her husband , and [she]208-chloe smiled — indulgently . Yes , life would be interesting when [she]208-chloe returned to [town]3064-town . Meanwhile , [she]208-chloe was passing the time . A thought suddenly occurred to [her]208-chloe . [The place appointed]1577-the place appointed was [a long way from [Heston]54-heston]1578-a long way from heston , but in the old days [he]2682-a man had often sent on a fresh horse by [train]1579-train to [a local station]1100-a local station . And then a look in the fine hazel eyes — like a horse putting back its ears . But it was the second tête - à - tête that was really adroit ! [Poor Roger]231-roger ! As to more recent adventures . If [people]2726-people meet in society , [they]2726-people must be civil ; and if [old friends]1598-old friends meet at a dance , there is [an institution known as “ sitting out ”]3192-an institution known as “ sitting out ”[3192-an institution known as “ sitting out ”] ; and “ sitting out ”[3192-an institution known as “ sitting out ”] is nothing if not conversational ; and conversation — between [old friends]1598-old friends and [cousins]3033-cousins — is beguiling , and may be lengthy . Since then , no communication between [Heston]54-heston and [Upcott]48-upcott . [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile was now a couple of miles from [the meet]1602-the meet . The wind had slightly reddened [her]203-mrs. fairmile pale skin : [her]203-mrs. fairmile expression was one of great animation , yet of great softness . Poor Roger!—had [he]1613-the man in front been living too well and idling too flagrantly on these American dollars ? Suddenly [she]208-chloe bent over and laid a gloved hand on [his]1613-the man in front arm . “ Had n't it ? ”[208-chloe] [she]208-chloe said , in a low voice . [He]1613-the man in front started . [[My]208-chloe dear]2812-my dear [Roger]121-roger , if [I]208-chloe hadn't — well , let 's talk plainly!—if [I]208-chloe had n't thrown [you]121-roger over , where would [you]121-roger be now ?
