[She]208-chloe laughed again . “ Well , [we]3207-we ca n't argue it — can [we]3207-we ? [I]208-chloe only wanted to point out to [you]208-chloe the plain , bare truth , that there is nothing in [the world]319-the world to prevent [our]3207-we being [excellent friends]3209-excellent friends again — now . But first — and once more — [my]208-chloe letters ! ”[208-chloe] [Her]208-chloe tone was a little peremptory , and [Roger]121-roger 's face clouded . “ [I]208-chloe found two of them last night , by the merest chance — in an old despatch - box [I]208-chloe took to [America]7-america . [They]3210-they were posted to [you]1617-he on the way [here]2658-here . ”[208-chloe] “ Good ! But there were three . ”[208-chloe] “ [I]208-chloe know — so [you]1617-he said . [I]208-chloe could only find two . ”[208-chloe] “ Was the particular letter [I]1617-he mentioned one of [them]3210-they ? ”[1617-he] [He]1617-he answered unwillingly . “ No . [I]1617-he searched everywhere . [I]1617-he do n't believe [I]1617-he have it . ”[1617-he] [She]208-chloe shook [her]208-chloe head with decision . “ [You]1617-he certainly have it . Please look again . ”[1617-he] [He]1617-he broke out with some irritation , insisting that if it had not been returned it had been either lost or destroyed . It could matter to [no one]2907-no one . Some snaring , entangling instinct — an instinct of [the hunter]1619-the hunter — made [her]208-chloe persist . [She]208-chloe must have it . It was a point of honour . “ [Poor Theresa]233-poor theresa is so unhappy , so pursued ! [You]1617-he saw that odious paragraph last week ? [I]1617-he ca n't run the risk ! ”[1617-he] With a groan of annoyance , [he]1617-he promised at last that [he]1617-he would look again . Then the sparkling eyes changed , the voice softened . [She]208-chloe praised — [she]208-chloe rewarded [him]1617-he . By smooth transitions [she]208-chloe slipped into ordinary talk ; of [his]1617-he candidature for [the County Council]1620-the county council — the points of the great horse [he]1617-he rode — the gossip of [the neighbourhood]1460-the neighbourhood — the charms of [Beatty]246-daphne . And on this last topic [he]1617-he , too , suddenly found [his]1617-he tongue . The cloud — of awkwardness , or of something else not to be analysed — broke away , and [he]1617-he began to talk , and presently to ask questions , with readiness , even with eagerness . Was it right to be so very strict with [children?—babies under three]1622-children?—babies under three ? Was n't it ridiculous to expect [them]1622-children?—babies under three not to be naughty or greedy ? Why , [every child]1623-every child wanted as much sweetstuff as it could tuck in ! Quite right too — [doctors]3104-doctors said it was good for [them]1622-children?—babies under three . But [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer — “ Who is [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer ? ”[203-mrs. fairmile] inquired [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile . [She]208-chloe was riding close beside [him]1617-he — an embodied friendliness — [a soft and womanly Chloe]1625-a soft and womanly chloe , very different from the old . “ [She]208-chloe 's [the nurse]3212-the nurse ; [[my]1617-he mother]2684-my mother found [her]208-chloe . [She]208-chloe 's [a lady]3214-a lady — by way of — [she]208-chloe does n't do any rough work — and [I]1617-he dare say [she]208-chloe 's the newest thing out . But [she]208-chloe 's too tight a hand for [my]1617-he taste . [I]1617-he say!—what do [you]3215-you think of this ! [She]208-chloe would n't let [Beattie]235-beattie come down to [the drawing - room]768-the drawing - room yesterday , because [she]208-chloe cried for a sweet ! Was n't that devilish ! ”[1617-he] [He]1617-he brought [his]1617-he hand down fiercely on [his]1617-he thigh . “ [A Gorgon]3217-a gorgon ! ”[203-mrs. fairmile] said [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , raising [her]203-mrs. fairmile eyebrows . “ Any other qualifications ? French ? German ? ”[203-mrs. fairmile] “ Not a word . Not [she]208-chloe ! [[Her]208-chloe people]2755-her people live somewhere near here , [I]121-roger believe . ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger looked vaguely round [him]1617-he . “ [[Her]208-chloe father]2883-her father managed [a brick - field]3220-a brick - field on [this estate]3221-this estate — [some parson or other]3222-some parson or other recommended [her]208-chloe to [mother]2693-mother . ”[121-roger] “ And [you]121-roger do n't like [her]208-chloe ? ”[203-mrs. fairmile] “ Well , no — [I]1617-he do n't ! [She]208-chloe 's not the kind of woman [I]1617-he want . ”[1617-he] [He]1617-he blurted it out , adding hurriedly , “ But [[my]1617-he wife]3224-my wife thinks a lot of [her]208-chloe . ”[1617-he] [Chloe]208-chloe dismissed the topic of [the nurse]3212-the nurse , but still let [him]1617-he run on about [the child]2941-the child . Amazing!—this development of paternity in [the careless , handsome youth of three years before]1628-the careless , handsome youth of three years before . [She]208-chloe was amused and bored by it . But [her]208-chloe permission of it had thawed [him]1617-he — that [she]208-chloe saw . Presently , from [the child]2941-the child [she]208-chloe led [him]1617-he on to common acquaintance — [old friends]1598-old friends — and talk flowed fast . [She]208-chloe made [him]1617-he laugh ; and the furrows in the young brow disappeared . Now as always [they]1631-they understood [each other]346-each other at a word ; there was between [them]1631-they the freemasonry of [persons sprung from the same world and the same tradition]1633-persons sprung from the same world and the same tradition ; [his]1617-he daily talk with [Daphne]145-daphne had never this easy , slipping pleasure . Meanwhile the horses sauntered on , unconsciously held back ; and the magical autumn wood , its lights and lines and odours , played upon [their]1631-they senses . At last [Roger]121-roger with a start perceived a gate in front . [He]1617-he looked at [his]1617-he watch , and [she]208-chloe saw [him]1617-he redden . “ [We]1631-they shall be late for the meet . ”[1617-he] [His]1617-he eyes avoided [hers]208-chloe . [He]1617-he gathered up the reins , evidently conscious . Smiling , [she]208-chloe let [him]1617-he open the gate for [her]208-chloe , and then as [they]1631-they passed into [the road]1634-the road , shadowed with overarching trees , [she]208-chloe reined in [Whitefoot]236-whitefoot , and bending forward , held out [her]208-chloe hand . “ Good - bye ! ”[208-chloe] “ [You]1617-he 're not coming ? ”[208-chloe] “ [I]208-chloe think [I]208-chloe 've had enough . [I]208-chloe 'll go [home]2690-home . Good - bye . ”[208-chloe] It was a relief . In both minds had risen the image of [their]1631-they arrival together — amid [the crowd of the meet]1635-the crowd of the meet . As [he]1617-he looked at [her]208-chloe — gratefully fully — the grace of [her]208-chloe movement , the temptation of [her]208-chloe eyes , the rush of old memories suddenly turned [his]1617-he head . [He]1617-he gripped [her]208-chloe hand hard for a minute , staring at [her]208-chloe . [The road in front of [them]1631-they]1636-the road in front of them was quite empty . But fifty yards behind [them]1631-they was [a small redbrick house buried in trees]1637-a small redbrick house buried in trees . As [they]1631-they still paused , hand in hand , in front of the gate into the wood , which had failed to swing back and remained half open , the garden door of [this house]2987-this house unclosed and [a young woman in a kind of uniform]1639-a young woman in a kind of uniform stepped into [the road]1634-the road . [She]208-chloe perceived [the two riders]1641-the two riders — stopped in astonishment — observed [them]1641-the two riders unseen , and walked quickly away in the direction of [the station]1642-the station . [Roger]121-roger reached [Heston]54-heston that night only just in time to dress for dinner . By this time [he]1617-he was in a wholly different mood ; angry with [himself]1617-he , and full of rueful thought about [[his]1617-he wife]1168-his wife . [Daphne]145-daphne and [he]1617-he had been getting on anything but well for some time past . [He]1617-he knew that [he]1617-he had several times behaved badly ; why , indeed , that very afternoon , had [he]1617-he held [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe 's hand in [the public road]1644-the public road , like [an idiot]2853-an idiot ? Suppose [anyone]2876-anyone had passed ? It was only [Daphne]145-daphne 's tempers and the discomfort at [home]2690-home that made an hour with [Chloe]208-chloe so pleasant — and brought the old recollections back . [He]1617-he vowed [he]1617-he never thought of [her]208-chloe , except when [she]208-chloe was there to make a fool of [him]1617-he — or plague [him]1617-he about those beastly letters . [Whereas Daphne]145-daphne — [Daphne]145-daphne was always in [his]1617-he mind , and this eclipse into which [their]1648-their daily life had passed . [He]1617-he seemed to be always tripping and stumbling , like [a lame man among loose stones]1649-a lame man among loose stones ; doing or saying what [he]1617-he did not mean to do or say , and tongue - tied when [he]1617-he should have spoken . [Daphne]145-daphne 's jealousy made [him]1617-he ridiculous ; [he]1617-he resented it hotly ; yet [he]1617-he knew [he]1617-he was not altogether blameless . If only something could be done to make [Daphne]145-daphne like [Heston]54-heston and [the neighbours]1650-the neighbours ! But [he]1617-he saw plainly enough that in spite of all the effort and money [she]145-daphne was pouring out upon [the house]413-the house , it gave [her]145-daphne very little pleasure in return . [Her]145-daphne heart was not in it . And as for [the neighbours]1650-the neighbours , [she]145-daphne had scarcely a good word now for [any of [them]1650-the neighbours]1653-any of them . [Jolly!—just]237-jolly!—just as [he]1617-he was going to stand for [the County Council]55-the county council , with an idea of Parliament later on ! And as for what [he]1617-he wished — what would be good for [him]1617-he — that [she]145-daphne never seemed to think of . And , really , some of the things [she]145-daphne said now and then about money — [nobody with the spirit of a mouse]1654-nobody with the spirit of a mouse could stand them . To comfort [his]1617-he worries [he]1617-he went first of all to [the nursery]1655-the nursery , where [he]1617-he found [the nursery - maid in charge]1656-the nursery - maid in charge , and [the child]2941-the child already asleep . [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer , it appeared , had been enjoying a “ day off , ”[1617-he] and was not expected back till late . [He]1617-he knelt down beside [the little girl]1658-the little girl , feeding [his]1617-he eyes upon [her]1658-the little girl . [She]1658-the little girl lay with [her]1658-the little girl delicate face pressed into the pillow , the small neck visible under the cloud of hair , one hand , the soft palm uppermost , on the sheet . [He]1617-he bent down and kissed the hand , glad that [the sharp - faced nurse]1659-the sharp - faced nurse was not there to see . The touch of the fragrant skin thrilled [him]1617-he with pride and joy ; so did the lovely defencelessness of [the child]2941-the child 's sleep . That such a possession should have been given to [him]1617-he , to guard and cherish ! There was in [his]1617-he mind a passionate vow to guard the little thing — aye , with [his]1617-he life - blood ; and then a movement of laughter at [his]1617-he own heroics . [Well!—Daphne]238-well!—daphne might give [him]1617-he [sons]1661-sons — but [he]1617-he did not suppose [any other child]1662-any other child could ever be quite the same to [him]1617-he as [Beatty]246-daphne . [He]1617-he sat in a contented silence , feeding [his]1617-he eyes upon [her]1658-the little girl , as the soft breath rose and fell . And as [he]1617-he did so , [his]1617-he temper softened and warmed towards [[Beatty]246-daphne 's mother]1663-beatty 's mother . A little later [he]1617-he found [Daphne]145-daphne in [[her]145-daphne room]1664-her room , already dressed for dinner . [He]1617-he approached [her]145-daphne uneasily . “ How tired [you]145-daphne look , [Daphne]145-daphne ! What have [you]145-daphne been doing to [yourself]145-daphne ? ”[1617-he] [Daphne]145-daphne stiffly pointed out that [she]145-daphne had been standing over [the workmen]1665-the workmen all day , there being [no one else]1666-no one else to stand over [them]1665-the workmen , and of course [she]145-daphne was tired . [Her]145-daphne manner would have provoked [him]1617-he but for the visiting of an inward compunction . Instead of showing annoyance [he]1617-he bent down and kissed [her]145-daphne . “ [I]1617-he 'll stay and help to - morrow , if [you]145-daphne want [me]1617-he , though [you]145-daphne know [I]1617-he 'm no good . [I]1617-he say , how much more are [you]145-daphne going to do to [the house]413-the house ? ”[1617-he] [Daphne]145-daphne looked at [him]1617-he coldly . [She]145-daphne had not returned the kiss . “ Of course , [I]145-daphne know that [you]1617-he do n't appreciate in the least what [I]145-daphne am doing ! ”[145-daphne] [Roger]121-roger thrust [his]1617-he hands into [his]1617-he pockets , and walked up and down uncomfortably . [He]1617-he thought , in fact , that [Daphne]145-daphne was spoiling [the dear nondescript old place]1667-the dear nondescript old place , and [he]1617-he knew that [the neighbourhood]1460-the neighbourhood thought so too . Also [he]1617-he particularly disliked [the young architect who was superintending the works ( “ a priggish ass , ”[1669-the young architect who was superintending the works ( “ a priggish ass , ” who gave himself abominable airs — except to daphne , whom he slavishly obeyed , and to miss farmer , with whom roger had twice caught him gossiping )] who gave [himself]1669-the young architect who was superintending the works ( “ a priggish ass , ” who gave himself abominable airs — except to daphne , whom he slavishly obeyed , and to miss farmer , with whom roger had twice caught him gossiping ) abominable airs — except to [Daphne]145-daphne , whom [he]1617-he slavishly obeyed , and to [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer , with whom [Roger]121-roger had twice caught [him]1617-he gossiping )]1669-the young architect who was superintending the works ( “ a priggish ass , ” who gave himself abominable airs — except to daphne , whom he slavishly obeyed , and to miss farmer , with whom roger had twice caught him gossiping ) . But [he]1617-he was determined not to anger [[his]1617-he wife]1168-his wife , and [he]1617-he held [his]1617-he tongue . “ [I]1617-he wish , anyway , [you]145-daphne would n't stick at it so closely , ”[1617-he] [he]1617-he said discontentedly . “ Let 's go abroad somewhere for Christmas — [Nice]73-nice , or [Monte Carlo]74-monte carlo . [I]1617-he am sure [you]145-daphne want a change . ”[1617-he] “ Well , it is n't exactly [an enchanting neighbourhood]3227-an enchanting neighbourhood , ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne]145-daphne , with pinched lips . “ [I]121-roger 'm awfully sorry [you]145-daphne do n't like [the people here]3228-the people here , ”[121-roger] said [Roger]121-roger , perplexed . “ [I]121-roger dare say [they]3228-the people here 're [all stupids]3229-all stupids . ”[121-roger] “ That would n't matter — if [they]3228-the people here behaved decently , ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne]145-daphne , flushing . “ [I]121-roger suppose that means — if [I]121-roger behaved decently ! ”[121-roger] cried [Roger]121-roger , turning upon [her]145-daphne . [Daphne]145-daphne faced [him]1671-i , [her]145-daphne head in air , [her]145-daphne small foot beating the ground , in a trick it had . “ Well , [I]145-daphne 'm not likely to forget the Brendon ball , am [I]145-daphne ? ”[145-daphne] [Roger]121-roger 's look changed . “ [I]1671-i meant no harm , and [you]145-daphne know [I]1671-i did n't , ”[1671-i] [he]1671-i said sulkily . “ Oh , no , [you]145-daphne only made a laughing - stock of [me]1671-i ! ”[1671-i] [Daphne]145-daphne turned on [her]145-daphne heel . Suddenly [she]145-daphne felt [herself]145-daphne roughly caught in [Roger]121-roger 's arms . “ [Daphne]145-daphne , what is the matter ? Why ca n't [we]3230-we be happy together ? ”[145-daphne] “ Ask [yourself]121-roger , ”[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne said , trying to extricate [herself]145-daphne , and not succeeding . “ [I]121-roger do n't like [the people here]3228-the people here , and [they]3228-the people here do n't like [me]121-roger . But as [you]121-roger seem to enjoy flirting with [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , there 's [one person]458-one person satisfied . ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger laughed — not agreeably . “ [I]121-roger shall soon think , [Daphne]145-daphne , that [somebody]2720-somebody 's ‘ put a spell on [you]145-daphne , ’ as [[my]121-roger old nurse]3234-my old nurse used to say . [I]121-roger wish [I]121-roger knew what [I]121-roger could do to break it . ”[121-roger] [She]145-daphne lay passive in [his]1672-his arms a moment , and then [he]1672-his felt a shiver run through [her]145-daphne , and saw that [she]145-daphne was crying . [He]1672-his held [her]145-daphne close to [him]1672-his , kissing and comforting [her]145-daphne , while [his]1672-his own eyes were wet . What [her]145-daphne emotion meant , or [his]1672-his own , [he]1672-his could not have told clearly ; but it was a moment for both of healing , of impulsive return , the one to the other , unspoken penitence on [her]145-daphne side , a hidden self - blame on [his]1672-his . [She]145-daphne clung to [him]1672-his fiercely , courting the pressure of [his]1672-his arms , the warm contact of [his]1672-his youth ; while , in [his]1672-his inner mind , [he]1672-his renounced with energy [the temptress [Chloe]208-chloe and all [her]208-chloe works]1673-the temptress chloe and all her works , vowing to [himself]1672-his that [he]1672-his would give [Daphne]145-daphne no cause , no pretext even , for jealousy , and would bear it patiently if [she]145-daphne were still unjust and tormenting . “ Where have [you]1672-his been all day ? ”[145-daphne] said [Daphne]145-daphne at last , disengaging [herself]145-daphne , and brushing the tears away from [her]145-daphne eyes — a little angrily , as though [she]145-daphne were ashamed of them . “ [I]145-daphne told [you]1672-his this morning . [I]145-daphne had a run with [the Stoneshire hounds]3235-the stoneshire hounds . ”[145-daphne] “ Whom did [you]1672-his meet [there]610-there ? ”[145-daphne] “ Oh , [various old acquaintances]3237-various old acquaintances . [Nobody amusing]3238-nobody amusing . ”[1672-his] [He]1672-his gave two or three names , [his]1672-his conscience pricking [him]1672-his . Somehow , at that moment , it seemed impossible to mention [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe . About eleven o'clock that night , [Daphne]145-daphne and [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes having just gone [upstairs]505-upstairs , [Roger]121-roger and [a local Colonel of Volunteers who was dining and spending the night at [Heston]54-heston]1675-a local colonel of volunteers who was dining and spending the night at heston , were in [the smoking - room]2810-the smoking - room . [Colonel Williams]239-colonel williams had come over to discuss Volunteer prospects in [the neighbourhood]1460-the neighbourhood , and had been delighted to find in [the grandson of [[his]239-colonel williams old friend]1679-his old friend [Oliver Trescoe]240-oliver trescoe]1678-the grandson of his old friend oliver trescoe — [a young fellow whom [he]239-colonel williams and [others had too readily regarded as given over to luxury and soft living — signs of the old public spirit]1681-others had too readily regarded as given over to luxury and soft living — signs of the old public spirit , the traditional manliness of [the family]375-the family]1680-a young fellow whom he and others had too readily regarded as given over to luxury and soft living — signs of the old public spirit , the traditional manliness of the family . [The two men]1420-the two men were talking with great cordiality , when the sound of a dogcart driving up to the front door disturbed [them]1420-the two men . “ Who on earth?—at this time of night ? ”[121-roger] said [Roger]121-roger . [The butler , entering with fresh cigarettes]1684-the butler , entering with fresh cigarettes , explained that [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer had only just returned , having missed [an earlier train]1685-an earlier train . “ Well , [I]121-roger hope to goodness [she]234-miss farmer wo n't go and disturb [Miss Beatty]246-daphne , ”[121-roger] grumbled [Roger]121-roger ; and then , half to [himself]121-roger , half to [[his]239-colonel williams companion]317-his companion , as [the butler]1245-the butler departed—“I do n't believe [she]234-miss farmer missed [her]234-miss farmer train ; [she]234-miss farmer 's [one of the cool sort]3239-one of the cool sort — does jolly well what [she]234-miss farmer likes ! [I]1245-the butler say , [Colonel]239-colonel williams , do [you]239-colonel williams like ‘ [lady helps ’]3240-lady helps ’ ? [I]1245-the butler do n't ! ”[1245-the butler] Half an hour later , [Roger]121-roger , having said good - night to [[his]239-colonel williams guest]1688-his guest ten minutes before , was mounting the stairs on [his]239-colonel williams own way to bed , when [he]239-colonel williams heard in the distance the sound of a closing door and the rustle of [a woman]793-a woman 's dress . [Nurse Farmer]241-nurse farmer , [he]239-colonel williams supposed , who had been gossiping with [Daphne]145-daphne . [His]241-nurse farmer face , as the candle shone upon it , expressed annoyance . Vaguely , [he]239-colonel williams resented the kind of intimacy which had grown up lately between [Daphne]145-daphne and [[her]145-daphne child 's nurse]1690-her child 's nurse . [She]145-daphne was not the kind of person to make [a friend of]1691-a friend of ; [she]145-daphne bullied [Beatty]246-daphne ; and [she]145-daphne must be got rid of . Yet when [he]239-colonel williams entered [[[his]239-colonel williams wife]1168-his wife 's room]1693-his wife 's room , everything was dark , and [Daphne]145-daphne was apparently sound asleep . [Her]145-daphne face was hidden from [him]239-colonel williams ; and [he]239-colonel williams moved on tiptoe so as not to disturb [her]145-daphne . Evidently it was not [she]145-daphne who had been gossiping late . [[His]239-colonel williams mother]335-his mother , perhaps , with [[her]335-his mother maid]1365-her maid . IN the course of that night [Roger Barnes]121-roger 's fate was decided , while [he]239-colonel williams lay , happily sleeping , beside [[his]239-colonel williams wife]1168-his wife . [Daphne]145-daphne , as soon as [she]145-daphne heard [his]239-colonel williams regular breathing , opened the eyes [she]145-daphne had only pretended to close , and lay staring into the shadows of [the room]743-the room , in which a night - light was burning . Presently [she]145-daphne got up softly , put on a dressing - gown , and went to the fire , which [she]145-daphne noiselessly replenished ; then , drawing up a chair , [she]145-daphne sank back into it , [her]145-daphne arms folded . The strengthening firelight showed [her]145-daphne small white face , amid the masses of [her]145-daphne dark hair . [Her]145-daphne whole being was seething with passionate and revengeful thought . It was as though with violent straining and wrenching the familiar links and bulwarks of life were breaking down , and as if amid the wreck of them [she]145-daphne found [herself]145-daphne looking at goblin faces beyond , growing gradually used to [them]1698-them , ceasing to be startled by [them]1698-them , finding in [them]1698-them even a wild attraction and invitation . So [Roger]121-roger had lied to [her]145-daphne . Instead of a casual ride , involving a meeting with [a few old acquaintances]1699-a few old acquaintances , as [he]239-colonel williams had represented to [her]145-daphne , [he]239-colonel williams had been engaged that day in an assignation with [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , arranged beforehand , and carefully concealed from [[his]239-colonel williams wife]1168-his wife . [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer had seen [them]1701-them coming out of a wood together hand in hand ! In [the public road]1644-the public road , this!—not even so much respect for appearances as might have dictated the most elementary reticence and decency . The case was so clear that it sickened [her]145-daphne ; [she]145-daphne shivered with cold and nausea as [she]145-daphne lay there by the now glowing fire which yet gave [her]145-daphne no physical comfort . Probably in the past [their]1701-them relation had gone much farther than [Roger]121-roger had ever confessed to [[his]239-colonel williams wife]1168-his wife . [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile was [a woman who would stick at nothing . The issue was certain . [Such women as [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe]1705-such women as chloe fairmile are not to be baulked of what [they]1705-such women as chloe fairmile desire . [Good women]1706-good women can not fight [them]1705-such women as chloe fairmile on equal terms . And as to any attempt to keep the affections of [a husband who could behave in such a way to [the wife who had given [him]239-colonel williams [her]1168-his wife youth , [herself]1168-his wife , and all the resources and facilities of life]1708-the wife who had given him her youth , herself , and all the resources and facilities of life]1707-a husband who could behave in such a way to the wife who had given him her youth , herself , and all the resources and facilities of life , [Daphne]145-daphne 's whole being stiffened into mingled anguish and scorn as [she]145-daphne renounced the contest . Knowing [himself]121-roger the traitor that [he]239-colonel williams was , [he]239-colonel williams could yet hold [her]145-daphne , kiss [her]145-daphne , murmur tender things to [her]145-daphne , allow [her]145-daphne to cry upon [his]239-colonel williams breast , to stammer repentance and humbleness . Cowardly ! False ! Treacherous ! [She]145-daphne flung out [her]145-daphne hands , rigid , before [her]145-daphne in the darkness , as though for ever putting [him]239-colonel williams away . Anguish ? Yes!—but not of such torturing quality as [she]145-daphne could have felt a year , six months even , before this date . [She]145-daphne was astonished that [she]145-daphne could bear [her]145-daphne life , that [she]145-daphne could sit there in the night stillness , motionless , holding [her]145-daphne breath even , while [Roger]121-roger slept there in the shadowed bed . Had this thing happened to [her]145-daphne before [their]1709-their arrival at [Heston]54-heston , [she]145-daphne must have fallen upon [Roger]121-roger in mad grief and passion , ready to kill [him]239-colonel williams or [herself]1710-herself ; must at least have poured out torrents of useless words and tears . [She]145-daphne could not have sat dumb like this ; in misery , but quite able to think things out , to envisage all the dark possibilities of the future . And not only the future . By a perfectly logical diversion [her]145-daphne thoughts presently went racing to the past . There was , so to speak , a suspension of the immediate crisis , while [she]145-daphne listened to [her]145-daphne own mind — while [she]145-daphne watched [her]145-daphne own years go by . It was but rarely that [Daphne]145-daphne let [her]145-daphne mind run on [her]145-daphne own origins . But on this winter night , as [she]145-daphne sat motionless by the fire , [she]145-daphne became conscious of a sudden detachment from [her]145-daphne most recent self and life — a sudden violent turning against both — which naturally threw [her]145-daphne back on the past , on some reflection upon what [she]145-daphne had made of [herself]145-daphne , by way of guide to what [she]145-daphne might still make of [herself]145-daphne , if [she]145-daphne struck boldly , now , while there was yet time , for [her]145-daphne own freedom and development . As to [[her]145-daphne parents]1711-her parents , [she]145-daphne never confessed , even to [herself]145-daphne , that [she]145-daphne owed [them]1711-her parents anything , except , of course , the mere crude wealth that [[her]145-daphne father]2883-her father had left [her]145-daphne . Otherwise [she]145-daphne was vaguely ashamed of [them]1711-her parents both . And yet!—in [her]145-daphne most vital qualities , [her]145-daphne love of sensational effect , [her]145-daphne scorn of half - measures , [her]145-daphne quick , relentless imagination , [her]145-daphne increasing ostentation and extravagance , [she]145-daphne was [the true child of the boastful mercurial Irishman who had married [[her]145-daphne Spanish mother]1714-her spanish mother as part of a trade bargain , on a chance visit to [Buenos Ayres]149-buenos ayres]1713-the true child of the boastful mercurial irishman who had married her spanish mother as part of a trade bargain , on a chance visit to buenos ayres . For twenty years [Daniel Floyd]242-daniel floyd had leased and exploited , had ravaged and destroyed , great tracts of primeval forest in [the northern regions of [the Prairie State]1716-the prairie state]1715-the northern regions of the prairie state , leaving behind [him]242-daniel floyd a ruined earth and [an impoverished community]1717-an impoverished community , but building up the while a colossal fortune . [He]242-daniel floyd had learnt the arts of municipal “ bossing ”[1723-an actor] in [one of [the minor towns of [Illinois]20-illinois]1719-the minor towns of illinois]1718-one of the minor towns of illinois , and had then migrated to [Chicago]21-chicago , where for years [he]242-daniel floyd was the life and soul of [all the bolder and more adventurous corruption of [the city]1721-the city]1720-all the bolder and more adventurous corruption of the city . [A jovial , handsome fellow!—with]1722-a jovial , handsome fellow!—with [an actor]1723-an actor 's face , a bright eye , and a slippery hand . [Daphne]145-daphne had a vivid , and , on the whole , affectionate , remembrance of [[her]145-daphne father]2883-her father , of whom , however , [she]145-daphne seldom spoke . The thought of [[her]145-daphne mother]2729-her mother , on the other hand , was always unwelcome . It brought back recollections of storm and tempest ; of wild laughter , and still wilder tears ; of gorgeous dresses , small feet , and jewelled fingers . No ; [[her]145-daphne parents]1711-her parents had but small place in that dramatic autobiography that [Daphne]145-daphne was now constructing for [herself]145-daphne . [She]145-daphne was not [[their]1711-her parents daughter]1727-their daughter in any but the physical sense ; [she]145-daphne was [the daughter of [her]145-daphne own works and efforts]1728-the daughter of her own works and efforts . [She]145-daphne leant forward to the fire , [her]145-daphne face propped in [her]145-daphne hands , going back in thought to [[her]145-daphne father]2883-her father 's death , when [she]145-daphne was fifteen ; to [her]145-daphne three years of cloying convent life , and [her]145-daphne escape from it , as well as from [the intriguing relations who would have kept [her]145-daphne [there]610-there]1730-the intriguing relations who would have kept her there ; to [the clever lawyer who had helped to put [her]145-daphne in possession of [her]145-daphne fortune]1732-the clever lawyer who had helped to put her in possession of her fortune , and the huge sums [she]145-daphne had paid [him]1732-the clever lawyer who had helped to put her in possession of her fortune for [his]1732-the clever lawyer who had helped to put her in possession of her fortune services ; to [her]145-daphne search for education , [her]145-daphne hungry determination to rise in [the world]319-the world , [the friends [she]145-daphne had made at college]1734-the friends she had made at college , in [New York]1-new york , [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia , [Washington]2-washington . [She]145-daphne had been influenced by one milieu after another ; [she]145-daphne had worked hard , now at music , now at philosophy ; had dabbled in [[girls]1735-girls ' clubs]1736-girls ' clubs , and gone to Socialist meetings , and had been all through driven on by the gadfly of an ever - increasing ambition . Ambition for what ! [She]145-daphne looked back on this early life with a bitter contempt . What had it all come to ? Marriage with [Roger Barnes!—a]121-roger hasty passion of which [she]145-daphne was already ashamed , for [a man who was already false to [her]145-daphne]1737-a man who was already false to her . And what , really , had [their]1739-their married life brought [her]145-daphne ? Had [she]145-daphne ever been sure of Roger?—had [she]145-daphne ever been able to feel proud of [him]1737-a man who was already false to her , in the company of really distinguished men?—had [she]145-daphne not been conscious , again and again , when in [London]26-london , or [Paris]56-paris , or [Berlin]62-berlin , that [he]1737-a man who was already false to her was [her]145-daphne inferior , that [he]1737-a man who was already false to her spoiled [her]145-daphne social and intellectual chances ? And [his]1737-a man who was already false to her tone towards [women]299-women had always been a low one ; no great harm in it , perhaps ; but it had often wounded and disgusted [her]145-daphne . And then — for climax!—his concealment of the early love affair with [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe ; [his]1737-a man who was already false to her weakness and folly in letting [her]145-daphne regain [her]145-daphne hold upon [him]1737-a man who was already false to her ; [his]1737-a man who was already false to her behaviour at the Brendon ball , the gossip , which , as [Agnes Farmer]244-agnes farmer declared , was all over [the neighbourhood]1460-the neighbourhood , ending in the last baseness — the assignation , the lies , the hypocrisy of the afternoon ! Enough!—more than enough ! What did [she]145-daphne care what [the English world]1742-the english world thought of [her]145-daphne ? [She]145-daphne would free and right [herself]145-daphne in [her]145-daphne own way , and [they]1743-they might hold up what hands [they]1743-they pleased . A passion of wounded vanity , of disappointed self - love , swept through [her]145-daphne . [She]145-daphne had looked forward to the English country life ; [she]145-daphne had meant to play a great part in it . But three months had been enough to show [her]145-daphne the kind of thing — the hopeless narrowness and Philistinism of [these English backwaters]1744-these english backwaters . [Her]145-daphne resentment of the milieu in which [Roger]121-roger expected [her]145-daphne to live subtly swelled and strengthened [her]145-daphne wrath against [himself]121-roger ; it made the soil from which sprang a sudden growth of angry will — violent and destructive . There was in [her]145-daphne little or none of that affinity with a traditional , a parent [England]14-england , which is present in [so many Americans]1750-so many americans , which emerges in [them]1750-so many americans like [buried land from the waters]1751-buried land from the waters . On the contrary , the pressure of race and blood in [her]145-daphne was not towards , but against ; not friendly , but hostile . The nearer [she]145-daphne came to the English life , the more certain forces in [her]145-daphne , deeply infused , rose up and made [their]1752-their protest . The Celtic and Latin strains that were mingled in [her]145-daphne , [their]1752-their natural sympathies and repulsions , which had been indistinct in [the girl]396-the girl , overlaid by the deposits of the current American world , were becoming dominant in [the woman]794-the woman . Well , thank goodness , modern life is not as the old ! There are ways out . Midnight had just struck . The night was gusty , the north - west wind made fierce attacks on [the square , comfortable house]1755-the square , comfortable house . [Daphne]145-daphne rose slowly ; [she]145-daphne moved noiselessly across the floor ; [she]145-daphne stood with [her]145-daphne arms behind [her]145-daphne , looking down at the sleeping [Roger]121-roger . Then a thought struck [her]145-daphne ; [she]145-daphne reached out a hand to the new number of an American Quarterly which lay , with the paper knife in it , on a table beside the bed . [She]145-daphne had ordered it in a mood of jealous annoyance because of a few pages of art criticism in it by [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , which impertinently professed to know more about the Vitali Signorelli than [its present owner]1756-its present owner did ; but [she]145-daphne remembered also an article on “ The Future for Women , ”[145-daphne] which had seemed to [her]145-daphne a fine , progressive thing . [She]145-daphne turned the pages noiselessly — [her]145-daphne eyes now on [the unconscious Roger]1757-the unconscious roger — now on the book . “ All forms of contract — in business , education , religion , or law — suffer from the weakness and blindness of [the persons]3241-the persons making [them]3242-them — the marriage contract as much as any other . The dictates of humanity and commonsense alike show that the latter and most important contract should no more be perpetual than any of the others . ”[145-daphne] Again : — “ Any covenant between [human beings]3243-human beings that fails to produce or promote human happiness , can not in the nature of things be of any force or authority ; it is not only a right but a duty to abolish it . ”[145-daphne] And a little further : — “ Womanhood is the great fact of [woman]3244-woman 's life . [She]145-daphne was miserable , consumed with jealous anger . But the temptation of a new licence — a lawless law — was in [her]145-daphne veins . Have [women]299-women been trampled on , insulted , enslaved?—in [America]7-america , at least , [they]299-women may now stand on [their]299-women feet . [A woman]793-a woman 's life may be soiled and broken ; but in [the great human workshop of [America]7-america]1762-the great human workshop of america it can be repaired . [She]145-daphne remembered that in the majority of American divorces it is [the woman who applies for relief]1763-the woman who applies for relief . And why not ? [The average woman]1764-the average woman , when [she]1764-the average woman marries , knows much less of life and [the world]319-the world than [the average man]1766-the average man . [She]145-daphne is more likely — poor soul!—to make mistakes . [She]145-daphne drew closer to the bed . All round [her]145-daphne glimmered the furniture and appointments of [a costly room]1767-a costly room — the silver and tortoise - shell on the dressing - table , the long mirrors lining the farther wall , the silk hangings of the bed . Luxury , as light and soft as skill and money could make it — [the room]743-the room breathed it ; and in the midst stood [the young creature who had designed it]1769-the young creature who had designed it , the will within [her]1769-the young creature who had designed it hardening rapidly to an irrevocable purpose . Yes , [she]145-daphne had made a mistake ! But [she]145-daphne would retrieve it . [She]145-daphne would free [herself]145-daphne . [She]145-daphne would no longer put up with [Roger]121-roger , with [his]1770-his neglect and deceit — [[his]1770-his disagreeable and ungrateful mother]1771-his disagreeable and ungrateful mother — [[his]1770-his immoral friends]1772-his immoral friends — and this dull , soul - deadening English life . [Roger]121-roger moved and murmured . [She]145-daphne retreated a little , still looking at [him]1770-his fixedly . Was it [the child]2941-the child 's name ? Perhaps . [He]1770-his dreamt interminably , and very often of [Beatty]246-daphne . But it did not move [her]145-daphne . [Beatty]246-daphne , of course , was [[her]145-daphne child]1774-her child . [Every child]1623-every child belongs to [the mother]1149-the mother in a far profounder sense than to [the father]329-the father . And [he]1770-his , too , would be free ; [he]1770-his would naturally marry again . Case after case of divorce ran through [her]145-daphne mind as [she]145-daphne stood there ; [the persons]3241-the persons and circumstances all well known to [her]145-daphne . Other stories also , not personally within [[her]145-daphne ken]1779-her ken ; the famous scandals of the time , much discussed throughout American society . [Her]145-daphne wits cleared and steeled . [She]145-daphne began to see the course that [she]145-daphne must follow . [She]145-daphne would have to recover [her]145-daphne American citizenship — [she]145-daphne and [the child]2941-the child . A domicile of six months in [South Dakota]76-south dakota , or in [Wyoming]24-wyoming — a year in [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia — [she]145-daphne began to recall information derived of old from [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine , who had , of course , been forced to consider all these things , and to weigh alternatives . Advice , therefore , must be asked of [her]145-daphne at once — and sympathy . Suddenly , on [her]145-daphne brooding , there broke a wave of excitement . Life , instead of being closed , as in a sense it is , for [every married woman]1782-every married woman , was in a moment open and vague again ; the doors flung wide to flaming heavens . An intoxication of recovered youth and freedom possessed [her]145-daphne . [The sleeping Roger]121-roger represented things intolerable and outworn . [She]145-daphne looked at [him]1784-this commonplace man with a kind of exaltation , spurning [him]1784-this commonplace man from [her]145-daphne path . Something more , no doubt , of both than [she]145-daphne had already . [She]145-daphne must wait — temporise — do nothing rashly . What was the alternative ? [She]145-daphne seemed to ask it of [Roger]121-roger , as [she]145-daphne stood looking down upon [him]1784-this commonplace man . No ! [she]145-daphne was born for other and greater things , and [she]145-daphne would grasp them . “ [My]145-daphne first duty is to [myself]145-daphne — to [my]145-daphne own development ! [We]3248-we have absolutely no right to sacrifice [ourselves]3248-we — as [women]299-women have been taught to do for thousands of years . ”[145-daphne] Bewildered by the rhetoric of [her]145-daphne own thoughts , [Daphne]145-daphne returned to [her]145-daphne seat by the fire , and sat there wildly dreaming , till once more recalled to practical possibilities by the passage of the hours on the clock above [her]145-daphne . [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer ? Everything , it seemed , depended on [her]145-daphne . But [Daphne]145-daphne had no doubts of [her]145-daphne . [Poor girl!—with [[her]145-daphne poverty - stricken home]1792-her poverty - stricken home]1791-poor girl!—with her poverty - stricken home , [[her]145-daphne drunken father]1793-her drunken father lately dismissed from [his]1793-her drunken father post , and [her]145-daphne evident inclination towards [this clever young fellow now employed in [the house]413-the house]1794-this clever young fellow now employed in the house — [Daphne]145-daphne rejoiced to think of what money could do , in this case at least ; of the reward that should be waiting for [the girl]396-the girl 's devotion when the moment came ; of the gifts already made , and the gratitude already evoked . No ; [she]145-daphne could be trusted ; [she]145-daphne had every reason to be true . Some fitful sleep came to [her]145-daphne at last in the morning hours . But when [Roger]121-roger awoke , [she]145-daphne was half - way through [her]145-daphne dressing ; and when [he]1793-her drunken father first saw [her]145-daphne , [he]1793-her drunken father noticed nothing except that [she]145-daphne was paler than usual , and confessed to a broken night . But as the day wore on it became plain to [everybody at [Heston]54-heston]1797-everybody at heston — to [Roger]121-roger first and foremost — that something was much amiss . [Daphne]145-daphne would not leave [[her]145-daphne sitting - room]1798-her sitting - room and [[her]145-daphne sofa]1799-her sofa ; [she]145-daphne complained of headache and over - fatigue ; would have nothing to say to [the men at work on the new decoration of [the east wing of [the house]413-the house]1801-the east wing of the house , who were clamouring for directions ; and would admit [nobody]2813-nobody but [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer and [[her]234-miss farmer maid]1365-her maid]1800-the men at work on the new decoration of the east wing of the house , who were clamouring for directions ; and would admit nobody but miss farmer and her maid . [Roger]121-roger forced [his]1793-her drunken father way in once , only to be vanquished by the traditional weapons of weakness , pallor , and silence . [Her]145-daphne face contracted and quivered as [his]1793-her drunken father step approached [her]145-daphne ; it was as though [he]1793-her drunken father trampled upon [her]145-daphne ; and [he]1793-her drunken father left [her]145-daphne , awkwardly , on tiptoe , feeling [himself]1793-her drunken father as intrusively brutal as [she]145-daphne clearly meant [him]1793-her drunken father to feel . What on earth was the matter ? Some new grievance against [him]1793-her drunken father , [he]1793-her drunken father supposed . After the softening , the quasi - reconciliation of the day before , [his]1793-her drunken father chagrin and disappointment were great . Impossible [she]145-daphne should know anything of [his]1793-her drunken father ride with [Chloe]208-chloe ! There was not a soul in [that wood]1805-that wood ; and [the place]642-the place was twenty miles from [Heston]54-heston . Again [he]1793-her drunken father felt the impulse to blurt it all out to [her]145-daphne ; but was simply repelled and intimidated by this porcupine mood in which [she]145-daphne had wrapped [herself]145-daphne . Better wait at least till [she]145-daphne was a little more normal again . [He]1793-her drunken father went off disconsolately to a day 's shooting . Meanwhile , [his]1793-her drunken father own particular worry was sharp enough . [Chloe]208-chloe had taken advantage of [their]1807-their casual tête - à - tête , as [she]208-chloe had done before on several occasions , to claim something of the old relation , instead of accepting the new , like [a decent woman]1808-a decent woman ; and in the face of the temptation offered [him]1793-her drunken father [he]1793-her drunken father had shown a weakness of which not only [his]1793-her drunken father conscience but [his]1793-her drunken father pride was ashamed . [He]1793-her drunken father realised perfectly that [she]208-chloe had been trying during the whole autumn to recover [her]208-chloe former hold on [him]1793-her drunken father , and [he]1793-her drunken father also saw clearly and bitterly that [he]1793-her drunken father was not strong enough to resist [her]208-chloe , should [he]1793-her drunken father continue to be thrown with [her]208-chloe ; and not clever enough to baffle [her]208-chloe , if [her]208-chloe will were really set on recapturing [him]1793-her drunken father . [He]1793-her drunken father was afraid of [her]208-chloe , and afraid of [himself]1793-her drunken father . What , then , must [he]1793-her drunken father do ? As [he]1793-her drunken father tramped about [the wet fields]1809-the wet fields and [plantations]1810-plantations with [a keeper]1811-a keeper and [a few beaters]1812-a few beaters after some scattered pheasants , [he]1793-her drunken father was really , [poor fellow]1813-poor fellow ! arguing out the riddle of [his]1793-her drunken father life . What would [Herbert French]187-french advise [him]1793-her drunken father to do?—supposing [he]1793-her drunken father could put the question plainly to [him]1793-her drunken father , which of course was not possible . [He]1793-her drunken father meant honestly and sincerely to keep straight ; to do [his]1793-her drunken father duty by [Daphne]145-daphne and [the child]2941-the child . But [he]1793-her drunken father was [no plaster saint]1815-no plaster saint , and [he]1793-her drunken father could not afford to give [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe too many opportunities . To break at once , to carry off [Daphne]145-daphne and leave [Heston]54-heston , at least for a time — that was the obviously prudent and reasonable course . But in [her]145-daphne present mood it was of no use for [him]1793-her drunken father to propose it , tired as [she]145-daphne seemed to be of [Heston]54-heston , and disappointed in [the neighbours]1650-the neighbours : any plan brought forward by [him]1793-her drunken father was doomed beforehand . Well then , let [him]1793-her drunken father go [himself]1793-her drunken father ; [he]1793-her drunken father had been so unhappy during the preceding weeks it would be a jolly relief to turn [his]1793-her drunken father back on [Heston]54-heston for a time . But as soon as [he]1793-her drunken father had taken [his]1793-her drunken father departure , [Chloe]208-chloe perhaps would take [hers]208-chloe ; and if so , [Daphne]145-daphne 's jealousy would be worse than ever . Whatever deserts [he]1793-her drunken father might place between [himself]1793-her drunken father and [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile , [Daphne]145-daphne would imagine [them]1817-them together . Meanwhile , there was that Lilliput bond , that small , chafing entanglement , which [Chloe]208-chloe had flung round [him]1793-her drunken father in [her]208-chloe persistence about the letters . There was , no doubt , a horrid scandal brewing about [Mrs. Weightman]245-mrs. weightman , [[Chloe]208-chloe 's old friend]1818-chloe 's old friend — [a friend of [his]1793-her drunken father own]1819-a friend of his own , too , in former days . Through [Chloe]208-chloe 's unpardonable indiscretions tions [he]1793-her drunken father knew a great deal more about [this lady]637-this lady 's affairs than [he]1793-her drunken father had ever wished to know . And [he]1793-her drunken father well remembered the letter in question ; a letter on which the political life or death of [one of [[England]14-england 's most famous men]1822-england 's most famous men]1821-one of england 's most famous men might easily turn , supposing it got out . But the letter was safe enough ; not the least likely to come into dangerous hands , in spite of [Chloe]208-chloe 's absurd hypotheses . It was somewhere , no doubt , among the boxes in [the locked room]1823-the locked room ; and who could possibly get hold of it ? At the same time [he]1793-her drunken father realised that as long as [he]1793-her drunken father had not found and returned it [she]208-chloe would still have a certain claim upon [him]1793-her drunken father , a certain right to harass [him]1793-her drunken father with inquiries and confidential interviews , which , as [a man of honour]1824-a man of honour , [he]1793-her drunken father could not altogether deny . A pheasant got up across [a ploughed field]1825-a ploughed field where in the mild season the young corn was already green . [Roger]121-roger shot , and missed ; the bird floated gaily down the wind , and [the head keeper]1286-the head keeper , in disgust , muttered bad language to [the underling beside [him]1793-her drunken father]1827-the underling beside him . But after that [Barnes]121-roger was twice as cheerful as before . [He]1793-her drunken father whistled as [he]1793-her drunken father walked ; [his]1793-her drunken father shooting recovered ; and by the time the dark fell , [keepers]1828-keepers and [beaters]1829-beaters were once more [[his]1793-her drunken father friends]895-his friends . The fact was that just as [he]1793-her drunken father missed the pheasant [he]1793-her drunken father had taken [his]1793-her drunken father resolution , and seen [his]1793-her drunken father way . [He]1793-her drunken father would have another determined hunt for that letter ; [he]1793-her drunken father would also find and destroy [his]1793-her drunken father own letters to [Chloe]208-chloe — those [she]208-chloe had returned to [him]1793-her drunken father — which must certainly never fall into [Daphne]145-daphne 's hands ; and then [he]1793-her drunken father would go away to [London]26-london or [the North]1831-the north , to some place whence [he]1793-her drunken father could write both to [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe and to [[his]1793-her drunken father wife]1168-his wife . [Women like [Daphne]145-daphne]1833-women like daphne were too quick ; [they]1833-women like daphne could get out a dozen words to [your]1834-your one ; but give [a man]2682-a man time , and [he]2682-a man could express [himself]2682-a man . And , therewith , a great tenderness and compunction in [this man]1836-this man 's heart , and a steady determination to put things right . For was not [[Daphne Beatty]246-daphne 's mother]1837-daphne beatty 's mother ? and was [he]1793-her drunken father not in truth very fond of [her]1837-daphne beatty 's mother , if only [she]1837-daphne beatty 's mother would let [him]1793-her drunken father be ? Now then for the hunt . As [he]1793-her drunken father had never destroyed the letters , they must exist ; but , in the name of mischief , where ? [He]1793-her drunken father seemed to remember thrusting [his]1793-her drunken father own letters to [Chloe]208-chloe into a desk of [his]1793-her drunken father schoolboy days which used to stand in [[his]1793-her drunken father [London]26-london sitting - room]1838-his london sitting - room . Very likely some of [hers]208-chloe might be [there]610-there too . But the thought of [his]1793-her drunken father own had by now become a much greater anxiety to [him]1793-her drunken father than the wish to placate [Chloe]208-chloe . For [he]1793-her drunken father was most uncomfortably aware that [his]1793-her drunken father correspondence with [Chloe]208-chloe during [their]1840-their short engagement had been of a very different degree of fervour from that shown in the letters to [Daphne]246-daphne under similar circumstances . As for the indelicacy and folly of leaving such documents to chance , [he]1793-her drunken father cursed it sorely . How to look ? [He]1793-her drunken father pondered it . [He]1793-her drunken father did not even know which [attic]1841-attic [it]1841-attic was that had been reserved at the time of the letting of [Heston]54-heston , and now held some of the old [London]26-london furniture and papers . Well , [he]1793-her drunken father must manage it , “ burgle ”[335-his mother] [[his]1793-her drunken father own house]1842-his own house , if necessary . What an absurd situation ! Should [he]1793-her drunken father consult [[his]1793-her drunken father mother]335-his mother ? No ; better not . That evening [General Hobson]120-general hobson was expected for a couple of nights . On going up to dress for dinner , [Roger]121-roger discovered that [he]1793-her drunken father had been banished to [a room on the farther side of [the house]413-the house]1844-a room on the farther side of the house , where [[his]1793-her drunken father servant]1846-his servant was now putting out [his]1793-her drunken father clothes . [He]1793-her drunken father turned very white , and went straight to [[his]1793-her drunken father wife]1168-his wife . [Daphne]246-daphne was on the sofa as before , and received [him]1793-her drunken father in silence . “ What 's the meaning of this , [Daphne]246-daphne ? ”[246-daphne] The tone was quiet , but the breathing quick . [She]246-daphne looked at [him]1793-her drunken father — bracing [herself]246-daphne . “ [I]246-daphne must be alone ! [I]246-daphne had no sleep last night . ”[246-daphne] “ [You]1793-her drunken father had neuralgia ? ”[246-daphne] “ [I]1793-her drunken father do n't know — [I]1793-her drunken father had no sleep . [I]1793-her drunken father must be alone . ”[1793-her drunken father] [His]1793-her drunken father eyes and [hers]246-daphne met . “ For to - night , then , ”[1793-her drunken father] [he]1793-her drunken father said briefly . “ [I]1793-her drunken father do n't know what 's the matter with [you]246-daphne , [Daphne]246-daphne , and [I]1793-her drunken father suppose it 's no use to ask [you]246-daphne . [I]1793-her drunken father thought , yesterday — but — however , there 's no time to talk now . Are [you]246-daphne coming down to dinner ? ”[1793-her drunken father] “ Not to dinner . [I]1793-her drunken father will come down for an hour afterwards . ”[1793-her drunken father] [He]1793-her drunken father went away , and before [he]1793-her drunken father had reached [[his]1793-her drunken father own room]1848-his own room , and while the heat of [his]1793-her drunken father sudden passion still possessed [him]1793-her drunken father , it occurred to [him]1793-her drunken father that [Daphne]246-daphne 's behaviour might after all prove [a godsend]1849-a godsend . That night [he]1793-her drunken father would make [his]1793-her drunken father search , with no risk of disturbing [[his]1793-her drunken father wife]1168-his wife . The dinner in [the newly decorated dining - room]1851-the newly decorated dining - room went heavily . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes had grown of late more and more anxious and depressed . [She]153-lady barnes had long ceased to assert [herself]153-lady barnes in [Daphne]246-daphne 's presence , and [one]2809-one saw [her]153-lady barnes as [the British matron in adversity]1853-the british matron in adversity , buffeted by forces [she]153-lady barnes did not understand ; or as [some minor despot snuffed out by a stronger]1854-some minor despot snuffed out by a stronger . [The General]289-the general , who had only arrived just in time to dress , inquired in astonishment for [Daphne]246-daphne , and was told by [Roger]121-roger that [[his]1793-her drunken father wife]1168-his wife was not well , but would come down for a little while after dinner . In presence of the new splendours of [Heston]54-heston , [the General]289-the general had — in [[Roger]121-roger 's company]1858-roger 's company — very little to say . [He]1793-her drunken father made the vague remark that [the dining - room]1859-the dining - room was “ very fine , ”[1793-her drunken father] but [he]1793-her drunken father should not have known it again . Where was the portrait of [Edward]192-edward , and the full - length of [[Edward]192-edward 's father]1860-edward 's father by [Sir Francis Grant]247-sir francis grant ? [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes drew [herself]153-lady barnes up , and said nothing . [Roger]121-roger hastily replied that [he]1793-her drunken father believed [they]1861-they were now in [the passage leading to [the billiard - room]1863-the billiard - room]1862-the passage leading to the billiard - room . “ What ! that dark corner ! ”[289-the general] cried [the General]289-the general , looking with both distaste and hostility at the famous Signorelli — a full - length nude [St. Sebastian]248-st. sebastian , bound and pierced — which had replaced them on the dining - room wall . Who on earth ever saw such a picture in [a dining - room]1865-a dining - room ? [Roger]121-roger must be [a fool to allow it]1866-a fool to allow it ! Afterwards , [the General]289-the general and [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes wandered through [the transformed house]1868-the transformed house , in general agreement as to the ugliness and extravagance of almost everything that had been done — an agreement that was as balm to the harassed spirits of [the lady]393-the lady . “ What have [they]1861-they spent ? ”[289-the general] asked [the General]289-the general , under [his]289-the general breath , as [they]1861-they returned to [the drawing - room—“thousands]3250-the drawing - room—“thousands and [thousands]3251-thousands , [I]289-the general should think ! And there was no need for [them]1861-they to spend a penny . It is a sinful waste , and [no one]2907-no one should waste money in these days — there are [too many unemployed]3253-too many unemployed ! ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general drew up [his]289-the general spare person , with a terrier - like shake of the head and shoulders , as of one repudiating [Mammon]249-mammon and all its works . “ [Daphne]246-daphne has simply no idea of the value of money ! ”[153-lady barnes] [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes complained , also under [her]153-lady barnes breath . [They]1861-they were passing along [one of the side corridors of [the house]413-the house]1871-one of the side corridors of the house , and there was [no one in sight]1873-no one in sight . But [[Roger]121-roger 's mother]1137-roger 's mother was evidently uneasy , as though [Daphne]246-daphne might at any moment spring from the floor , or emerge from the walls . [The General]289-the general was really sorry for [her]246-daphne . “ It 's like [all the rest of [them]3254-all the rest of them]3254-all the rest of them — [Americans]3255-americans , [I]289-the general mean , ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general declared ; “ [they]3255-americans have n't [our]3256-our sense of responsibility . [I]289-the general saw plenty of that in [the States]2653-the states . ”[289-the general] [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes acquiesced . [She]153-lady barnes was always soothed by [the General]289-the general 's unfaltering views of British superiority . [They]1877-they found [Daphne]246-daphne in [the drawing - room]768-the drawing - room — a ghostly Daphne , in white , and covered with diamonds . [She]246-daphne made a little perfunctory conversation with [them]1877-they , avoided all mention of [the house]413-the house , and presently , complaining again of headache , went back to [[her]246-daphne room]1664-her room after barely an hour [downstairs]1881-downstairs . [The General]289-the general whistled to [himself]289-the general , as [he]289-the general also retired to bed , after another and more private conversation with [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes , and half an hour 's billiards with [a very absent - minded host]1883-a very absent - minded host . By [Jove]160-jove , [Laura]137-laura wanted a change ! [He]289-the general rejoiced that [he]289-the general was to escort [her]137-laura on the morrow to [the [London]26-london house of some cheerful and hospitable relations]1884-the london house of some cheerful and hospitable relations . Dollars , it seemed , were not everything , and [he]289-the general wished to heaven that [Roger]121-roger had been content to marry [some plain English girl , with , say , a couple of thousand]1885-some plain english girl , with , say , a couple of thousand a year . Even [the frugal General]1886-the frugal general did not see how it could have been done on less . [Roger]121-roger no doubt had been [a lazy , self - indulgent beggar]1887-a lazy , self - indulgent beggar . Yet [he]289-the general seemed a good deal steadier , and more sensible than [he]289-the general used to be ; in spite of [[his]289-the general wife]1168-his wife , and the pouring out of dollars . And there was no doubt that [he]289-the general had grown perceptibly older . [The General]120-general hobson felt a vague pang of regret , so rare and so compelling had been the quality of [Roger]121-roger 's early youth , measured at least by physical standards . [The house]413-the house sank into sleep and silence . [Roger]121-roger , before saying good - night to [[his]289-the general mother]335-his mother , had let fall a casual question as to the whereabouts of [the room which still contained the débris of [the London house]3188-the london house]1891-the room which still contained the débris of the london house . [Lady Barnes]153-lady barnes directed [him]289-the general . At the end of [the nursery wing]1894-the nursery wing , to the right . But in the morning [one of [the housemaids]1896-the housemaids]1895-one of the housemaids would show [him]289-the general . Had [she]1895-one of the housemaids the key ?
