[He]289-the general waited in [[his]289-the general room]706-his room till after midnight , then took off [his]289-the general shoes , [his]289-the general pride smarting , and emerged . There was one electric light burning in [the hall]1027-the hall below . This gave enough glimmer on the broad open landing for [him]289-the general to grope [his]289-the general way by , and [he]289-the general went noiselessly towards the staircase leading up to [[Beatty]246-daphne 's rooms]1899-beatty 's rooms . Once , just as [he]289-the general reached [it]1900-it , [he]289-the general thought [he]289-the general caught the faint noise of low talking somewhere in [the house]413-the house , an indeterminate sound not to be located . But when [he]289-the general paused to listen , it had ceased ; and [he]289-the general supposed it to be only a windy murmur of the night . [He]289-the general gained [the nursery wing]1894-the nursery wing . So far , of course , the way was perfectly familiar . [He]289-the general rarely passed an evening without going to kiss [Beatty]246-daphne in [[her]246-daphne cot]1903-her cot . Outside the door of [the night - nursery]1904-the night - nursery [he]289-the general waited a moment to listen . Was [she]246-daphne snoozling among [her]246-daphne blankets?—the darling ! [She]246-daphne still sucked [her]246-daphne thumb , sometimes , [poor baby]1905-poor baby , to send [her]246-daphne to sleep , and it was another reason for discontent with [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer that [she]246-daphne would make a misdemeanour of it . Really , [that woman]3073-that woman got on [his]289-the general nerves ! Beyond [the nursery]1655-the nursery [he]289-the general had no knowledge whatever of [[his]289-the general own house]1842-his own house . [The attics at [Heston]54-heston]1909-the attics at heston were large and rambling . [He]289-the general believed [the servants]1910-the servants were all in [the other wing]1911-the other wing , but was not sure ; [he]289-the general could only hope that [he]289-the general might not stumble on [[some handmaiden]1912-some handmaiden 's room]1913-some handmaiden 's room by mistake ! A door to the right , at the end of [the passage]1914-the passage . [He]289-the general tried the key . Thank goodness ! It turned without too much noise , and [he]289-the general found [himself]289-the general on the threshold of [a big lumber - room]1915-a big lumber - room , [his]289-the general candle throwing lines of dusty light across [it]1915-a big lumber - room . [He]289-the general closed the door , set down the light , and looked round [him]289-the general in despair . [The room]743-the room was crowded with furniture , trunks , and boxes , in considerable confusion . It looked as though [the men employed to move them]1917-the men employed to move them had piled them there as [they]1917-the men employed to move them pleased ; and [Roger]121-roger shrewdly suspected that [[his]289-the general mother]335-his mother , from whom , in spite of [her]335-his mother square and businesslike appearance , [his]289-the general own indolence was inherited , had shrunk till now from the task of disturbing [them]1919-them . [He]289-the general began to rummage a little . Papers belonging to [[his]289-the general father]561-his father — an endless series of them ; some in tin boxes marked with the names of [various companies]1921-various companies , mining and other ; some in leather cases , reminiscent of politics , and labelled “ Parliamentary ”[289-the general] or “ [Local Government Board]3258-local government board . ”[289-the general] Trunks containing Court suits , yeomanry uniforms , and the like ; a medley of old account books , photographs , worthless volumes , and broken ornaments : all the refuse that [our]1922-our too complex life piles about [us]1922-our was represented in the chaos of [the room]743-the room . [Roger]121-roger pulled and pushed as cautiously as [he]289-the general could , but making , inevitably , some noise in the process . At last ! [He]289-the general caught sight of some belongings of [his]289-the general own , and was soon joyfully detaching the old Eton desk , of which [he]289-the general was in search , from a pile of miscellaneous rubbish . In doing so , to [his]289-the general dismay , [he]289-the general upset a couple of old cardboard boxes filled with letters , and they fell with some clatter . [He]289-the general looked round instinctively at the door ; but it was shut , and [the house]413-the house was well built , the walls and ceilings reasonably sound - proof . The desk was only latched — beastly carelessness , of course!—and inside [it]1925-it were three thick piles of letters , and a few loose ones below . [His]289-the general own letters to [Chloe]208-chloe ; and — by [George!—the]250-george!—the lost one!—among the others . [He]289-the general opened it eagerly , ran it through . Yes , the very thing ! What luck ! [He]289-the general laid it carefully aside a moment on a trunk near by , and sat with the other letters on [his]289-the general lap . [His]289-the general fingers played with them . [He]289-the general almost determined to take them down unopened , and burn them , as they were , in [[his]289-the general own room]1848-his own room ; but in the end [he]289-the general could not resist the temptation to look at them once more . [He]289-the general pulled off an indiarubber band from the latest packet , and was soon deep in them , at first half ashamed , half contemptuous . Calf love , of course ! And [he]289-the general had been [a precious fool]1927-a precious fool to write such things . Then , presently , the headlong passion of them began to affect [him]289-the general , to set [his]289-the general pulses swinging . [He]289-the general fell to wondering at [his]289-the general own bygone facility , [his]289-the general own powers of expression . How did [he]289-the general ever write such a style ! [He]289-the general , who could hardly get through a note now without blots and labour . Self - pity grew upon [him]289-the general , and self - admiration . By heaven ! How could [a woman]793-a woman treat [a man]2682-a man — [a man who could write to [her]793-a woman like this — as [Chloe]208-chloe had treated [him]289-the general]1930-a man who could write to her like this — as chloe had treated him ! [The old smart revived]1931-the old smart revived ; or rather , the old indelible impressions of it left on nerve and brain . The letters lay on [his]289-the general knee . [He]289-the general sat brooding : [his]289-the general hands upon the packets , [his]289-the general head bowed . [One]2809-one might have thought [him]289-the general [a man overcome and dissolved by the enervating memories of passion]1933-a man overcome and dissolved by the enervating memories of passion ; but in truth , [he]289-the general was gradually and steadily reacting against [them]1934-them ; resuming , and this time finally , as far as [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe was concerned , [a man]2682-a man 's mastery of [himself]2682-a man . [He]289-the general thought of [her]208-chloe unkindness and cruelty — of the misery [he]289-the general had suffered — and now of the reckless caprice with which , during the preceding weeks , [she]208-chloe had tried to entangle [him]289-the general afresh , with no respect for [his]289-the general married life , for [his]289-the general own or [Daphne]246-daphne 's peace of mind . [He]289-the general judged [her]208-chloe , and therewith , [himself]289-the general . Looking back upon the four years since [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe had thrown [him]289-the general over , it seemed to [him]289-the general that , in some ways , [he]289-the general had made a good job of [his]289-the general life , and , in others , a bad one . As to the money , that was neither here nor there . It had been amusing to have so much of it ; though of late [Daphne]246-daphne 's constant reminders that the fortune was [hers]246-daphne and not [his]289-the general , had been like grit in the mouth . But [he]289-the general did not find that boundless wealth had made as much difference to [him]289-the general as [he]289-the general had expected . On the other hand , [he]289-the general had been much happier with [Daphne]246-daphne than [he]289-the general had thought [he]289-the general should be , up to the time of [their]1936-their coming to [Heston]54-heston . [She]208-chloe was n't easy to live with , and [she]208-chloe had been often , before now , ridiculously jealous ; but [you]1937-you could not , apparently , live with [a woman]793-a woman without getting very fond of [her]208-chloe — [he]289-the general couldn't — especially if [she]208-chloe had given [you]1937-you [a child]1939-a child ; and if [Daphne]246-daphne had turned against [him]289-the general now , for a bit — well , [he]289-the general could not swear to [himself]289-the general that [he]289-the general had been free from blame ; and it perhaps served [him]289-the general right for having gone out deliberately to [the States]77-the states to marry money — with [a wife]1940-a wife thrown in — in that shabby sort of way . But , now , to straighten out this coil ; to shake [himself]289-the general finally free of [Chloe]208-chloe , and make [Daphne]246-daphne happy again ! [He]289-the general vowed to [himself]289-the general that [he]289-the general could and would make [her]246-daphne happy — just as [she]246-daphne had been in [their]1941-their early days together . The memory of [her]246-daphne lying white and exhausted after child - birth , with the little dark head beside [her]246-daphne , came across [him]289-the general , and melted [him]289-the general ; [he]289-the general thought of [her]246-daphne with longing and tenderness . With a deep breath [he]289-the general raised [himself]289-the general on [his]289-the general seat ; in the old Greek phrase , “ [the gods]3259-the gods breathed courage into [his]3259-the gods soul ”[289-the general] ; and as [he]289-the general stretched out an indifferent hand towards [Chloe]208-chloe 's letters on the trunk , [Roger Barnes]121-roger had perhaps reached the highest point of [his]289-the general moral history ; [he]289-the general had become conscious of [himself]289-the general as [a moral being choosing good]1942-a moral being choosing good or evil ; and [he]289-the general had chosen good . It was not so much that [his]289-the general conscience accused [him]289-the general greatly with regard to [Chloe]208-chloe . For that [his]289-the general normal standards were not fine enough . It was rather a kind of “ serious call , ”[208-chloe] something akin to conversion , or that might have been conversion , which befell [him]289-the general in [this dusty room]1943-this dusty room , amid the night - silence . As [he]289-the general took up [Chloe]208-chloe 's letters [he]289-the general did not notice that the door had quietly opened behind [him]289-the general , and that [a figure]1944-a figure stood on the threshold . A voice struck into the stillness . “ [Roger]121-roger ! ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general turned with a movement that scattered all [his]289-the general own letters on the floor . [Daphne]246-daphne stood before [him]289-the general — but with the eyes of [a mad woman]1945-a mad woman . [Her]246-daphne hand shook on the handle of the door . “ What are [you]289-the general doing [here]2658-here ? ”[246-daphne] [She]246-daphne flung out the question like a blow . “ Hallo , [Daphne!—is]251-daphne!—is that [you]251-daphne!—is ? ”[246-daphne] [He]289-the general tried to laugh . “ [I]289-the general 'm only looking up some old papers ; no joke , in all this rubbish . ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general pointed to it . “ What old papers ? ”[289-the general] “ Well , [you]246-daphne need n't catechise [me]289-the general ! ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general said , nettled by [her]246-daphne tone , “ or not in that way , at any rate . [I]289-the general could n't sleep , and [I]289-the general came up here to look for something [I]289-the general wanted . Why did [you]251-daphne!—is shut [your]251-daphne!—is door on [me]289-the general ? ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general looked at [her]246-daphne intently , [his]289-the general lips twitching a little . [Daphne]246-daphne came nearer . “ It must be something [you]289-the general want very badly — something [you]289-the general do n't want [other people]3261-other people to see — something [you]289-the general 're ashamed of!—or [you]289-the general would n't be searching for it at this time of night . ”[246-daphne] [She]246-daphne raised [her]246-daphne eyes , still with the same strange yet flaming quiet , from the littered floor to [his]289-the general face . Then suddenly glancing again at the scattered papers—“That 's [your]289-the general handwriting!—they're [your]289-the general letters!—letters to [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile ! ”[246-daphne] “ Well , and what do [you]246-daphne make of that ? ”[121-roger] cried [Roger]121-roger , half wroth , half inclined to laugh . “ If [you]246-daphne want to know , they are the letters [I]121-roger wrote to [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe ; and [I]121-roger , like [a careless beast]3262-a careless beast , never destroyed them , and they were stuffed away here . [I]121-roger have long meant to get at them and burn them , and as [you]246-daphne turned [me]121-roger out to - night — ”[121-roger] “ What is that letter in [your]289-the general hand ? ”[246-daphne] exclaimed [Daphne]246-daphne , interrupting [him]289-the general . “ Oh , that has nothing to do with [you]246-daphne — or [me]289-the general — ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general said , hastily making a movement to put it in [his]289-the general coat pocket . But in a second , [Daphne]246-daphne , with a cry , had thrown [herself]246-daphne upon [him]289-the general , to [his]289-the general intense amazement , wrestling with [him]289-the general , in a wild excitement . And as [she]246-daphne did so , [a thin woman , with frightened eyes , in a nurse]1946-a thin woman , with frightened eyes , in a nurse 's dress , came quickly into [the room]743-the room , as though [Daphne]246-daphne 's cry had signalled to [her]246-daphne . [She]246-daphne was behind [Roger]121-roger , and [he]289-the general was not aware of [her]246-daphne approach . “ [Daphne]246-daphne , do n't be such [a little fool]2924-a little fool ! ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general said indignantly , holding [her]246-daphne off with one hand , determined not to give [her]246-daphne the letter . Then , all in a moment — without , as it seemed to [him]289-the general , any but the mildest defensive action on [his]289-the general part — [Daphne]246-daphne stumbled and fell . “ [Daphne!—I]252-daphne!—i say ! — ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general was stooping over [her]246-daphne in great distress to lift [her]246-daphne up , when [he]289-the general felt [himself]289-the general vehemently put aside by [a woman]793-a woman 's hand . “ [You]289-the general ought to be ashamed of [yourself]289-the general , [sir]2704-sir ! Let [me]289-the general go to [her]246-daphne . ”[289-the general] [He]289-the general turned in bewilderment . “ [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer ! What on earth are [you]289-the general doing here ? ”[289-the general] But in [his]289-the general astonishment [he]289-the general had given way to [her]246-daphne , and [he]289-the general fell back pale and frowning , while , without replying , [she]246-daphne lifted [Daphne]246-daphne — who had a cut on [her]246-daphne forehead and was half fainting — from the ground . “ Do n't come near [her]246-daphne , [sir]2704-sir ! ”[3212-the nurse] said [the nurse]3212-the nurse , again warding [him]289-the general off . “ [You]289-the general have done quite enough . Let [me]3212-the nurse attend to [her]246-daphne . ”[3212-the nurse] “ [You]3212-the nurse imagine that was [my]121-roger doing ? ”[121-roger] said [Roger]121-roger grimly . “ Let [me]121-roger assure [you]3212-the nurse it was nothing of the kind . And pray , were [you]3212-the nurse listening at the door ? ”[121-roger] [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer vouchsafed no reply . [She]246-daphne was half leading , half supporting [Daphne]246-daphne , who leant against [her]246-daphne . As [they]1950-them neared the door , [Roger]121-roger , who had been standing dumb again , started forward . “ Let [me]289-the general take [her]246-daphne , ”[289-the general] [he]289-the general said sternly . “ Daphne!—send [this woman]1265-this woman away . ”[289-the general] But [Daphne]246-daphne only shuddered , and putting out a shaking hand , [she]246-daphne waved [him]289-the general from [her]246-daphne . “ [You]121-roger see in what a state [she]246-daphne is ! ”[234-miss farmer] cried [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer , with a withering look . “ If [you]121-roger must speak to [her]246-daphne , put it off , [sir]2704-sir , at least till tomorrow . ”[234-miss farmer] [Roger]121-roger drew back . A strange sense of inexplicable disaster rushed upon [him]289-the general . [He]289-the general sombrely watched [them]1950-them pass through the door and disappear . [Daphne]246-daphne reached [[her]246-daphne own room]1335-her own room . As the door closed upon [them]1950-them [she]246-daphne turned to [[her]246-daphne companion]356-her companion panion , holding out the handkerchief stained with blood [she]246-daphne had been pressing to [her]246-daphne temple . “ [You]121-roger saw it all ? ”[246-daphne] [she]246-daphne said imperiously—“the whole thing ? ”[246-daphne] “ All , ”[234-miss farmer] said [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer . “ It 's a mercy [you]121-roger 're not more hurt . ”[234-miss farmer] [Daphne]246-daphne gave a hysterical laugh . “ It 'll just do — [I]246-daphne think it 'll just do ! But [you]121-roger 'll have to make a good deal out of it . ”[246-daphne] And sinking down by the fire , [she]246-daphne burst into a passion of wild tears . [The nurse]3212-the nurse brought [her]246-daphne sal volatile , and washed the small cut above [her]246-daphne eyebrow . “ It was lucky [we]1954-we heard [him]356-her companion , ”[3212-the nurse] [she]3212-the nurse said triumphantly . “ [I]3212-the nurse guessed at once [he]356-her companion must be looking for something — [I]3212-the nurse knew [that room]3268-that room was full of papers . ”[3212-the nurse] A knock at the door startled [them]1954-we . “ Never mind . ”[3212-the nurse] [The nurse]3212-the nurse hurried across [the room]743-the room . “ [It]743-the room 's locked . ”[3212-the nurse] “ How is [[my]121-roger wife]3224-my wife ? ”[121-roger] said [Roger]121-roger 's strong and , as it seemed , threatening voice outside . “ [She]3224-my wife 'll be all right , [sir]2704-sir , [I]121-roger hope , if [you]2704-sir 'll leave [her]3224-my wife to rest . But [I]121-roger wo n't answer for the consequences if [she]3224-my wife 's disturbed any more . ”[121-roger] There was a pause , as though of hesitation . Then [Roger]121-roger 's steps receded . [Daphne]246-daphne pushed [her]246-daphne hair back from [her]246-daphne face , and sat staring into the fire . Everything was decided now . Yet [she]246-daphne had rushed [upstairs]505-upstairs stairs on [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer 's information with no definite purpose . [She]246-daphne only knew that — once again — [Roger]121-roger was hiding something from [her]246-daphne — doing something secret and disgraceful — and [she]246-daphne suddenly resolved to surprise and confront [him]1958-him . With a mind still vaguely running on the legal aspects of what [she]246-daphne meant to do , [she]246-daphne had bade [the nurse]3212-the nurse follow [her]246-daphne . The rest had been half spontaneous , half acting . It had struck [her]246-daphne imagination midway how the incident could be turned — and used . [She]246-daphne was triumphant ; but from sheer excitement [she]246-daphne wept and sobbed through the greater part of the night . “ La vie est un orage , soit . Nous sommes orage et convulsion nous - mêmes . Laissons nous aller à cette loi qui emporte tout dans l'abîme , et il n'y a plus de société , plus d'humanité , plus rien . ”[246-daphne] IT was a cheerless February day , dark and slaty overhead , dusty below . In [the East End streets]1960-the east end streets paper and straw , [children]2775-children 's curls , [girls]1735-girls ' pinafores and [women]299-women 's skirts were driven back and forward by a bitter wind ; there was an ugly light on [ugly houses]1964-ugly houses , with none of that kind trickery of mist or smoke which can lend some grace on normal days even to [Commercial Street]78-commercial street , or to [the network of lanes north of [the Bethnal Green Road]1966-the bethnal green road]1965-the network of lanes north of the bethnal green road . The pitiless wind swept [the streets]1967-the streets — swept [the children]2664-the children and [the grown - ups]1969-the grown - ups out of [them]1967-the streets into [the houses]677-the houses , or any available shelter ; and in the dark and chilly emptiness of [the side roads]1971-the side roads [one]2809-one might listen in fancy for the stealthy returning steps of spirits crueller than Cold , more tyrannous than Poverty , coming to seize upon [their]1973-their own . In one of [these side streets]1974-these side streets stood [a house larger than [[its]1975-a house larger than its neighbours neighbours]1976-its neighbours]1975-a house larger than its neighbours , in a bit of [front garden]1977-front garden , with some decrepit rust - bitten railings between [it]1975-a house larger than its neighbours and [the road]1634-the road . [It]1975-a house larger than its neighbours was [an old dwelling overtaken by the flood of [tenement houses]1980-tenement houses , which spread north , south , east , and west of [it]1975-a house larger than its neighbours]1979-an old dwelling overtaken by the flood of tenement houses , which spread north , south , east , and west of it . [Its]1975-a house larger than its neighbours walls were no less grimy than [[its]1975-a house larger than its neighbours neighbours]1976-its neighbours ' ; but [its]1975-a house larger than its neighbours windows were outlined in cheerful white paint , firelight sparkled through [its]1975-a house larger than its neighbours unshuttered panes , and a bright green door with a brass knocker completed [its]1975-a house larger than its neighbours pleasant air . There were always [children]2775-children outside the Vicarage railings on winter evenings , held there by the spell of the green door and the firelight . Inside [the firelit room to the left of the front pathway]1983-the firelit room to the left of the front pathway , [two men]1984-two men were standing — [one of whom had just entered [the house]413-the house]1985-one of whom had just entered the house . “ [[My]586-the man dear]2812-my dear [Penrose!—how]253-penrose!—how very good of [you]2812-my dear to come . [He]140-boyson knew a good deal about the [Barnes story—“feels]121-roger , so [I]255-penrose gathered , very strongly about it , and on [the man]586-the man 's side ; and when [I]255-penrose told [him]140-boyson that [Roger]121-roger had just arrived and was coming to take counsel with [you]3279-you and [me]255-penrose this afternoon , [he]140-boyson suddenly asked if [he]586-the man might come , too . Scandal pour rire ! [Not a soul]3309-not a soul believed that there was anything more in it than mischief on [the woman]794-the woman 's side , and a kind of incapacity for dealing with [a woman]793-a woman as [she]793-a woman deserved , on [the man]586-the man 's . [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile has been an intrigante from [her]203-mrs. fairmile cradle . [Barnes]121-roger was at one time deeply in love with [her]203-mrs. fairmile . [[His]586-the man wife]1168-his wife became jealous of [her]203-mrs. fairmile after the marriage , and threw [them]3305-these two together , by way of getting at the truth , and [he]586-the man shilly - shallied with the situation , instead of putting a prompt end to it , as of course [he]586-the man ought to have done . [He]586-the man was honestly fond of [[his]586-the man wife]1168-his wife the whole time , and devoted to [[his]586-the man home]3315-his home and [[his]586-the man child]1355-his child . ”[187-french] “ Well , [she]203-mrs. fairmile did n't plead , [you]255-penrose say , anything more than ‘ cruelty ’ and ‘ indignities . ’ The scandal , such as it was , was no doubt part of the ‘ cruelty ’ ? ”[187-french] [French]187-french assented . “ And [you]255-penrose suspect that money played a great part in the whole transaction ? ”[187-french] “ [I]255-penrose do n't suspect — the evidence goes a long way beyond that . [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger bought the show ! [I]255-penrose am told there are a thousand ways of doing it . ”[255-penrose] [Penrose]255-penrose smoked and pondered . “ Well , then — what happened ? But the fact was [he]586-the man had put it off too long — ”[187-french] “ Naturally , ”[255-penrose] said [Penrose]255-penrose , with a shrug . “ Not much hope for [him]586-the man — after the decree . ”[255-penrose] “ So [he]586-the man discovered , [poor old fellow]3323-poor old fellow ! [[His]586-the man lawyers]3324-his lawyers told [him]586-the man plainly from the beginning that [he]586-the man had precious little chance . [Penrose]255-penrose observed [the new - comer]1250-the new - comer . In some ways [Roger Barnes]121-roger was handsomer than ever . [His]2007-his colour , the pink and white of [his]2007-his astonishing complexion , was miraculously vivid ; [his]2007-his blue eyes were infinitely more arresting than of old ; and the touch of physical weakness in [his]2007-his aspect , left evidently by severe illness , was not only not disfiguring , but a positive embellishment . That imaginative power , combined with the power of drudgery , which was in process of making [a great lawyer]2042-a great lawyer out of [a Balliol scholar]2043-a balliol scholar , showed [him]255-penrose something typical and dramatic in the two figures:—in [Boyson]140-boyson , on the one hand , so lithe , serviceable , and resolved , [a helpful , mercurial man , ashamed of [[his]140-boyson country]2045-his country in this one respect , because [he]140-boyson adored [her]2046-she in so many others , penitent and patriot in [one:—in Barnes]121-roger , on the other , so heavy , inert , and bewildered , [a shipwrecked suppliant as it were]2047-a shipwrecked suppliant as it were , clinging to the knees of [that very America]2048-that very america which had so lightly and irresponsibly wronged [him]140-boyson]2044-a helpful , mercurial man , ashamed of his country in this one respect , because he adored her in so many others , penitent and patriot in one:—in barnes , on the other , so heavy , inert , and bewildered , a shipwrecked suppliant as it were , clinging to the knees of that very america which had so lightly and irresponsibly wronged him . It was [Penrose]255-penrose who broke the silence . “ Is there any chance of [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger 's marrying again ? ”[255-penrose] [he]255-penrose asked . [Barnes]121-roger turned to [him]140-boyson . “ Not that [I]121-roger know of . ”[121-roger] “ There 's [no one else in the case]3396-no one else in the case ? ”[255-penrose] “ [I]121-roger never heard of [anyone]2876-anyone . ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger gave a short , excited laugh . “ What [she]2046-she 's done , [she]2046-she 's done because [she]2046-she was tired of [me]121-roger , not because [she]2046-she was in love with [anyone else]1513-anyone else . That was [her]2046-she great score in the divorce case — that there was [nobody]2813-nobody . ”[121-roger] Biting and twisting [his]140-boyson lip , in a trick that recalled to [French]187-french [the beautiful Eton lad]2049-the beautiful eton lad , cracking [his]140-boyson brains in [the pupil - room]2050-the pupil - room over a bit of Latin prose , [Roger]121-roger glanced , frowning , from one to the other of [these three men who felt for [him]140-boyson , whose resentment of the wrong that had been done [him]140-boyson , whose pity for [his]140-boyson calamity showed plainly enough through [their]2051-these three men who felt for him , whose resentment of the wrong that had been done him , whose pity for his calamity showed plainly enough through their reticent speech reticent speech]2051-these three men who felt for him , whose resentment of the wrong that had been done him , whose pity for his calamity showed plainly enough through their reticent speech . [His]140-boyson sense , indeed , of [their]2051-these three men who felt for him , whose resentment of the wrong that had been done him , whose pity for his calamity showed plainly enough through their reticent speech sympathy began to move [him]140-boyson , to break down [his]140-boyson own self - command . No doubt , also , the fatal causes that ultimately ruined [his]140-boyson will - power were already at work . At any rate , [he]140-boyson broke out into sudden speech about [his]140-boyson case . [His]140-boyson complexion , now unhealthily delicate , like the complexion of [a girl]308-a girl , had flushed deeply . As [he]140-boyson spoke [he]140-boyson looked mainly at French . “ There 's lots of things [you]1679-his old friend do n't know , ”[140-boyson] [he]140-boyson said in a hesitating voice , as though appealing to [[his]140-boyson old friend]1679-his old friend . And rapidly [he]140-boyson told the story of [Daphne]145-daphne 's flight from [Heston]54-heston . Evidently since [his]140-boyson return [home]2690-home many details that were once obscure had become plain to [him]140-boyson ; and [the three listeners]2055-the three listeners could perceive how certain new information had goaded and stung [him]140-boyson afresh . [He]140-boyson dwelt on the letters which had reached [him]140-boyson during [his]140-boyson first week 's absence from [home]2690-home , after the quarrel — letters from [Daphne]145-daphne and [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer , which were posted at intervals from [Heston]54-heston by [[their]2055-the three listeners accomplice]2057-their accomplice , [the young architect]2058-the young architect , while [the writers of [them]2055-the three listeners]2059-the writers of them were hurrying across [the Atlantic]13-the atlantic . [The servants]1910-the servants had been told that [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger , [Miss Farmer]234-miss farmer , and [the little girl]1658-the little girl were going to [London]26-london for a day or two , and suspected nothing . “ [I]2062-i wrote long letters — lots of them — to [[my]2062-i wife]3224-my wife . [I]2062-i thought [I]2062-i had made everything right — not that there ever had been anything wrong , [you]3401-you understand,—seriously . But in some ways [I]2062-i had behaved like [a fool]2696-a fool . ”[2062-i] [He]2062-i threw [himself]2062-i back in [his]2062-i chair , pressing [his]2062-i hands on [his]2062-i eyes . [The listeners]2063-the listeners sat or stood motionless . “ Well , [I]2062-i might have spared [my]2062-i pains . The letters were returned to [me]2062-i from [the States]2653-the states . [Daphne]145-daphne had arranged it all so cleverly that [I]2062-i was some time in tracing [her]145-daphne . By the time [I]2062-i had got to [Sioux Falls]83-sioux falls [she]145-daphne was through a month of [her]145-daphne necessary residence . [My]2062-i God!”—his[2062-i] voice dropped , became almost inaudible—“if [I]2062-i 'd only carried [Beatty]246-daphne off then!—then and there — [the frontier]3404-the frontier was n't far off — without waiting for anything more . But [I]2062-i would n't believe that [Daphne]246-daphne could persist in such a monstrous thing , and , if [she]246-daphne did , that [any decent country]3405-any decent country would aid and abet [her]246-daphne . ”[2062-i] [Boyson]140-boyson made a movement of protest , as though [he]140-boyson could not listen any longer in silence . “ [I]140-boyson am ashamed to remind [you]121-roger , [Barnes,—again]262-barnes,—again — that [your]121-roger case is no worse than that of [scores of [American citizens]3407-american citizens]3406-scores of american citizens . [We]3408-we are the first to suffer from [our]3408-we own enormities . ”[140-boyson] “ Perhaps , ”[121-roger] said [Barnes]121-roger absently , “ perhaps . ”[121-roger] [His]140-boyson impulse of speech dropped . [He]140-boyson sat , drearily staring into the fire , absorbed in recollection . [Penrose]255-penrose had gone . So had [Boyson]140-boyson . [Roger]121-roger was sitting by the fire in [[the vicar]2064-the vicar 's study]2065-the vicar 's study , ministered to by [Elsie French]124-french and [[her]124-french children]912-her children . By common consent the dismal subject of the day had been put aside . There was an attempt to cheer and distract [him]140-boyson . [The little girl of two]2068-the little girl of two , curled up on [[her]2068-the little girl of two mother]2729-her mother 's lap close by , listened sleepily , and [Elsie]124-french , applauding and prompting as [a properly regulated mother]2070-a properly regulated mother should , was all the time , in spirit , hovering pitifully about [[her]124-french guest]954-her guest and [his]954-her guest plight . [She]124-french spoke to [the young man]290-the young man kindly and shyly , as though [she]124-french feared lest any chance word might wound [him]290-the young man ; [she]124-french was the symbol , in [her]124-french young motherliness , of all that [Daphne]144-daphne had denied and forsaken . “ When would [America]7-america — dear , dear America!—see to it that such things were made impossible ! ”[121-roger] [Roger]121-roger meanwhile was evidently cheered and braced . [Beatty]246-daphne had once been very ill with [hers]246-daphne , at [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia , mostly caused , however , by some beastly , indigestible food that [the nurse]3212-the nurse had let [her]246-daphne have .
