[They]2104-they were returning from [their]2104-they wedding journey . Some six weeks before this date [Boyson]140-boyson had married in [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia [a girl coming from one of [the old Quaker stocks of [that town]2107-that town]2106-the old quaker stocks of that town]2105-a girl coming from one of the old quaker stocks of that town , in whose tender steadfastness of character [a man inclined both by nature and experience to expect little from life]2108-a man inclined both by nature and experience to expect little from life had found a happiness that amazed [him]140-boyson . [The bridegroom]2109-the bridegroom , also , had just been appointed to [the Military Attachéship at [the Berlin Embassy]2111-the berlin embassy]2110-the military attachéship at the berlin embassy , and [the couple]2112-the couple were , in fact , on [their]2112-the couple way south to [New York]1-new york and [embarkation tion]88-embarkation tion . But there were still a few days left of the honeymoon , of which [they]2112-the couple had spent the last half in [Canada]89-canada , and on this May night [they]2112-the couple were journeying from [Toronto]90-toronto along [the southern shore of [Lake Ontario]91-lake ontario]2113-the southern shore of lake ontario to [the pleasant Canadian hotel which overlooks [the pageant of [Niagara]18-niagara]2115-the pageant of niagara]2114-the pleasant canadian hotel which overlooks the pageant of niagara . [They]2112-the couple had left [Toronto]90-toronto in bright sunshine , but as [they]2112-the couple turned [the corner of [the lake]2117-the lake]2116-the corner of the lake westward , a white fog had come creeping over [the land]2118-the land as the sunset fell . But the daylight was still strong , the fog thin ; so that it appeared rather as a veil of gold , amethyst , and opal , floating over [the country]3129-the country , now parting altogether , now blotting out [the orchards]2120-the orchards and [the fields]1582-the fields . And into the colour above melted the colour below . For [the orchards that cover [the [Hamilton]93-hamilton district of [Ontario]94-ontario]92-the hamilton district of ontario]2122-the orchards that cover the hamilton district of ontario were in bloom , and the snow of the pear - trees , the flush of the peach - blossom broke everywhere through the warm cloud of pearly mist ; while , just as [Mrs. Boyson]267-boyson spoke , [the train]468-the train had come in sight of the long flashing line of [the Welland Canal]2124-the welland canal , which wound its way , outlined by huge electric lamps , through the sunset and the fog , till the lights died in that northern distance where stretched [the invisible shore of [the great lake]2126-the great lake]2125-the invisible shore of the great lake . [The glittering waterway]2127-the glittering waterway , speaking of the labour and commerce of [men]556-men , [the blossom - laden earth]2129-the blossom - laden earth , the white approaching mist , the softly falling [night:—the girl - bride]2130-night:—the girl - bride could not tear [herself]2130-night:—the girl - bride from the spectacle . [She]2130-night:—the girl - bride sat beside the window entranced . But [[her]2130-night:—the girl - bride husband]778-her husband had captured [her]2130-night:—the girl - bride hand , and into the overflowing beauty of nature there stole the thrill of [their]2132-them love . “ All very well ! ”[267-boyson] said [Boyson]267-boyson presently . “ But a fog at [Niagara]18-niagara is no joke ! ”[267-boyson] The night stole on , and the cloud through which [they]2132-them journeyed grew denser . Up crept the fog , on stole the night . The lights of [the canal]2133-the canal faded , [the orchards]2120-the orchards sank into darkness , and when [the bride]2135-the bride and [bridegroom]609-bridegroom reached [the station on [the Canadian side]95-the canadian side]2137-the station on the canadian side [the bride]2135-the bride 's pleasure had become dismay . “ Oh , [Alfred]140-boyson , [we]2132-them sha n't see anything ! ”[2135-the bride] And , indeed , as [[their]2132-them carriage]405-their carriage made its slow progress along [the road that skirts [the gorge]2141-the gorge]2140-the road that skirts the gorge , [they]2132-them seemed to plunge deeper and deeper into the fog . A white darkness , as though of impenetrable yet glimmering cloud , above and around [them]2132-them ; [a white abyss beneath [them]2132-them]2142-a white abyss beneath them ; and issuing from [it]2143-it the thunderous voice of wild waters , dim first and distant , but growing steadily in volume and terror . “ There are the lights of [the bridge]3426-the bridge ! ”[140-boyson] cried [Boyson]140-boyson , “ and [the towers of [the aluminium works]3428-the aluminium works]3427-the towers of the aluminium works . But not a vestige of [the Falls]96-the falls ! Gone ! Wiped out ! [I]140-boyson say , [darling]2945-darling , this is going to be a disappointment . ”[140-boyson] [Mrs. Boyson]267-boyson , however , was not so sure . The lovely “ nocturne ”[140-boyson] of [the evening plain]2144-the evening plain had passed into a Vision or Masque of Force that captured the mind . High above [the gulf]2145-the gulf rose [the towers of the great works]2146-the towers of the great works , transformed by the surging fog and darkness into [some piled and castled fortress]2147-some piled and castled fortress ; [a fortress of Science held by Intelligence]2148-a fortress of science held by intelligence . Lights were in [the towers]2149-the towers , as of [genii]2150-genii at [their]2150-genii work ; lights glimmered here and there on the face of [the farther cliff]2151-the farther cliff , as though to measure the vastness of [the gorge]2141-the gorge and of that resounding vacancy towards which [they]2132-them moved . In front , the arch of [the vast suspension bridge]2153-the vast suspension bridge , pricked in light , crossed [the gulf]2145-the gulf , from nothingness to nothingness , like [that skyey bridge on which [the gods]3259-the gods marched to [Walhalla]97-walhalla]2155-that skyey bridge on which the gods marched to walhalla . Otherwise , no shape , no landmark ; [earth and heaven]2157-earth and heaven had disappeared . “ Here [we]2132-them are at [the hotel]951-the hotel , ”[267-boyson] said [Boyson]267-boyson . “ There , [[my]267-boyson dear,”—he]3431-my dear,”—he[267-boyson] pointed ironically—“is the American Fall , and there — is [the Canadian]98-the canadian ! Let [me]2132-them introduce [you]3431-my dear,”—he to [Niagara]18-niagara ! ”[2132-them] [They]2132-them jumped out of [the carriage]635-the carriage , and while [their]2132-them bags were being carried in [they]2132-them ran to the parapeted edge of [the cliff in front of [the hotel]951-the hotel]2159-the cliff in front of the hotel . [Niagara]18-niagara thundered in [their]2132-them ears ; the spray of it beat upon [their]2132-them faces ; but of [the two great Falls immediately in front of [them]2132-them]2161-the two great falls immediately in front of them [they]2132-them saw nothing whatever . The fog , now cold and clammy , enwrapped [them]2132-them ; even the bright lights of [the hotel]951-the hotel , but a stone 's throw distant , were barely visible ; and the carriage still standing at the steps had vanished . Suddenly , some common impulse born of the moment and the scene — of its inhuman ghostliness and grandeur — drew [them]2132-them to each other . [Boyson]267-boyson threw [his]2163-his arm round [[his]2163-his young wife]2103-his young wife and pressed [her]2103-his young wife to [him]2163-his , kissing [her]2103-his young wife face and hair , bedewed by the spray . [She]2103-his young wife clung to [him]2163-his passionately , trembling a little , as the roar deafened [them]2132-them and the fog swept round [them]2132-them . As [the Boysons]268-the boysons lingered in [the central hall of [the hotel]951-the hotel]2165-the central hall of the hotel , reading some letters which had been handed to [them]268-the boysons , [a lady in black]2167-a lady in black passed along [the gallery]2168-the gallery overhead and paused a moment to look at [the new arrivals brought by]2169-the new arrivals brought by [the evening train]2170-the evening train . As [she]2167-a lady in black perceived [Captain Boyson]140-boyson there was a quick , startled movement ; [she]2167-a lady in black bent a moment over the staircase , as though to make sure of [his]140-boyson identity , and then ran along [the gallery]2168-the gallery to [a room at the farther end]2172-a room at the farther end . As [she]2167-a lady in black opened the door a damp cold air streamed upon [her]2167-a lady in black , and the thunder of the Falls , with which [the hotel]951-the hotel is perpetually filled , seemed to redouble . Three large windows opposite to [her]2167-a lady in black were , in fact , wide open ; [the room]743-the room , with [its]743-the room lights dimmed by fog , seemed hung above [the abyss]2175-the abyss . An invalid couch stood in front of the window , and upon [it]2176-it lay [a pale , emaciated woman]2177-a pale , emaciated woman , breathing quickly and feebly . At the sound of the closing door , [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine turned . “ Oh , [Daphne]246-daphne , [I]159-madeleine was afraid [you]246-daphne had gone out ! [You]246-daphne do such wild things ! ”[159-madeleine] [Daphne Barnes]144-daphne came to the side of the couch . “ Darling , [I]144-daphne only went to speak to [[your]246-daphne maid]3432-your maid for a moment . Are [you]246-daphne sure [you]246-daphne can stand all this damp fog ? ”[144-daphne] As [she]144-daphne spoke [Daphne]144-daphne took up a fur cloak lying on a chair near , and wrapped [herself]144-daphne warmly in it . “ [I]144-daphne ca n't breathe when [they]3433-they shut the windows . But it is too cold for [you]246-daphne . ”[144-daphne] “ Oh , [I]144-daphne 'm all right in this . ”[144-daphne] [Daphne]144-daphne drew the cloak round [her]144-daphne . Inwardly [she]144-daphne said to [herself]144-daphne , “ Shall [I]144-daphne tell [her]3432-your maid [the Boysons]3434-the boysons are here ? Yes , [I]144-daphne must . [She]3432-your maid is sure to hear it in some way . ”[144-daphne] So , stooping over the couch , [she]144-daphne said : “ Do [you]144-daphne know who arrived this evening ? [The Alfred Boysons]268-the boysons . [I]144-daphne saw [them]3434-the boysons in [the hall]1027-the hall just now . ”[144-daphne] “ [They]3434-the boysons 're on [their]3434-the boysons honeymoon ? ”[2178-the faint voice] asked [the faint voice]2178-the faint voice , after a just perceptible pause . [Daphne]144-daphne assented . “ [She]144-daphne seems a pretty little thing . ”[144-daphne] [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine opened [her]159-madeleine tired eyes to look at [Daphne]144-daphne . [Mrs. Floyd]269-mrs. floyd — as [Daphne]144-daphne now called [herself]269-mrs. floyd — was dressed in deep black . The costly gown revealed a figure which had recently become substantial , and the face on which the electric light shone had nothing left in it of [the girl]396-the girl , though [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne was not yet thirty . The initial beauty of complexion was gone ; so was the fleeting prettiness of youth . The eyes were as splendid as ever , but combined with the increased paleness of the cheeks , the greater prominence and determination of the mouth , and a certain austerity in the dressing of the hair , which was now firmly drawn back from the temples round which it used to curl , and worn high , à [la Marquise]270-la marquise , [they]2180-they expressed a personality — a formidable personality — in which self - will was no longer graceful , and power no longer magnetic . [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine gazed at [[her]159-madeleine friend]764-her friend in silence . [She]159-madeleine was very grateful to [Daphne]145-daphne , often very dependent on [her]145-daphne . But there were moments when [she]159-madeleine shrank from [her]145-daphne , when [she]159-madeleine would gladly never have seen [her]145-daphne again . [Daphne]145-daphne was still erect , self - confidant , [militant]2182-militant ; whereas [Madeleine]159-madeleine knew [herself]159-madeleine vanquished — vanquished both in body and soul . Certain inner miseries and discomforts had been set vibrating by the name of [Captain Boyson]140-boyson . “ [You]159-madeleine wo n't want to see [him]140-boyson or come across [him]140-boyson ? ”[159-madeleine] [she]159-madeleine said abruptly . “ Who ? [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson ? [I]159-madeleine am not afraid of [him]140-boyson in the least . [He]140-boyson may say what [he]140-boyson pleases — or think what [he]140-boyson pleases . It does n't matter to [me]159-madeleine . ”[159-madeleine] “ When did [you]159-madeleine see [him]140-boyson last ? ”[145-daphne] [Daphne]145-daphne hesitated a moment . “ When [he]140-boyson came to ask [me]145-daphne for certain things which had belonged to [Beatty]246-daphne . ”[145-daphne] “ For [Roger]121-roger ? [I]159-madeleine remember . It must have been painful . ”[159-madeleine] “ Yes , ”[246-daphne] said [Daphne]246-daphne unwillingly , “ it was . [He]140-boyson was very unfriendly . [He]140-boyson always has been — since it happened . But [I]246-daphne bore [him]140-boyson no malice”—the[246-daphne] tone was firm—“and the interview was short . ”[159-madeleine] “ [Beatty]246-daphne — ”[159-madeleine] The half audible word fell like a sigh from [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's lips as [she]159-madeleine closed [her]159-madeleine eyes again to shut out the light which teased them . And presently [she]159-madeleine added , “ Do [you]159-madeleine ever hear anything now — from [England]14-england ? ”[159-madeleine] “ Just what [I]159-madeleine might expect to hear — what more than justifies all that [I]159-madeleine did . ”[159-madeleine] [Daphne]246-daphne sat rigid on [her]246-daphne chair , [her]246-daphne hands crossed on [her]246-daphne lap . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne did not pursue the conversation . Outside the fog grew thicker and darker . Even the lights on [the bridge]3426-the bridge were now engulfed . [Daphne]146-daphne began to shiver in [her]146-daphne fur cloak . [She]146-daphne put out a cold hand and took one of [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne 's . “ [Dear Madeleine]271-dear madeleine ! Indeed , indeed , [you]271-dear madeleine ought to let [me]146-daphne move [you]271-dear madeleine from [this place]2649-this place . Do let [me]146-daphne ! [There]610-there 's [the house at [Stockbridge]99-stockbridge]3438-the house at stockbridge all ready . And in July [I]146-daphne could take [you]271-dear madeleine to [Newport]100-newport . [I]146-daphne must be off next week , for [I]146-daphne 've promised to take the chair at a big meeting at [Buffalo]22-buffalo on the 29th . But [I]146-daphne ca n't bear to leave [you]271-dear madeleine behind . [We]3439-we could make the journey quite easy for [you]271-dear madeleine . [That new car]3440-that new car of [mine]146-daphne is very comfortable . ”[146-daphne] “ [I]146-daphne know it is . But , thank [you]271-dear madeleine , [dear]2856-dear , [I]146-daphne like [this hotel]3442-this hotel ; and it will be summer directly . ”[146-daphne] [Daphne]146-daphne hesitated . A strong protest against “ morbidness ”[146-daphne] was on [her]146-daphne lips , but [she]146-daphne did not speak it . In [the mist - filled room]2184-the mist - filled room even the bright fire , the electric lights , had grown strangely dim . Only the roar outside was real — terribly , threateningly real . Yet the sound was not so much fierce as lamentable ; the voice of [Nature]136-nature mourning the eternal flaw and conflict at the heart of things . [Daphne]146-daphne knew well that , mingled with this primitive , cosmic voice , there was — for [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine — another : a plaintive , human cry , that was drawing the life out of [her]159-madeleine breast , the blood from [her]159-madeleine veins , like some baneful witchcraft of old . But [she]146-daphne dared not speak of it ; [she]146-daphne and [the doctor who attended [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne]2185-the doctor who attended mrs. verrier dared no longer name [the patient]2186-the patient 's “ obsession ”[146-daphne] even to [each other]346-each other . [They]2188-they had tried to combat it , to tear [her]146-daphne from [this place]2649-this place ; with no other result , as it seemed , than to hasten the death - process which was upon [her]146-daphne . Gently , but firmly , [she]146-daphne had defied [them]2188-they , and [they]2188-they knew now that [she]146-daphne would always defy [them]2188-they . For a year past , summer and winter , [she]146-daphne had lived in [this apartment facing [the Falls]96-the falls]2190-this apartment facing the falls ; [[her]146-daphne nurses]2191-her nurses found [[her]146-daphne very patient]2192-her very patient under the incurable disease which had declared itself ; [Daphne]146-daphne came to stay with [her]146-daphne when arduous engagements allowed , and [Madeleine]159-madeleine was always grateful and affectionate . But certain topics , and certain advocacies , had dropped out of [their]2188-they conversation — not by [Daphne]146-daphne 's will . There had been no spoken recantation ; only [the prophetess]2193-the prophetess prophesied no more ; and of late , especially when [Daphne]146-daphne was not [there]610-there — so [Mrs. Floyd]269-mrs. floyd had discovered — [a Roman Catholic priest]2195-a roman catholic priest had begun to visit [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne . [Daphne]146-daphne , moreover , had recently noticed a small crucifix , hidden among the folds of the loose black dress which [Madeleine]159-madeleine commonly wore . [Daphne]146-daphne had changed [her]146-daphne dress and dismissed [[her]146-daphne maid]1365-her maid . Although it was May , a wood - fire had been lighted in [[her]146-daphne room]1664-her room to counteract the chilly damp of the evening . [She]146-daphne hung over it , loth to go back to [the sitting - room]2198-the sitting - room , and plagued by a depression that not even [her]146-daphne strong will could immediately shake off . [She]146-daphne wished [the Boysons]268-the boysons had not come . [She]146-daphne supposed that [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson would hardly cut [her]146-daphne ; but [she]146-daphne was tolerably certain that [he]140-boyson would not wish [[his]140-boyson young wife]2103-his young wife to become acquainted with [her]146-daphne . [She]146-daphne scorned [his]140-boyson disapproval of [her]146-daphne ; but [she]146-daphne smarted under it . It combined with [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's strange delusions to put [her]146-daphne on the defensive ; to call out all the fierceness of [her]146-daphne pride ; to make [her]146-daphne feel [herself]146-daphne the champion of a sound and reasonable view of life as against weakness and reaction . [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's dumb remorse was , indeed , the most paralysing and baffling thing ; nothing seemed to be of any avail against it , now that it had finally gained the upper hand . There had been dark times , no doubt , in the old days in [Washington]2-washington ; times when the tragedy of [[her]146-daphne husband]778-her husband 's death had overshadowed [her]146-daphne . But in the intervals , what courage and boldness , what ardour in the declaration of that new Feminist gospel to which [Daphne]146-daphne had in [her]146-daphne own case borne witness ! [Daphne]146-daphne remembered well with what feverish readiness [Madeleine]159-madeleine had accepted [her]159-madeleine own pleas after [her]159-madeleine flight from [England]14-england ; how [she]159-madeleine had defended [her]159-madeleine against hostile criticism , had supported [her]159-madeleine during the divorce court proceedings , and triumphed in [their]2201-their result . “ [You]146-daphne are unhappy ? And [he]778-her husband deceived [you]146-daphne ? Well , then , what more do [you]146-daphne want ? , Free [yourself]146-daphne , [[my]159-madeleine dear]2812-my dear , free [yourself]146-daphne ! What right have [you]146-daphne to bear [more children]3444-more children to [a man who is [a liar and a shuffler]3446-a liar and a shuffler]3445-a man who is a liar and a shuffler ? It is [[our]3447-our generation]3448-our generation that must suffer , for the liberty of [those that come after]3449-those that come after ! ”[159-madeleine] What had changed [her]159-madeleine ? Was it simply the approach of mortal illness , the old questioning of “ what dreams may come ”[159-madeleine] ? Superstition , in fact ? As [a girl]308-a girl [she]159-madeleine had been mystical and devout ; so [Daphne]146-daphne had heard . Or was it the death of [little Beatty]246-daphne , to whom [she]146-daphne was much attached ? [She]146-daphne had seen something of [Roger]121-roger during that intermediate [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia stage , when [he]2203-he and [Beatty]246-daphne were allowed to meet at [[her]146-daphne house]2204-her house ; and [she]146-daphne had once or twice astonished and wounded [Daphne]246-daphne at that time by sudden expressions of pity for [him]2203-he . It was [she]146-daphne who had sent the cable message announcing [the child]2941-the child 's death , wording it as gently as possible , and had wept in sending it . “ As if [I]246-daphne had n't suffered too ! ”[246-daphne] cried [Daphne]246-daphne 's angry thought . And [she]246-daphne turned to look at the beautiful miniature of [Beatty]246-daphne set in pearls that stood upon [her]146-daphne dressing - table . There was something in the recollection of [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's sensibility with regard to [the child]2941-the child — as in that of [her]146-daphne compassion for [the father]329-the father 's suffering — that offended [Daphne]246-daphne . It seemed a reflection upon [herself]146-daphne , [[Beatty]246-daphne 's mother]1663-beatty 's mother , as lacking in softness and natural feeling . On the contrary ! [She]146-daphne had suffered terribly ; but [she]146-daphne had thought it [her]146-daphne duty to bear it with courage , not to let it interfere with the development of [her]146-daphne life . And as for [Roger]121-roger , was it [her]146-daphne fault that [he]329-the father had made it impossible for [her]146-daphne to keep [her]146-daphne promise ? That [she]146-daphne had been forced to separate [Beatty]246-daphne from [him]329-the father ? And if , as [she]146-daphne understood now from [various English correspondents]2209-various english correspondents , it was true that [Roger]121-roger had dropped out of decent society , did it not simply prove that [she]146-daphne had guessed [his]329-the father character aright , and had only saved [herself]146-daphne just in time ? It was as though the sudden presence of [Captain Boyson]140-boyson under the same roof had raised up [a shadowy adversary and accuser]2210-a shadowy adversary and accuser , with whom [she]146-daphne must go on thus arguing , and hotly defending [herself]146-daphne , in a growing excitement . Not that [she]146-daphne would ever stoop to argue with [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson face to face . How could [he]329-the father ever understand the ideals to which [she]146-daphne had devoted [her]146-daphne powers and [her]146-daphne money since the break - up of [her]146-daphne married life ? [He]329-the father could merely estimate what [she]146-daphne had done in the commonest , vulgarest way . Yet who could truthfully charge [her]146-daphne with having obtained [her]146-daphne divorce in order thereby to claim any fresh licence for [herself]146-daphne ? [She]146-daphne looked back now with a cool amazement on that sudden rush of passion which had swept [her]146-daphne into marriage , no less than the jealousy which had led [her]146-daphne to break with [Roger]121-roger . [She]146-daphne was still capable of many kinds of violence ; but not , probably , of the violence of love . The influence of sex and sense upon [her]146-daphne had weakened ; the influence of ambition had increased . As in [many women of Southern race]2211-many women of southern race , the period of hot blood had passed into a period of intrigue and domination . [Her]146-daphne wealth gave [her]146-daphne power , and for that power [she]146-daphne lived . Yes , [she]146-daphne was personally desolate , but [she]146-daphne had stood firm , and [her]146-daphne reward lay in the fact that [she]146-daphne had gathered round [her]146-daphne an army of [dependents]2212-dependents and [followers]2213-followers — [women]299-women especially — to whom [her]146-daphne money and [her]146-daphne brains were indispensable . There on the table lay the plans for [a new Women 's College]2215-a new women 's college , on the broadest and most modern lines , to which [she]146-daphne was soon to devote a large sum of money . The walls should have been up by now but for a quarrel with [[her]146-daphne secretary]2216-her secretary , who had become much too independent , and had had to be peremptorily dismissed at a moment 's notice . But the plan was a noble one , approved by [the highest authorities]2217-the highest authorities ; and [Daphne]246-daphne , looking to posterity , anticipated the recognition that [she]246-daphne [herself]246-daphne might never live to see . For the rest [she]246-daphne had given [herself]246-daphne — with reservations — to the Feminist movement . It was not in [her]246-daphne nature to give [herself]246-daphne wholly to anything ; and [she]246-daphne was instinctively critical of [people who professed fessed to be [[her]246-daphne leaders]2219-her leaders , and programmes to which [she]246-daphne was expected to subscribe . Wholehearted devotion , which , as [she]246-daphne rightly said , meant blind devotion , had never been [her]246-daphne line]2218-people who professed fessed to be her leaders , and programmes to which she was expected to subscribe . wholehearted devotion , which , as she rightly said , meant blind devotion , had never been her line ; and [she]246-daphne had been on one or two occasions offensively outspoken on the subject of [certain leading persons in the movement]2220-certain leading persons in the movement . [She]246-daphne was not , therefore , popular with [[her]246-daphne party]2221-her party , and did not care to be ; [her]246-daphne pride of money held [her]246-daphne apart from the rank and file , [the college girls]2222-the college girls , and [typists]2223-typists , and [journalists who filled [the Feminist meetings]2225-the feminist meetings , and often made [themselves]2226-themselves , in [her]246-daphne eyes , supremely ridiculous , because of what [she]246-daphne considered [their]2226-themselves silly provinciality and lack of knowledge of [the world]319-the world]2224-journalists who filled the feminist meetings , and often made themselves , in her eyes , supremely ridiculous , because of what she considered their silly provinciality and lack of knowledge of the world . Yet , of course , [she]246-daphne was [a “ Feminist”—and]3450-a “ feminist”—and[246-daphne] particularly associated with [those persons in the suffrage camp who stood for broad views on marriage and divorce]2228-those persons in the suffrage camp who stood for broad views on marriage and divorce . [She]246-daphne knew very well that [many other persons in the same camp]2229-many other persons in the same camp held different opinions ; and in public or official gatherings was always nervously — [most people]720-most people thought arrogantly — on the look - out for affronts . Meanwhile , everywhere , or almost everywhere , [her]246-daphne money gave [her]246-daphne power , and [her]246-daphne knowledge of it was always sweet to [her]246-daphne . There was nothing in [the world]319-the world — no cause , no faith — that [she]246-daphne could have accepted “ as [a little child]3451-a little child . ”[246-daphne] But everywhere , in [her]246-daphne own opinion , [she]246-daphne stood for Justice ; justice for [women]299-women as against the old primæval tyranny of [men]556-men ; justice , of course , to [the workman]2234-the workman , and justice to [the rich]2235-the rich . No foolish Socialism , and [no encroaching Trusts]2236-no encroaching trusts ! A lucid common - sense , so it seemed to [her]246-daphne , had been [her]246-daphne cradle - gift . And with regard to Art , how much [she]246-daphne had been able to do ! [She]246-daphne had generously helped the public collections , and [[her]246-daphne own small gallery]2237-her own small gallery , at [the house in [Newport]100-newport]2238-the house in newport , was famous throughout [England]14-england and [America]7-america . That in the course of the preceding year [she]246-daphne had found among the signatures , extracted from [visitors]1293-visitors by [the custodian in charge]2240-the custodian in charge , the name of [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe , had given [her]246-daphne a peculiar satisfaction . [She]246-daphne walked proudly across [the room]743-the room , [her]246-daphne head thrown back , every nerve tense . Let [the ignorant and stupid]2242-the ignorant and stupid blame [her]246-daphne if [they]2242-the ignorant and stupid chose . [She]246-daphne stood absolved . Memory reminded [her]246-daphne , moreover , of a great number of kind and generous things — private things — that [she]246-daphne had done with [her]246-daphne money . If [[men]556-men like [Herbert French]187-french]2244-men like herbert french , or [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson , denounced [her]246-daphne , there were [many persons who felt warmly towards [her]246-daphne — and had cause]2245-many persons who felt warmly towards her — and had cause . As [she]246-daphne thought of [them]2245-many persons who felt warmly towards her — and had cause the tears rose in [her]246-daphne eyes . Of course [she]246-daphne could never make such things public . Outside the fog seemed to be lifting a little . There was a silvery light in [the south - east]2246-the south - east , a gleam and radiance over [the gorge]2141-the gorge . If the moon struggled through , it would be worth while slipping out after dinner to watch its play upon the great spectacle . [She]246-daphne was careful to cherish in [herself]246-daphne an openness to noble impressions and to the high poetry of nature and life . And [she]246-daphne must not allow [herself]246-daphne to be led by [the casual neighbourhood of [the Boysons]268-the boysons]2248-the casual neighbourhood of the boysons into weak or unprofitable thought . [The Boysons]268-the boysons dined at a table , gay with lights and flowers , that should have commanded [the Falls]96-the falls but for the curtain of fog . [Niagara]18-niagara , however , might flout [them]268-the boysons if it pleased ; [they]268-the boysons could do without [Niagara]18-niagara . [They]268-the boysons were delighted that [the hotel]951-the hotel , apparently , contained [no one [they]268-the boysons knew]2250-no one they knew . All [they]268-the boysons wanted was to be together , and alone . But [the bride]2135-the bride was tired by a long day in [the train]468-the train ; [her]2135-the bride smiles began presently to flag , and by nine o'clock [[her]2135-the bride husband]778-her husband had insisted on sending [her]2135-the bride to rest . After escorting [her]2135-the bride [upstairs]505-upstairs [Captain Boyson]140-boyson returned to [the verandah]490-the verandah , which was brightly lit up , in order to read some letters that were still unopened in [his]140-boyson pocket . But before [he]140-boyson began upon [them]2256-them [he]140-boyson was seized once more by the wizardry of the scene . Was that indistinct glimmer in the far distance — that intenser white on white — the eternal cloud of spray that hangs over [the Canadian Fall]2257-the canadian fall ? If so , the fog was indeed yielding , and the full moon behind it would triumph before long . On the other hand , [he]140-boyson could no longer see the lights of [the bridge]3426-the bridge at all ; the rolling vapour choked [the gorge]2141-the gorge , and [the waiter who brought [him]140-boyson [his]140-boyson coffee]2260-the waiter who brought him his coffee drily prophesied that there would not be much change under twenty - four hours . [He]140-boyson fell back upon [his]140-boyson letters , well pleased to see that one among them came from [Herbert French]187-french , with whom [the American officer]392-the american officer had maintained a warm friendship since the day of a certain consultation in [French 's [East - End library]2263-east - end library]2262-french 's east - end library . The letter was primarily one of congratulation , written with all [French]187-french 's charm and sympathy ; but over the last pages of it [Boyson]140-boyson 's face darkened , for they contained a deplorable account of [the man whom [he]140-boyson and [French]187-french had tried to save]2264-the man whom he and french had tried to save . The concluding passage of the letter ran as follows : “ [You]3452-you will scarcely wonder after all this that [we]3453-us see [him]140-boyson very seldom , and that [he]140-boyson no longer gives [us]3453-us [his]140-boyson confidence . Yet both [Elsie]124-french and [I]2265-you feel that [he]140-boyson cares for [us]3453-us as much as ever . And , indeed , [poor fellow]1813-poor fellow , [he]140-boyson [himself]140-boyson remains strangely lovable , in spite of what [one]2809-one must — alas!—believe as to [his]140-boyson ways of life and [the people with whom [he]140-boyson associates]3456-the people with whom he associates . There is in [him]140-boyson , always , something of what [Myers]272-myers called ‘ [the imperishable child]3457-the imperishable child . ’ That [a man who might have been so easily led to good has been so fatally thrust into evil]3458-a man who might have been so easily led to good has been so fatally thrust into evil is one of the abiding sorrows of [my]2265-you life . How can [I]2265-you reproach [him]140-boyson for [his]140-boyson behaviour ? As the law stands , [he]140-boyson can never marry ; [he]140-boyson can never have [legitimate children]3459-legitimate children . Under the wrong [he]140-boyson has suffered , and , no doubt , in consequence of that illness in [New York]1-new york , when [he]140-boyson was badly nursed and cared for — from which , in fact , [he]140-boyson has never wholly recovered — [his]140-boyson will - power and nerve , which were never very strong , have given way ; [he]140-boyson broods upon the past perpetually , and on the loss of [[his]140-boyson child]1355-his child . [[Our]3461-our poor Apollo]3462-our poor apollo , [Boyson]140-boyson , will soon have lost [himself]140-boyson wholly , and there is [no one]2907-no one to help . “[2265-you] Do [you]2265-you ever see or hear anything of [that woman]3073-that woman ? Do [you]2265-you know what has become of [her]3073-that woman ? [I]0-i see [you]2265-you are to have a Conference on [your]2265-you Divorce Laws — that opinion and indignation are rising . For Heaven 's sake , do something ! [I]0-i gather some appalling facts from a recent [Washington]2-washington report . One in twelve of all [your]2265-you marriages dissolved ! [A man]2682-a man or [a woman]793-a woman divorced in [one State]2269-one state , and still bound in another ! The most trivial causes for the break - up of marriage , accepted and acted upon by [corrupt courts]2270-corrupt courts , and reform blocked by [a phalanx of corrupt interests]2271-a phalanx of corrupt interests ! Is it all true ? [An American correspondent of mine]2272-an american correspondent of mine — [a lady]3214-a lady — repeats to [me]0-i what [you]2265-you once said , that it is [the women who bring the majority of the actions]2274-the women who bring the majority of the actions . [She]2272-an american correspondent of mine impresses upon [me]0-i also the remarkable fact that it is apparently only in a minority of cases that [a woman]793-a woman , when [she]793-a woman has got rid of [[her]793-a woman husband]778-her husband , marries [someone else]2902-someone else . It is not passion , therefore , that dictates many of these actions ; no serious cause or feeling , indeed , of any kind ; but rather an ever - spreading restlessness and levity , a readiness to tamper with the very foundations of society , for a whim , a nothing!—in the interests , often , of what [women]299-women call [their]299-women ‘ individuality ’ ! No foolish talk here of being ‘ [members one of another ’]2279-members one of another ’ ! [We]2280-we have outgrown all that . The facilities are always there , and the temptation of [them]2281-them . ‘ [The women — especially — who do these things]2282-the women — especially — who do these things , ’ [she]2272-an american correspondent of mine writes [me]0-i , ‘ are [moral anarchists]2283-moral anarchists . One can appeal to nothing ; [they]2282-the women — especially — who do these things acknowledge nothing . Transformations infinitely far - reaching and profound are going on among [us]2280-we . ’ “ ‘ Appeal to nothing ! ’ And this said of [women]299-women , by [a woman]793-a woman ! It was of [men]556-men that [a Voice]3467-a voice said long ago : ‘ [Moses]273-moses , because of the hardness of [your]273-moses hearts , suffered [you]273-moses to put away [your]273-moses wives’—just such grounds , apparently — trivial and cruel pretexts — as [[your]273-moses American courts]3468-your american courts admit . ‘ But [I]2284-a christian priest say unto [you!—I]3469-you!—i say unto [you]273-moses ! ’ .... “[2284-a christian priest] Well , [I]0-i am [a Christian priest]2284-a christian priest , incapable , of course , of an unbiassed opinion . [[My]0-i correspondent]2285-my correspondent tries to explain the situation a little by pointing out that [[your]2286-your women in [America]7-america]2287-your women in america claim to be [the superiors of [[your]2286-your men]2289-your men]2288-the superiors of your men , to be more intellectual , better - mannered , more refined . Marriage disappoints or disgusts [them]2287-your women in america , and [they]2287-your women in america impatiently put it aside . [They]2287-your women in america break it up , and seem to pay no penalty . But [you]2286-your and [I]0-i believe that [they]2287-your women in america will pay it!—that there are divine avenging forces in the very law [they]2287-your women in america tamper with — and that , as a nation , [you]2286-your must either retrace some of the steps taken , or sink in the scale of life . “ How [I]140-boyson run on ! And all because [my]140-boyson heart is hot within [me]140-boyson for the suffering of [one man]3470-one man , and the hardness of [one woman]3471-one woman ! ”[140-boyson] [Boyson]140-boyson raised [his]140-boyson eyes . As [he]140-boyson did so [he]140-boyson saw dimly through the mist the figure of [a lady]3214-a lady , veiled , and wrapped in a fur cloak , crossing the farther end of [the verandah]490-the verandah . [He]140-boyson half rose from [his]140-boyson seat , with an exclamation . [She]3214-a lady ran down [the steps leading to [the road]1634-the road]2292-the steps leading to the road and disappeared in the fog . [Boyson]140-boyson stood looking after [her]3214-a lady , [his]140-boyson mind in a whirl . [The manager of [the hotel]951-the hotel]2294-the manager of the hotel came hurriedly out of the same door by which [Daphne Floyd]145-daphne had emerged , and spoke to [a waiter on the verandah]2296-a waiter on the verandah , pointing in the direction [she]3214-a lady had taken . [Boyson]140-boyson heard what was said , and came up . A short conversation passed between [him]140-boyson and [the manager]2297-the manager . There was a moment 's pause on [Boyson]140-boyson 's part ; [he]140-boyson still held [French]124-french 's letter in [his]140-boyson hand . At last , thrusting it into [his]140-boyson pocket , [he]140-boyson hurried to the steps whereby [Daphne]145-daphne had left [the hotel]951-the hotel , and pursued [her]145-daphne into the cloud outside . The fog was now rolling back from [the gorge]2141-the gorge , upon [the Falls]96-the falls , blotting out the transient gleams which had seemed to promise a lifting of the veil , leaving nothing around or beneath but [the white and thunderous abyss]2300-the white and thunderous abyss . [DAPHNE]145-daphne 'S purpose in quitting [the hotel]951-the hotel had been to find [her]145-daphne way up [the river]351-the river by [the road which runs along [the gorge on [the Canadian side]2305-the canadian side]2304-the gorge on the canadian side]2303-the road which runs along the gorge on the canadian side , from [the hotel]951-the hotel to [the Canadian Fall]101-the canadian fall . Thick as the fog still was in [the gorge]2141-the gorge [she]145-daphne hoped to find some clearer air beyond it . [She]145-daphne felt oppressed and stifled ; and though [she]145-daphne had told [Madeleine]159-madeleine that [she]145-daphne was going out in search of effects and spectacle , it was in truth [the neighbourhood of [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson]2308-the neighbourhood of alfred boyson which had made [her]145-daphne restless . [The road]1634-the road was lit at intervals by electric lamps , but after a time [she]145-daphne found the passage of [it]1634-the road not particularly easy . Some repairs to [the tramway lines]2310-the tramway lines were going on higher up , and [she]145-daphne narrowly escaped various pitfalls in the shape of trenches and holes in [the roadway]2311-the roadway , very insufficiently marked by feeble lamps . But the stir in [her]145-daphne blood drove [her]145-daphne on ; so did the strangeness of this white darkness , suffused with moonlight , yet , in [this immediate neighbourhood of [the Falls]96-the falls]2312-this immediate neighbourhood of the falls , impenetrable . [She]145-daphne was impatient to get through it ; to breathe an unembarrassed air . The roar at [her]145-daphne left hand grew wilder . [She]145-daphne had reached a point some distance from [the hotel]951-the hotel , close to the jutting corner , once open , now walled and protected , where the traveller approaches nearest to [the edge of [the Canadian Fall]2257-the canadian fall]2314-the edge of the canadian fall . [She]145-daphne knew [the spot]2316-the spot well , and groping for the wall , [she]145-daphne stood breathless and spray - beaten beside [the gulf]2145-the gulf . Only a few yards from [her]145-daphne the vast sheet of water descended . [She]145-daphne could see nothing of it , but the wind of its mighty plunge blew back [her]145-daphne hair , and [her]145-daphne mackintosh cloak was soon dripping with the spray . Once , far away , above [the Falls]2318-the falls , [she]145-daphne seemed to perceive a few dim lights along [the bend of [the river]351-the river]2319-the bend of the river ; perhaps from [one of [the great power - houses that tame to [man]2323-man 's service the spirits of [the water]2324-the water]2322-the great power - houses that tame to man 's service the spirits of the water]2321-one of the great power - houses that tame to man 's service the spirits of the water . Otherwise — nothing ! [She]145-daphne was alone with the perpetual challenge and fascination of [the Falls]96-the falls . As [she]145-daphne stood there [she]145-daphne was seized by a tragic recollection . It was from [this spot]2325-this spot , so [she]145-daphne believed , that [Leopold Verrier]167-leopold verrier had thrown [himself]167-leopold verrier over . [The body]2326-the body had been carried down through [the rapids]2327-the rapids , and recovered , terribly injured , in [the deep eddying pool which [the river]351-the river makes below [them]2330-them]2328-the deep eddying pool which the river makes below them . [He]167-leopold verrier had left no letter or message of any sort behind [him]167-leopold verrier . But the reasons for [his]167-leopold verrier suicide were clearly understood by [a large public , whose main verdict upon it]2331-a large public , whose main verdict upon it was the quiet “ What else could [he]167-leopold verrier do ? ”[2331-a large public , whose main verdict upon it] Here , then , on [this very spot]2332-this very spot , [he]167-leopold verrier had stood before [his]167-leopold verrier leap . [Daphne]145-daphne had heard [him]167-leopold verrier described by [various spectators of the marriage]2333-various spectators of the marriage . [He]167-leopold verrier had been , it seemed , [a man of sensitive temperament]2334-a man of sensitive temperament , who should have been [an artist]2335-an artist and was [a man of business]2336-a man of business ; [a considerable musician]2337-a considerable musician , and something of [a poet]2338-a poet ; proud of [his]167-leopold verrier race and faith and [himself]167-leopold verrier irreproachable , yet perpetually wounded through [[his]167-leopold verrier family]2339-his family , which bore a name of ill - repute in [the New York]2340-the new york business world ; passionately grateful to [[his]167-leopold verrier wife]1168-his wife for having married [him]167-leopold verrier , delighting in [her]1168-his wife beauty and charm , and foolishly , abjectly eager to heap upon [her]1168-his wife and [[their]2342-their child]2343-their child everything that wealth could buy . “ It was [[Madeleine]159-madeleine 's mother]3472-madeleine 's mother who made it hopeless , ”[145-daphne] thought [Daphne]145-daphne . “ But for [Mrs. Fanshaw]274-mrs. fanshaw — it might have lasted . ”[145-daphne] And memory called up [Mrs. Fanshaw]274-mrs. fanshaw , [the beautifully dressed woman of fifty , with [her]274-mrs. fanshaw pride of wealth and family , belonging to [the strictest sect of [New York]1-new york 's social élite]2345-the strictest sect of new york 's social élite]2344-the beautifully dressed woman of fifty , with her pride of wealth and family , belonging to the strictest sect of new york 's social élite , with [her]274-mrs. fanshaw hard , fastidious face , [her]274-mrs. fanshaw formidable elegance and self - possession . How [she]274-mrs. fanshaw had loathed the marriage ! And with what a harpy - like eagerness had [she]274-mrs. fanshaw seized on the first signs of [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's discontent and ennui ; persuaded [her]274-mrs. fanshaw to come [home]2690-home ; prepared the divorce ; poisoned public opinion . It was from a last interview with [Mrs. Fanshaw]274-mrs. fanshaw that [Leopold Verrier]167-leopold verrier had gone straight to [his]167-leopold verrier death . What was it that [she]274-mrs. fanshaw had said to [him]167-leopold verrier ? [Daphne]145-daphne lingered on the question ; haunted , too , by other stray recollections of the dismal story — [the doctor driving by in the early morning who had seen the fall]2347-the doctor driving by in the early morning who had seen the fall ; the discovery of the poor broken body ; [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's blanched stoicism , under the fierce coercion of [[her]159-madeleine mother]2729-her mother ; and that strong , silent , slow - setting tide of public condemnation , which in this instance , at least , had avenged a cruel act . But at this point [Daphne]145-daphne ceased to think about [[her]145-daphne friend]764-her friend . [She]145-daphne found [herself]145-daphne suddenly engaged in a heated self - defence . What comparison could there be between [her]145-daphne case and [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's ? Fiercely [she]145-daphne found [herself]145-daphne going through the list of [Roger]121-roger 's crimes ; [his]167-leopold verrier idleness , treachery and deceit ; [his]167-leopold verrier lack of any high ideals ; [his]167-leopold verrier bad influence on [the child]2941-the child ; [his]167-leopold verrier luxurious self - indulgent habits , the lies [he]167-leopold verrier had told , the insults [he]167-leopold verrier had offered [her]145-daphne . By now the story had grown to a lurid whole in [her]145-daphne imagination , based on a few distorted facts , yet radically and monstrously untrue . Generally , however , when [she]145-daphne dwelt upon it , it had power to soothe any smart of conscience , to harden any yearning of the heart , supposing [she]145-daphne felt any . And by now [she]145-daphne had almost ceased to feel any . But to - night [she]145-daphne was mysteriously shaken and agitated . As [she]145-daphne clung to the wall , which alone separated [her]145-daphne from [the echoing gulf beyond]2351-the echoing gulf beyond , [she]145-daphne could not prevent [herself]145-daphne from thinking of [Roger]121-roger , [Roger]121-roger as [he]167-leopold verrier was when [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson introduced [him]167-leopold verrier to [her]145-daphne , when [they]2352-they first married , and [she]145-daphne had been blissfully happy ; happy in the possession of such [a god - like creature]2353-a god - like creature , in the envy of [other women]2354-other women , in the belief that [he]167-leopold verrier was growing more and more truly attached to [her]145-daphne . [Her]145-daphne thoughts broke abruptly . “ [He]167-leopold verrier married [me]145-daphne for money ! ”[145-daphne] cried the inward voice . Then [she]145-daphne felt [her]145-daphne cheeks tingling as [she]145-daphne remembered [her]145-daphne conversation with [Madeleine]159-madeleine on that very subject — how [she]145-daphne had justified what [she]145-daphne was now judging — how plainly [she]145-daphne had understood and condoned it . “ That was [my]145-daphne inexperience ! Besides , [I]145-daphne knew nothing then of [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe . If [I]145-daphne had — [I]145-daphne should never have done it . ”[145-daphne] [She]145-daphne turned , startled . [Steps]275-steps seemed to be approaching [her]145-daphne , of [someone as yet invisible]2355-someone as yet invisible . [Her]145-daphne nerves were all on edge , and [she]145-daphne felt suddenly frightened . [Strangers of all kinds]2356-strangers of all kinds visit and hang about [Niagara]18-niagara ; [she]145-daphne was quite alone , known to be [the rich Mrs. Floyd]269-mrs. floyd ; if [she]145-daphne were attacked — set upon — The outline of [a man]2682-a man 's form emerged ; [she]145-daphne heard [her]145-daphne name , or rather the name [she]145-daphne had renounced . “ [I]145-daphne saw [you]145-daphne come in this direction , [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger . [I]145-daphne knew [the road]1634-the road was up in some places , and [I]145-daphne thought in this fog [you]145-daphne would allow [me]145-daphne to warn [you]145-daphne that walking was not very safe . ”[145-daphne] The voice was [Captain Boyson]140-boyson 's ; and [they]2358-they were now plain to [each other]346-each other as [they]2358-they stood a couple of yards apart . The fog , however , was at last slightly breaking . There was a gleam over [the nearer water]2360-the nearer water ; not merely the lights , but the span of [the bridge]3426-the bridge had begun to appear . [Daphne]145-daphne composed [herself]145-daphne with an effort . “ [I]145-daphne am greatly obliged to [you]140-boyson , ”[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne said in [her]145-daphne most freezing manner . “ But [I]145-daphne found no difficulty at all in getting through , and the fog is lifting . ”[145-daphne] With a stiff inclination [she]145-daphne turned in the direction of [the hotel]951-the hotel , but [Captain Boyson]140-boyson stood in [her]145-daphne way . About half an hour ago , on [the verandah]490-the verandah , [I]267-boyson opened an English letter which arrived this evening . The news in it gave [me]267-boyson great concern . However , [I]145-daphne am quite willing . ”[145-daphne] The voice was familiar yet strange . There was in it the indefinable hardening and ageing which seemed to [Boyson]267-boyson to have affected the whole personality . What had happened to [her]145-daphne ? [I]2367-he have recovered [my]2367-he American citizenship , and the law of [[my]2367-he country]3023-my country has freed [me]2367-he from a degrading and disastrous marriage ! ”[2367-he] “ While [Roger]121-roger remains bound ? Incapable , at the age of thirty , of marrying again , unless [he]2367-he renounces [[his]2367-he country]2045-his country — permanently debarred from [home]2690-home and [children]2775-children ! ”[2367-he] [His]2367-he pulse ran quick . But that was no reason why [I]586-the man , too , should suffer ! ”[586-the man] “ No reason for patience ? No reason for pity ? ”[586-the man] said [the man]586-the man 's voice , betraying emotion at last . “ [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger , what do [you]121-roger know of [Roger]121-roger 's present state ? ”[586-the man] “ [I]586-the man have no need to know anything . ”[586-the man] “ It matters nothing to [you]121-roger ? What [you]140-boyson say is monstrous ! ”[2372-you] [her]2372-you voice shook . “ In the first place , [I]2372-you freed [myself]2372-you from [a man who married [me]2372-you for money]3495-a man who married me for money . ”[2372-you] “ One moment ! Do [you]2372-you forget that from the day [you]2372-you left [him]140-boyson [Roger]121-roger has never touched a farthing of [your]2372-you money ? No , [Mrs. Barnes!—that]277-mrs. barnes!—that view of [Roger]121-roger does not really convince [you]2372-you , [you]2372-you do not really believe it . ”[2372-you] [She]2372-you smiled bitterly . “ As it happens , in [his]140-boyson letters to [me]2372-you after [I]2372-you left [him]140-boyson , [he]140-boyson amply confessed it . ”[2372-you] “ Because [his]140-boyson wish was to make peace , to throw [himself]140-boyson at [your]2372-you feet . [He]140-boyson accused [himself]140-boyson , more than was just . But [you]2372-you do not really think [him]140-boyson mercenary and greedy , [you]2372-you know that [he]140-boyson was neither ! [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger , [Roger]121-roger is ill and lonely . ”[2372-you] “ [His]140-boyson mode of life accounts for it . ”[2372-you] “ [You]2372-you mean that [he]140-boyson has begun to drink , has fallen into bad company . That may be true . [I]2372-you can not deny it . But consider . [A man from whom everything is torn at one blow]3497-a man from whom everything is torn at one blow ; [a man of not very strong character , not accustomed to endure]3498-a man of not very strong character , not accustomed to endure hardness.—Does it never occur to [you]2372-you that [you]2372-you took a frightful responsibility ? ”[2372-you] “ [I]2373-he protected [myself]2373-he — and [[my]2373-he child]3375-my child . ”[2373-he] [He]2373-he breathed deep . “ Or rather — did [you]2372-you murder a life — that [God]148-god had given [you]2372-you in trust ? ”[2373-he] [He]2373-he paused , and [she]2374-you paused also , as though held by the power of [his]2373-he will . [They]2375-they were passing along [the public garden that borders the road]2376-the public garden that borders the road ; scents of lilac and fresh leaf floated over the damp grass ; the moonlight was growing in strength , and the majesty of [the gorge]2141-the gorge , the roar of the leaping water , all seemed to enter into the moral and human scene , to accent and deepen it . [Daphne]145-daphne suddenly clung to a seat beside the path , dropped into it . “ [Captain Boyson]140-boyson ! [I]145-daphne — [I]145-daphne can not bear this any longer . ”[145-daphne] “ [I]2373-he will not reproach [you]2374-you any more , ”[2373-he] [he]2373-he said , quietly . “ [I]2373-he beg [your]2374-you pardon . The past is irrevocable , but the present is here . [The man who loved [you]2374-you]3500-the man who loved you , [the father of [[your]2374-you child]3502-your child]3501-the father of your child , is alone , ill , poor , in danger of moral ruin , because of what [you]2374-you have done . [I]2373-he ask [you]2374-you to go to [his]2373-he aid . [She]335-his mother is incapable of giving advice or help . ”[145-daphne] “ Of course , [I]145-daphne am sorry . But [Herbert French]187-french — ”[145-daphne] “ [No one]2907-no one but [a wife]1940-a wife could save [him]2373-he — [no one]2907-no one ! ”[2373-he] [he]2373-he repeated with emphasis . “ [I]145-daphne am not [[his]2373-he wife]1168-his wife ! ”[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne insisted faintly . “ [I]145-daphne released [myself]145-daphne by American law . [He]2373-he is nothing to [me]145-daphne . ”[145-daphne] As [she]145-daphne spoke [she]145-daphne leant back against the seat and closed [her]145-daphne eyes . [Boyson]140-boyson saw clearly that excitement and anger had struck down [her]145-daphne nervous power , that [she]145-daphne might faint or go into hysterics . Yet [a man of remarkable courtesy and pitifulness towards [women]299-women]2378-a man of remarkable courtesy and pitifulness towards women was not thereby moved from [his]2378-a man of remarkable courtesy and pitifulness towards women purpose . Only there was something now in [her]145-daphne attitude which recalled [the young Daphne]145-daphne of years ago ; which touched [his]140-boyson heart . [He]140-boyson sat down beside [her]145-daphne . “ Bear with [me]140-boyson , [Mrs. Barnes]121-roger , for a few moments , while [I]140-boyson put it as it appears to another mind . [You]121-roger became first jealous of [Roger]121-roger , for very small reason , then tired of [him]140-boyson . [Your]121-roger marriage no longer satisfied [you]121-roger — [you]121-roger resolved to be quit of it ; so [you]121-roger appealed to laws of which , as [a nation]2706-a nation , [we]2706-a nation are ashamed , which all that is best among [us]2706-a nation will , before long , rebel against and change . [[Our]2706-a nation State system]3509-our state system permits [them]3510-them — [America]7-america suffers . In this case — forgive [me]140-boyson if [I]140-boyson put it once more as it appears to [me]140-boyson — [they]3510-them have been used to strike at [an Englishman who had absolutely no defence , no redress]3511-an englishman who had absolutely no defence , no redress . And now [you]121-roger are free ; [he]3511-an englishman who had absolutely no defence , no redress remains bound — so long , at least , as [you]121-roger form no other tie . Again [I]140-boyson ask [you]121-roger , have [you]121-roger ever let [yourself]121-roger face what it means to [a man of thirty to be cut off from lawful marriage and legitimate children?—Mrs]3512-a man of thirty to be cut off from lawful marriage and legitimate children?—mrs . [Barnes]121-roger ! [you]121-roger know what [a man]2682-a man is , [his]2682-a man strength and [his]2682-a man weakness . [He]3511-an englishman who had absolutely no defence , no redress may not be able”—he[140-boyson] hesitated , then brought the words out firmly—“to forgive [you]121-roger . The force of feeling which impelled [him]2380-he so mastered [her]145-daphne that when [he]2380-he gravely took [her]145-daphne hand [she]145-daphne did not withdraw it . [She]145-daphne had a strange sense of having at last discovered the true self of [the quiet , efficient , unpretending man [she]145-daphne had known for so long and cast so easily aside]2381-the quiet , efficient , unpretending man she had known for so long and cast so easily aside . There was shock and excitement in it , as there is in all trials of strength between [a man]2682-a man and [a woman]793-a woman . [She]145-daphne tried to hate and despise [him]2380-he , but [she]145-daphne could not achieve it . [She]145-daphne longed to answer and crush [him]2380-he , but [her]145-daphne mind was a blank , [her]145-daphne tongue refused its office . [She]145-daphne rose at last painfully from [her]145-daphne seat . “ This conversation must end , ”[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne said brokenly . “ [Captain Boyson]140-boyson , [I]145-daphne appeal to [you]2380-he as [a gentleman]515-a gentleman , let [me]145-daphne go on alone . ”[145-daphne] [He]2380-he looked at [her]145-daphne sadly and stood aside . But this time [he]2380-he felt distress and compunction . “ Forgive [me]2380-he ! ”[2380-he] [he]2380-he said , bending over [her]145-daphne . “ But think of what [I]2380-he have said — [I]2380-he beg of [you]145-daphne ! [They]2386-they had reached [the courtyard of [the hotel]951-the hotel]2387-the courtyard of the hotel . [Daphne]145-daphne withdrew [her]145-daphne hand . When [she]145-daphne reached the steps [she]145-daphne preceded [him]2380-he without looking back , and was soon lost to sight . [Boyson]140-boyson shook [his]140-boyson head , lit a cigar , and spent some time longer pacing up and down [the verandah]490-the verandah . When [he]140-boyson went to [[[his]140-boyson wife]1168-his wife 's room]1693-his wife 's room [he]140-boyson found [her]1168-his wife asleep , a vision of soft youth and charm . [He]140-boyson stood a few moments looking down upon [her]1168-his wife , wondering in [himself]140-boyson at what [he]140-boyson had done . Yet [he]140-boyson knew very well that it was the stirring and deepening of [his]140-boyson whole being produced by love that had impelled [him]140-boyson to do it . Next morning [he]140-boyson told [[his]140-boyson wife]1168-his wife . “ Do [you]1168-his wife suppose [I]140-boyson produced any effect ? ”[140-boyson] [he]140-boyson asked [her]1168-his wife anxiously . “ If [she]1168-his wife really thinks over what [I]140-boyson said , [she]1168-his wife must be touched ! unless [she]1168-his wife 's made of flint . But [she]1168-his wife only said , thoughtfully : “ [You]140-boyson took a great responsibility ! ”[1168-his wife] “ Towards [her]1168-his wife ? ”[1168-his wife] [She]1168-his wife shook [her]1168-his wife head . “ No — towards [him]140-boyson ! ”[1168-his wife] Meanwhile [Daphne]145-daphne was watching beside a death - bed . On [her]145-daphne return from [her]145-daphne walk [she]145-daphne had been met by the news of fresh and grave symptoms in [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne 's case . [A Boston doctor]2394-a boston doctor arrived the following morning . The mortal disease which had attacked [her]145-daphne about a year before this date had entered , so [he]2394-a boston doctor reported , on its last phase . [He]2394-a boston doctor talked of a few days — possibly hours . [The Boysons]268-the boysons departed , having left cards of inquiry and sympathy , of which [Mrs. Floyd]269-mrs. floyd took no notice . Then for [Daphne]146-daphne there followed a nightmare of waiting and pain . [She]146-daphne loved [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine , as far as [she]159-madeleine was capable of love , and [she]146-daphne jealously wished to be all in all to [her]159-madeleine in these last hours . [She]146-daphne would have liked to feel that it was [she]146-daphne who had carried [[her]146-daphne friend]764-her friend through [them]2396-them ; who had nobly sustained [her]146-daphne in the dolorous pass . To have been able to feel this would have been as balm moreover to a piteously wounded self - love , to a smarting and bitter recollection , which would not let [her]146-daphne rest . But in these last days [Madeleine]159-madeleine escaped [her]145-daphne altogether . [A thin - faced priest]2397-a thin - faced priest arrived , the same who had been visiting [the invalid at intervals for a month or two]2398-the invalid at intervals for a month or two . [Mrs. Verrier]146-daphne was received into [the Roman Catholic Church]2399-the roman catholic church ; [she]146-daphne made [her]146-daphne first confession and communion ; [she]146-daphne saw [[her]146-daphne mother]2729-her mother for a short , final interview , and [[her]146-daphne little girl]2401-her little girl ; and the physical energy required for these acts exhausted [her]146-daphne small store . Whenever [Daphne]146-daphne entered [[her]146-daphne room]1664-her room [Madeleine]159-madeleine received [her]146-daphne tenderly ; but [she]146-daphne could speak but little , and [Daphne]146-daphne felt [herself]146-daphne shut out and ignored . What [she]146-daphne said or thought was no longer , it seemed , of any account . [She]146-daphne resented and despised [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's surrender to what [she]146-daphne held to be a decaying superstition ; and [her]146-daphne haughty manner towards [the mild Oratorian whom [she]146-daphne met occasionally on the stairs , or in [the corridor]2404-the corridor]2403-the mild oratorian whom she met occasionally on the stairs , or in the corridor , expressed [her]146-daphne disapproval . But it was impossible to argue with [a dying woman]2405-a dying woman . [She]146-daphne suffered in silence . As [she]146-daphne sat beside [the patient]2186-the patient , in the hours of narcotic sleep when [she]146-daphne relieved [one of [the nurses]2408-the nurses]2407-one of the nurses , [she]146-daphne went often through times of great bitterness . [She]146-daphne could not forgive the attack [Captain Boyson]140-boyson had made upon [her]146-daphne ; yet [she]146-daphne could not forget it . It had so far roused [her]146-daphne moral sense that it led [her]146-daphne to a perpetual brooding over the past , a perpetual re - statement of [her]146-daphne own position . [She]146-daphne was most troubled , often , by certain episodes in the past , of which , [she]146-daphne supposed , [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson knew least ; the corrupt use [she]146-daphne had made of [her]146-daphne money ; [the false witnesses [she]146-daphne had paid for]2409-the false witnesses she had paid for ; the bribes [she]146-daphne had given . At the time it had seemed to [her]146-daphne all part of the campaign , in the day 's work . [She]146-daphne had found [herself]146-daphne in a milieu that demoralised ised [her]146-daphne ; [her]146-daphne mind had become like “ [the dyer]3519-the dyer 's hand , subdued to what it worked in . ”[146-daphne] Now , [she]146-daphne found [herself]146-daphne thinking in a sudden terror , “ If [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson knew so and so ! ”[146-daphne] or , as [she]146-daphne looked down on [Madeleine]159-madeleine 's dying face , “ Could [I]146-daphne even tell [Madeleine]159-madeleine that ? ”[146-daphne] And then would come the dreary thought , “ [I]146-daphne shall never tell [her]159-madeleine anything any more . [She]159-madeleine is lost to [me]146-daphne — even before death . ”[146-daphne] [She]146-daphne tried to avoid thinking of [Roger]121-roger ; but the memory of the scene with [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson did , in truth , bring [him]140-boyson constantly before [her]146-daphne . An inner debate began , from which [she]146-daphne could not escape . [She]146-daphne grew white and ill with it . If [she]146-daphne could have rushed away from it into the full stream of life , have thrown [herself]146-daphne into meetings and discussion , have resumed [her]146-daphne place as [the admired and flattered head of [a particular society]2411-a particular society]2410-the admired and flattered head of a particular society , [she]146-daphne could easily have crushed and silenced the thoughts which tormented [her]146-daphne . But [she]146-daphne was held fast . [She]146-daphne could not desert [Madeleine Verrier]159-madeleine in death ; [she]146-daphne could not wrench [her]146-daphne own hand from this frail hand which clung to it ; even though [Madeleine]159-madeleine had betrayed the common cause , had yielded at last to that moral and spiritual cowardice which — as [all freethinkers]2412-all freethinkers know — has spoiled and clouded so many death - beds . [Daphne]146-daphne — [the skimmer of many books]2413-the skimmer of many books — remembered how [Renan]278-renan — sain et sauf — had sent a challenge to [his]278-renan own end , and , defying the possible weakness of age and sickness , had demanded to be judged by the convictions of life , and not by the terrors of death . [She]146-daphne tried to fortify [her]146-daphne own mind by the recollection . The first days of [June]279-june broke radiantly over [the great gorge]2414-the great gorge and [the woods which surround]2415-the woods which surround [it]2414-the great gorge . One morning , early , between four and five o'clock , [Daphne]146-daphne came in , to find [Madeleine]159-madeleine awake and comparatively at ease . Yet the preceding twenty - four hours had been terrible , and [[her]159-madeleine nurses]2191-her nurses knew that the end could not be far off . [The invalid]2417-the invalid had just asked that [her]159-madeleine couch might be drawn as near to the window as possible , and [she]159-madeleine lay looking towards the dawn , which rose in fresh and windless beauty over [the town]2365-the town opposite and the white splendour of [the Falls]96-the falls . The American Fall was still largely in shadow ; but the light struck on [the fresh green of [Goat Island]103-goat island]2419-the fresh green of goat island and leapt in tongues of fire along [the edge of [the Horseshoe]104-the horseshoe]2420-the edge of the horseshoe , turning [the rapids above [it]104-the horseshoe]2421-the rapids above it to flame and sending shafts into the vast tower of spray that holds the centre of the curve . Nature was all youth , glitter and delight ; summer was rushing on [the gorge]2141-the gorge ; the mingling of wood and water was at its richest and noblest . [Madeleine]159-madeleine turned [her]159-madeleine face towards [the gorge]2141-the gorge , [her]159-madeleine wasted hands clasped on [her]159-madeleine breast . [She]159-madeleine beckoned [Daphne]146-daphne with a smile , and [Daphne]146-daphne knelt down beside [her]159-madeleine . “ [The water]2324-the water ! ”[159-madeleine] said the whispering voice ; “ it was once so terrible . [I]159-madeleine am not afraid — now . ”[159-madeleine] “ No , [darling]2945-darling . Why should [you]2945-darling be ? ”[159-madeleine] “ [I]146-daphne know now , [I]146-daphne shall see [him]3522-him again . ”[146-daphne] [Daphne]146-daphne was silent . “ [I]146-daphne hoped it , but [I]146-daphne could n't be certain . That was so awful . Now — [I]146-daphne am certain . ”[146-daphne] “ Since [you]2945-darling became [a Catholic]3523-a catholic ? ”[146-daphne] [She]146-daphne made a sign of assent . “ [I]146-daphne could n't be uncertain — [I]146-daphne could n't ! ”[146-daphne] [she]146-daphne added with fervour , looking strangely at [Daphne]146-daphne . And [Daphne]146-daphne understood that no voice less positive or self - confident than that of Catholicism , no religion less well provided with tangible rites and practices , could have lifted from the spirit the burden of that remorse which had yet killed the body . A little later [Madeleine]159-madeleine drew [her]146-daphne down again . “ [I]159-madeleine could n't talk , [Daphne]146-daphne — [I]159-madeleine was afraid ; but [I]159-madeleine 've written to [you]146-daphne , just bit by bit , as [I]159-madeleine had strength . Oh , [Daphne]146-daphne — ! ”[159-madeleine] Then voice and strength failed [her]146-daphne . [Her]146-daphne eyes piteously followed [[her]146-daphne friend]764-her friend for a little , and then closed . [She]146-daphne lingered through the day ; and at night , when the June starlight was on [the gorge]2141-the gorge , [she]146-daphne passed away , with the voice of the Falls in [her]146-daphne dying ears . A tragic beauty—“beauty born of murmuring sound”—had[146-daphne] passed into [her]146-daphne face ; and that great plunge of many waters , which had been to [her]146-daphne in life the symbol of anguish and guilt , had become in some mysterious way the comforter of [her]146-daphne pain , [the friend of [her]146-daphne last sleep]2426-the friend of her last sleep . A letter was found for [Daphne]146-daphne in the little box beside [her]146-daphne bed . It ran thus : “ [DAPHNE]146-daphne , [DARLING,—It]280-darling,—it was [I]146-daphne who first taught [you]146-daphne that [we]3524-we may follow [our]3524-we own lawless wills , and that marriage is something [we]3524-we may bend or break as [we]3524-we will . But , oh ! it is not so . Marriage is mysterious and wonderful ; it is the supreme test of [men]556-men and [women]299-women . If [we]3524-we wrong it , and despise it , [we]3524-we mutilate the divine in [ourselves]3524-we . “[146-daphne] Oh , [Daphne]146-daphne ! it is a small thing to say , ‘ Forgive ! ’ Yet it means [the whole world]2427-the whole world . “ And [you]146-daphne can still say it to [the living]3527-the living . It has been [my]146-daphne anguish that [I]146-daphne could only say it to [the dead]3528-the dead . [Daphne]146-daphne , good - bye ! [I]146-daphne have fought a long , long fight , but [God]148-god is [Master]1344-master — [I]146-daphne bless — [I]146-daphne adore — ”[146-daphne] [Daphne]146-daphne sat staring at the letter through a mist of unwilling tears . All its phrases , ideas , preconceptions , were unwelcome , unreal to [her]146-daphne , though [she]146-daphne knew they had been real to [Madeleine]159-madeleine . Yet the compulsion of the dead was upon [her]146-daphne , and of [her]146-daphne scene with [Boyson]140-boyson . What [they]2428-they asked of [her]146-daphne — [Madeleine]159-madeleine and [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson — was of course out of the question ; the mere thought of that humiliating word “ forgiveness ”[2428-they] sent a tingle of passion through [her]146-daphne . But was there no third course?—something which might prove to all [the world]319-the world how full of resource and generosity [a woman]793-a woman may be ? [She]146-daphne pondered through some sleepless hours ; and at last [she]146-daphne saw [her]146-daphne way plain . Within a week [she]146-daphne had left [New York]1-new york for [Europe]23-europe . [THE ship on which [Daphne]146-daphne travelled]2431-the ship on which daphne travelled had covered about half [her]146-daphne course . On a certain June evening [Mrs. Floyd]269-mrs. floyd , walking up and down [the promenade deck]2432-the promenade deck , found [her]269-mrs. floyd attention divided between [two groups of [[her]269-mrs. floyd fellow - travellers]2434-her fellow - travellers]2433-two groups of her fellow - travellers — one taking exercise on [the same deck]2435-the same deck as [herself]269-mrs. floyd ; [the other]314-the other , a family party , on [the steerage deck]2437-the steerage deck , on which [many persons in the first class]2438-many persons in the first class paused to look down with sympathy as [they]2438-many persons in the first class reached the dividing rail aft . [The group on [the promenade deck]2432-the promenade deck]2439-the group on the promenade deck consisted of [a lady]3214-a lady and [gentleman]2442-gentleman , and [a boy of seven]2443-a boy of seven . [The elders]2444-the elders walked rapidly , holding [themselves]2444-the elders stiffly erect , and showing no sign of acquaintance with [anyone on board]2445-anyone on board . [The child]2941-the child dragged [himself]2941-the child wearily along behind [them]2444-the elders , looking sometimes from side to side at [the various people passing by]2447-the various people passing by , with eyes no less furtive than [[his]2941-the child mother]335-his mother 's . [She]335-his mother was [a tall and handsome woman , with extravagantly marine clothes and much false hair]2449-a tall and handsome woman , with extravagantly marine clothes and much false hair . [[Her]335-his mother companion]356-her companion , [a bulky and ill - favoured man]2451-a bulky and ill - favoured man , glanced superciliously at [the ladies in the deck chairs]2452-the ladies in the deck chairs , bestowing always a more attentive scrutiny than usual on [a very pretty girl]2453-a very pretty girl , who was lying reading midway down , with a white lace scarf draped round [her]2453-a very pretty girl beautiful hair and the harmonious oval of [her]2453-a very pretty girl face . [Daphne]146-daphne , watching [him]2451-a bulky and ill - favoured man , remembered that [she]146-daphne had seen [him]2451-a bulky and ill - favoured man speaking to [the girl]396-the girl — who was travelling alone — on one or two occasions . For the rest , [they]2455-they were [a notorious couple]2456-a notorious couple . [The woman]794-the woman had been twice divorced , after misdoings which had richly furnished the newspapers ; [the man]586-the man belonged to [a financial class with which [reputable men of business]2460-reputable men of business associate no more than [they]2460-reputable men of business are obliged]2459-a financial class with which reputable men of business associate no more than they are obliged . [The ship]2461-the ship left [them]2455-they severely alone ; and [they]2455-they retaliated by a manner clearly meant to say that [they]2455-they did n't care a brass farthing for [the ship]2461-the ship . [The group on [the steerage deck]2437-the steerage deck]2463-the group on the steerage deck was of a very different kind . It was made up of [a consumptive wife]2465-a consumptive wife , [a young husband]2466-a young husband and [one or two children]2467-one or two children . There were other mournful cases indeed to be studied on [the steerage deck]2437-the steerage deck , but none in which misfortune was so attractive . As [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother walked up and down , or sat in [the tea - room]2484-the tea - room catching fragments of the conversation round [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother , [Daphne]146-daphne was often secretly angered by the public opinion [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother perceived , favourable in the one case , hostile in the other . [Her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother own version of [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother story was clearly accepted , at least by [the majority]298-the majority ; some showed [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother an unspoken but evident sympathy , while [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother wealth made [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother generally interesting . [Bostonian Pharisees]2488-bostonian pharisees , no doubt!—ignorant of all those great expansions of the female destiny that were going forward . The fact was — [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother admitted it — that [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother was abnormally sensitive . These moral judgments , of different sorts , of which [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother was conscious , floating as it were in the life around [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother , which [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother mind isolated and magnified , found [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother smarting and sore , and would not let [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother be . [Her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother irritable pride was touched at every turn ; [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother hardly knew why . The days passed , however , and as [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother neared [the English shores]2495-the english shores [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother resistance to a pursuing thought became fainter . It was , of course , [Boyson]140-boyson 's astonishing appeal to [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother that had let loose [the Avenging Goddesses]2496-the avenging goddesses .
