After all , [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother was [no monster]2497-no monster . [She]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother had done a monstrous thing in a sudden brutality of egotism ; and a certain crude state of law and opinion had helped [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother to do it , had confused the moral values and falsified [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother conscience . But [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother was not yet brutalised . Its manifestations in [Daphne]146-daphne 's case were slight , but enough . [She]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother was not happy , that certainly was clear . [She]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother did not suppose [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother ever would be happy again . Whatever it was — just , heroic , or the reverse — the action by which [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother had violently changed [her]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother life had not been a success , estimated by results . One night , a night of calm air and [silvery sea]2503-silvery sea , [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother hung over [the ship]2461-the ship 's side , dreaming rather miserably . What was [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother going to do ? And why was [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother making this journey ? [They]2515-they had given a handle to [such harsh critics]2516-such harsh critics as [Alfred Boyson]140-boyson . But [she]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother meant somehow to put [herself]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother right ; and not only [herself]2471-the young and sweet - faced mother , but the great cause of [woman]3244-woman 's freedom and independence . Marriage is merely proclaimed love ; and if love fails , marriage has no further meaning or raison d'être : it comes , or should come , automatically to an end . This is the first article in [the woman]794-the woman 's charter , and without it marriage itself has neither value nor sanctity . [Her]145-daphne eyes avoided [him]2682-a man . “ [Mrs. Fairmile]203-mrs. fairmile ? ”[145-daphne] [she]145-daphne said in a low voice . [You]145-daphne were able to get [your]145-daphne way without it . ”[2623-i] [He]2623-i sank back in [his]2623-i chair again . “ No , [my]2623-i remark had nothing to do with [Chloe]208-chloe . [I]2623-i have never set eyes on [her]208-chloe since [I]2623-i left [you]145-daphne at [Heston]54-heston . [She]208-chloe loves [me]2623-i , [she]208-chloe was awfully good to [me]2623-i , [a regular little brick]3592-a regular little brick . Then [I]2624-he went to say goodbye to [her]208-chloe , and [she]208-chloe , ”[2624-he] [his]2624-he voice shook a little , “ [she]208-chloe took it hard . But it 's all right . [I]2624-he 'm not going to risk [her]208-chloe life , or saddle [her]208-chloe with [a dying man]3595-a dying man . [She]208-chloe 's with [[her]208-chloe sister]3596-her sister . [She]208-chloe 'll get over it . ”[2624-he] [He]2624-he turned [his]2624-he head towards the window , [his]2624-he eyes pursued the white sails on the darkening blue outside . “ It 's been a bad business , but it was n't altogether [my]2624-he fault . [I]2624-he saved [her]208-chloe from [someone else]2902-someone else , and [she]208-chloe saved [me]2624-he , once or twice , from blowing [my]2624-he brains out . ”[2624-he] “ What did [the doctors]3598-the doctors say to [you]2624-he ? ”[145-daphne] asked [Daphne]145-daphne , brusquely , after a pause . “ [They]3598-the doctors gave [me]2624-he about two years , ”[2624-he] [he]2624-he said , indifferently , turning to knock off the end of [his]2624-he cigarette . “ That does n't matter . ”[2624-he] Then , as [his]2624-he eyes caught [her]145-daphne face , a sudden animation sprang into [his]2624-he . [He]2624-he drew [his]2624-he chair nearer to [her]145-daphne and threw away [his]2624-he cigarette . “ Look here , [Daphne]145-daphne , do n't let 's waste time . [We]3599-we shall never see [each other]346-each other again , and there are a number of things [I]2624-he want to know . Tell [me]2624-he everything [you]145-daphne can remember about [Beatty]246-daphne that last six months — and about [her]246-daphne illness , [you]145-daphne understand — never mind repeating what [you]145-daphne told [Boyson]140-boyson , and [he]140-boyson told [me]2624-he . But there 's lots more , there must be . Did [she]246-daphne ever ask for [me]2624-he ? [Boyson]140-boyson said [you]145-daphne could n't remember . But [you]145-daphne must remember ! ”[2624-he] [He]2624-he came closer still , [his]2624-he threatening eyes upon [her]2625-her . And as [he]2624-he did so , the dark presence of ruin and death , of things damning and irrevocable , which had been hovering over [their]2626-their conversation , approached with [him]2624-he — flapped [their]2627-their sombre wings in [Daphne]246-daphne 's face . [She]246-daphne trembled all over . “ Yes , ”[246-daphne] [she]246-daphne said , faintly , “ [she]246-daphne did ask for [you]2624-he . ”[246-daphne] “ Ah ! ”[2624-he] [He]2624-he gave a cry of delight . “ Tell [me]2624-he — tell [me]2624-he at once — everything — from the beginning ! ”[2624-he] And held by [his]2624-he will , [she]246-daphne told [him]2624-he everything — all the piteous story of [the child]2941-the child 's last days — sobbing [herself]246-daphne ; and for the first time making much of [the little one]2629-the little one 's signs of remembering [[her]2629-the little one father]2883-her father , instead of minimising and ignoring [them]2631-them , as [she]246-daphne had done in the talk with [Boyson]140-boyson . It was as though for the first time [she]246-daphne were trying to stanch a wound instead of widening it . [He]2624-he listened eagerly . The two heads — of [the father]329-the father and [mother]2693-mother — drew closer ; [one]2809-one might have thought [them]2635-them [lovers still , united by tender and sacred memories]2636-lovers still , united by tender and sacred memories . But at last [Roger]121-roger drew [himself]2624-he away . [He]2624-he rose to [his]2624-he feet . “ [I]2624-he 'll forgive [you]246-daphne much for that ! ”[2624-he] [he]2624-he said with a long breath . “ Will [you]2624-he write it for [me]2624-he — some day — all [you]2624-he 've told [me]2624-he ? ”[2624-he] [She]246-daphne made a sign of assent . “ Well , now , [you]2624-he must n't stay [here]2658-here any longer . [I]246-daphne suppose [you]2624-he 've got [a carriage]3602-a carriage ? And [we]3603-we must n't meet again . There 's no object in it . But [I]246-daphne 'll remember that [you]2624-he came . ”[246-daphne] [She]246-daphne looked at [him]2624-he . In [her]246-daphne nature the great deeps were breaking up . [She]246-daphne saw [him]2624-he as [she]246-daphne had seen [him]2624-he in [her]246-daphne first youth . And , at last , what [she]246-daphne had done was plain to [her]246-daphne . With a cry [she]246-daphne threw [herself]246-daphne on the floor beside [him]2624-he . [She]246-daphne pressed [his]2624-he hand in [hers]246-daphne . “ [Roger]121-roger , let [me]246-daphne stay ! Let [me]246-daphne nurse [you]2624-he ! ”[246-daphne] [she]246-daphne panted . “ [I]246-daphne did n't understand . Let [me]246-daphne be [[your]2624-he friend]2737-your friend ! Let [me]246-daphne help ! [I]246-daphne implore — [I]246-daphne implore [you]246-daphne ! ”[246-daphne] [He]2624-he hesitated a moment , then [he]2624-he lifted [her]246-daphne to [her]246-daphne feet decidedly , but not unkindly . “ What do [you]246-daphne mean ? ”[2624-he] [he]2624-he said , slowly . “ Do [you]246-daphne mean that [you]246-daphne wish [us]3605-us to be [husband]3606-husband and [wife]1233-wife again ? [You]246-daphne are , of course , [[my]2624-he wife]3224-my wife , in the eye of English law , at this moment . ”[2624-he] “ Let [me]246-daphne try and help [you]2624-he ! ”[246-daphne] [she]246-daphne pleaded again , breaking into bitter tears . “ [I]2624-he didn't — [I]2624-he did n't understand ! ”[2624-he] [He]2624-he shook [his]2624-he head . “ [You]246-daphne ca n't help [me]2624-he . [I]2624-he — [I'm]2624-he afraid [I]2624-he could n't bear it . [We]3609-we must n't meet . It — it 's gone too deep . ”[2624-he] [He]2624-he thrust [his]2624-he hands into [his]2624-he pockets and walked away to the window . [She]246-daphne stood helplessly weeping . When [he]2624-he returned [he]2624-he was quite composed again . “ Do n't cry so , ”[2624-he] [he]2624-he said , calmly . “ It 's done . [We]3609-we ca n't help it . And do n't make [yourself]246-daphne too unhappy about [me]2637-i . [I]2637-i 've had awful times . When [I]2637-i was ill in [New York]1-new york — it was like hell . The pain was devilish , and [I]2637-i was n't used to being alone , and [nobody]2813-nobody caring a damn , and [everybody]2750-everybody believing [me]2637-i [a cad]3612-a cad and [a bully]3613-a bully . But [I]2637-i got over that . It was [Beatty]246-daphne 's death that hit [me]2637-i so hard , and that [I]2637-i was n't there . It 's that , somehow , [I]2637-i ca n't get over — that [you]246-daphne did it — that [you]246-daphne could have had the heart . It would always come between [us]3609-we . No , [we]3609-we 're better apart . But [I]2637-i 'll tell [you]246-daphne something to comfort [you]246-daphne . [I]2637-i 've given up [that girl]3614-that girl , as [I]2637-i 've told [you]246-daphne , and [I]2637-i 've given up drink . [Herbert]187-french wo n't believe it , but [he]187-french 'll find it is so . And [I]2637-i do n't mean to die before [my]2637-i time . [I]2637-i 'm going out to [Switzerland]119-switzerland directly . [I]2637-i 'll do all the correct things . [You]246-daphne see , when [a man]2682-a man knows [he]2682-a man 's going to die — well , ”[2637-i] [he]2637-i turned away , “ [he]2682-a man gets uncommonly curious as to what 's going to come next . ”[2637-i] [He]2637-i walked up and down a few turns . [Daphne]246-daphne watched [him]2637-i . “ [I]246-daphne 'm not pious — [I]246-daphne never was . But after all , [the religious people]3616-the religious people profess to know something about it , and [nobody else]3617-nobody else does . Just supposing it were true ? ”[246-daphne] [He]2637-i stopped short , looking at [her]246-daphne . [She]246-daphne understood perfectly that [he]2637-i had [Beatty]246-daphne in [his]2637-i mind . “ Well , anyhow , [I]2637-i 'm going to live decently for the rest of [my]2637-i time — and die decently . [I]2637-i 'm not going to throw away chances . And do n't trouble [yourself]246-daphne about money . There 's enough left to carry [me]2637-i through . Good - bye , [Daphne]246-daphne ! ”[2637-i] [He]2637-i held out [his]2637-i hand to [her]246-daphne . [She]246-daphne took it , still dumbly weeping . [He]2637-i looked at [her]246-daphne with pity . “ Yes , [I]2637-i know , [you]246-daphne did n't understand what [you]246-daphne were doing . But [you]246-daphne see , [Daphne]246-daphne , marriage is — ”[2637-i] [he]2637-i sought rather painfully for [his]2637-i words , “ it 's a big thing . If it does n't make [us]3618-us , it ruins [us]3618-us ; [I]2637-i did n't marry [you]246-daphne for the best of reasons , but [I]2637-i was very fond of [you]246-daphne — honour bright ! [I]2637-i loved [you]246-daphne in [my]2637-i way , [I]2637-i should have loved [you]246-daphne more and more . [I]2637-i should have been [a decent fellow]3619-a decent fellow if [you]246-daphne 'd stuck to [me]2637-i . [I]2637-i had all sorts of plans ; [you]246-daphne might have taught [me]2637-i anything . [I]2637-i was [a fool]2696-a fool about [Chloe Fairmile]208-chloe , but there was nothing in it , [you]246-daphne know there was n't . And now it 's all rooted up and done with . [Women]299-women like to think such things can be mended , but [they]299-women can't — [they]299-women ca n't , indeed . It would be foolish to try . ”[2637-i] [Daphne]246-daphne sank upon a chair and buried [her]246-daphne face in [her]246-daphne hands . [He]2638-he drew a long and painful breath . “ [I]2638-he 'm afraid [I]2638-he must go , ”[2638-he] [he]2638-he said waveringly . “ [I]2638-he — [I]2638-he ca n't stand this any longer . Good - bye , [Daphne]246-daphne , good - bye . ”[2638-he] [She]246-daphne only sobbed , as though [her]246-daphne life dissolved in grief . [He]2638-he drew near to [her]246-daphne , and as [she]246-daphne wept , hidden from [him]2638-he , [he]2638-he laid [his]2638-he hand a moment on [her]246-daphne shoulder . Then [he]2638-he took up [his]2638-he hat . “ [I]2638-he 'm going now , ”[2638-he] [he]2638-he said in a low voice . “ [I]2638-he sha n't come back till [you]246-daphne have gone . ”[2638-he] [She]246-daphne heard [him]2638-he cross [the room]743-the room , [his]2638-he steps in [the verandah]490-the verandah . Outside , in the summer dark , [a figure]1944-a figure came to meet [him]2638-he . [French]187-french drew [Roger]121-roger 's arm into [his]187-french , and [the two]863-the two walked away . The shadows of [the wooded lane]2643-the wooded lane received [them]863-the two . [A woman]793-a woman came quickly into [the room]743-the room . [Elsie French]124-french looked down upon the sobbing [Daphne]246-daphne , [her]124-french own eyes full of tears , [her]124-french hands clasped . “ Oh , [[you]246-daphne poor thing]3622-you poor thing ! ”[124-french] [she]124-french said , under [her]124-french breath . “ [You]246-daphne poor thing ! ”[124-french] And [she]124-french knelt down beside [her]246-daphne and folded [her]124-french arms round [her]246-daphne . So from the same heart that had felt a passionate pity for [the victim]2646-the victim , compassion flowed out on [the transgressor]2647-the transgressor . For where [others]2683-others feel the tragedy of suffering , the pure in heart realise with an infinitely sharper pain the tragedy of guilt .
